loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia  is 27 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She lives with her boyfriend who has a selling booth. Felecia has a 9-year-old son who is attending school. 

For the past four years, Felecia has been cooking and selling pig feet, chicken and soft bone. She started this business after she graduated from high school. Her current challenge is to keep the business up and running while taking care of her son and attending classes. What she likes about the business is making her own money to support her son and pay her own expenses. 

Felecia has requested a loan to purchase pig feet and chicken to cook and sell. She is continuing her education and in the future she wants to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase pig feet and chicken to cook and sell

loans.name: Karima

texts.en:
Karima is a 53-year-old married woman living in Dahieh with her husband. She doesn't have children, which forces her to work hard and fill her free time with something productive. She started working 31 years ago. She works hard to save as much as she can for her and her husband's old age secure living since, as she mentioned, they have no children to take care of them when they grow older and reach a level where they can't work anymore.

Karima is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to improve her tailoring business by purchasing new thread colors and good quality needles. The loan will also help support her other small businesses, selling foodstuff and detergents. She's willing to increase their capital so that they will increase her income. 

She is a woman with a good reputation, loved by her customers and neighbors. She hopes to expand her business more and to ask for employees to help her.

loans.use: to buy necessary threads and needles for her tailoring business, and to support her foodstuff business and detergents trade

loans.name: Hanan

texts.ar: حنان عمرها 52 سنة متزوحة ولها ولد تعمل في محل لبيع الادوات المنزلية والاكسسوار لها في عملها 7 سنوات تحب عملها وتستطيع من خلاله ان تعيل عائلته زوجها وولدها تريد دائما تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي لها ولعائلتها فهي تسعى الى تكبير عملها وتطويره حتى يصبح باستطاعتها تعليم ابنها بافضل الاماكن هي طموحة محبة للحياة والعمل تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل وتقوية المصلحة وهي تتميز بالمحيط بالانفراد في عملها والتمييز بالبضاعة لها احلام كثيرة تتمنى ان تتحق من خلال تقوية عملها
texts.en: Hanan is 52 years old and married with a son. She works in a shop selling household goods and accessories and has 7 years experience in this. She loves her work. It allows her to support her husband and son and she is constantly seeking ways to improve her family's financial and social situation as well as her own. She aspires to expand and develop her business so that she can support her son's education. Hanan is ambitious and loves life and work. With this loan she wants to purchase new stock for her shop. Her business and stock is unique in her locality and she has many dreams that she hopes to realise through the strengthening of her business.

loans.use: to purchase new stock for her household goods shop.

loans.name: John Memusi

texts.en:
John Memusi is 30 years  old.  He is married and has three children. He has been in the livestock trading business for the last two years.

John was introduced to KADET LTD by KADET staff in his area of residence.  He is applying for his first loan which he plans to use to purchase more animals for sale. He intends to use the returns from this loan to reinvest in his business and to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous businessman in the area and to educate his children to higher levels of education. He an assiduous man despite  his age who struggles to achieve his goals when funded.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a camera

loans.name: Riyad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, married and has one child.

Riyad is a carpenter and has his own shop; he has been selling furniture, pillows and covers since 2007. He has a long experience; he inherited this business from his father. He has an excellent reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting $2400 loan to buy a new machine. He aspires to a better future through good financial returns.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for his work.

loans.name: Karia Ole

texts.en:
Karia Ole S. is 36 years old.  He is married and supports six people. His monthly income is Ksh 10,000. He has been a farmer for the past five years. Wheat farming is doing well in his area due to favorable conditions.

Karia Ole learned about KADET LTD through advertisements done by KADET staff. He has been a good client and repaid his previous loan well.  He has applied for a second loan of KES 80,000 from KADET to buy farm supplies (wheat seeds & fertilizers). 

Karia Ole plans to use the proceed from the loan to plough back into his farm. He has never taken a loan from any other MFI. He is a genuine man who struggles and can achieve his goals if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies (wheat seeds & fertilizers)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to move his business to a better location and buy another shop

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 49 years old and married.  To earn a living, he sells cameras.  He has engaged in the business for nine years.  He runs his business in a very competitive environment; hence, he puts extra effort to attract more customers.  He hopes to expand his business within five years.  He wants 20,000 KES to buy cameras.

loans.use: To buy cameras

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Haja is 23 years old. She lives in the area of Jacob Town, She’s single but unfortunately did not have the means of getting an education. Her fiancée is an auto mechanic and they have a son who is 1 year old.

Haja has been involved in the charcoal business for two years now, but she plans to make her business a very big one. Haja is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, and she hopes that her earnings will increase so that she and her family can be able to live a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Ann Wachuka

texts.en:
Ann Wachuka E. L. is 50 years old. She is married and a mother of five children. She has been a wheat farmer for the past 11 years with a monthly income of KES 13,000.

She learned about KADET LTD through a KADET staff in her place of habitat. She has applied for her third loan which she intends to use to buy wheat seed and fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to large scale and, also to buy a few goats for fattening.

She dreams of educating her children to a higher level of education. She is a thorough woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy wheat seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 27 years old. She lives in the Jacob’s Town Area. She was dropout at seventh grade. She has three children already and her husband's less paid job as a teacher cannot afford them a better living.

Mamie decided to get in the charcoal business so as to generate income for her and her family. To date, she has her own charcoal shop and sells others fruits like pineapple and orange amongst others.

Mamie is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, fruits and even vegetables for her shop. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman who will be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, fruits and vegetables for her shop

loans.name: Joyce Enole

texts.en:
Joyce Enole S. is 27 years old and is married to John S., who is a farmer. She has been a wheat farmer for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 3,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client and she is applying for her first loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase maize seeds and fertilizers. 

She hopes to generate profits from the loan which she would use to expand farming from small-scale to large-scale commercial farming. She hopes in the future, she will live a better live and hopes to see her children realizing their goals through better education.

loans.use: to purchase maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kimererio

texts.en:
Kimererio E. N. is 41 years old. She is married and has four children. She has been farming her own piece of land for the past eight years.

She was first introduced to KADET by one of its local staff members. She has now applied for her third loan, which she intends to use to buy maize seed and fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity. She also intends to buy a few cows for fattening.

She dreams of educating her children to a higher level. She is a thorough lady who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy maize seed, fertilizer and cows to expand a small scale farming operation

loans.name: Sando

texts.en:
Sando is 36 years old and lives in the Jacob's Town area. She has three children between the ages of five and 19, all of whom live with her and her husband. They can only afford to send one of them to school on their current income.

Sando has been operating a small shop for the past eight years selling rice, oil, milk and other items. Sando is requesting a loan to purchase more oil and other items for her shop. In the future, she hopes to operate a mini mart and purchase some land for her family.

loans.use: To purchase oil and other items to increase stock for her shop

loans.name: Arusyak

texts.en:
Arusyak P. is 31 years old and lives in Sevan City with her parents and brother. Arusyak has her own food trading business, which she runs out of her private shop. Her brother helps Arusyak in the business by delivering products to the shop. 

Thanks to her first Kiva loan, Arusyak has organized the household goods trade in her shop, which helps her to increase the number of clients she serves.

Now Arusyak is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy sausages, semi-prepared foods and other items. She also plans to increase the household goods assortment in her shop.

loans.use: To buy sausages, semi-prepared foods and household goods for her shop

loans.name: Kainh

texts.en:
Kainh is 40 years old and married with six children between the ages of 11 and 23. She lives in Jacob’s Town Community. Her husband is currently out of a job and she has only one means of getting income, selling clothing in the local market. She has a lot of customers and she plans to increase her business.

Kainh is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing to sell, and she hopes to purchase a piece of land and build her own house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Mutete

texts.en:
Mutete M. is a 39-year-old married lady and the mother of three school-going children. She has been a wheat farmer for the past five years with a monthly income of approximately $170. 

She is a good client who repays her loans without any obstruction. This will be her third loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase wheat seed and fertilizers. 

She hopes to generate profits from the loan which will be used to expand her farming from small scale to large scale commercial farming. She hopes in future she will live a better life and she also hopes to see her children realize their goals through better education.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, soaps, sardines, biscuits, etc. in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Nahla

texts.ar: نهلة عمرها 47 سنة تعمل في بيع المفروشات المنزلية لها في عملها 5 سنوات تحب عملها وتجيده بشكل جيد متزوجة تعمل بحب ونشاط تريد التطوروالتجدد في العمل تتميز بحبها للعمل والانفراد في المنطقة بهذا العمل لها زبائن من محيطها وجيرانها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل وتقوية المصلحة وايضا مساعدة الاخت في مصاريف العلاج اللازم وذلك من باب مساعدة وتوثيق الروابط الاسرية فهي طيبة ومحبة للخير تسعى دائما الى راحت من حولها وتطوير عملها حتى تساعد من هم بحاجة لها
texts.en: Nahla is 47 years old and married. She sells furniture for a living. She has five years of experience in her line of work. She likes her work and she does it well. She is energetic and thorough in her work, and she stands out in her line of work because of her love for her work, and because hers is the only business of its kind in the area. She has customers from her community and from among her neighbors. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she would like to buy new goods for her store, as well as help pay for the medical care that her sister needs. She is close with her family, and she is a loving and caring person in general who holds charity and good works in high esteem. She is always trying to help those around her, as well as develop her business, and her reason for wanting to develop her business is so that she can better help those around her.

loans.use: to purchase new goods for her furniture store.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is currently in a business of selling charcoal. She is 39 years old, married, and has eight children, five of whom go to school. Hilda borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to pay for her children's schooling with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and five young children who are still attending school. He is the main income source of the family. He has worked as a driver for a locA. company since 2007. His work consists in transporting the employees from their houses to the company and vice versa.  He has obtained two Kiva loans and was a very good client with prompt payments.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay for his children's schooling. His main purpose in life is to ensure a better education for his children.

loans.use: to pay for his children's schooling.

loans.name: Kalamera Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Kalamera” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to seek a loan of 1,400,000.00 SLL. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Rugiatu C.. Rugiatu is age 33. She was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her two children. Her children are attending primary and secondary school. For ten years now, Rugiatu has been selling palm-oil and clothes. With her share of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying palm-oil and clothes in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil and clothes in large quantities

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur  Cheikh D. habite à  Yoff. Il est marié et âgé  de 38 ans. Il a en charge une famille avec  2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 6 ans. Monsieur D. était auparavant un cultivateur. Il a renoncé à cette activité a cause du manque d’espace auquel il était confronté et aussi de  la non rentabilité de son exploitation. Ainsi il s’est orienté vers  le commerce sous l’influence d’un ami agriculteur qui a été le premier à l’approvisionner en oignons lors du démarrage de son activité. Actuellement  son activité concerne l’achat d’oignons au village et d’huile qu’il revend  aux restaurateurs et boutiquiers de la localité de Yoff. Il est sociétaire du guichet de Yoff depuis janvier 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour acheter de l’huile et des oignons pour les besoins de son commerce.
texts.en:
Mr Sheik D. lives in Yoff. 

He is married and 38 years old.

He has a family with 2 children aged  2 and 6 years.
 
Mr D. was a farmer.

He gave up this activity because of the lack of arable land with which he was confronted and also nonprofitability of its operation.

Thus he was directed towards this business by a friend farmer who was the first to supply him onions during his business startup. 

Currently his activity is the purchase of onions at the village and oil which he resells to the restaurants and convenience stores of the locality of Yoff. 

He is member of the credit union of Yoff since January 2011. 

He requests a credit of 300.000 frs destined to buy oil and onions for the needs of his business.

loans.use: achat oignon et huile

loans.name: Saigo Enole

texts.en:
Saigo is 29 years old, married, and the mother of two children who are schooling. She has been in the agriculture industry for the last five years with a monthly income of about $63. 

She has been a good client who repaid her first loan without any impediment. This will be her second loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase farm supplies. 

She hopes to generate profits from the loan which she will use to expand her farm from small scale to commercial. She hopes in future she will live a better life and hopes to see her children live in opulence.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en:
Zeddy J. C. is 29 years old and a skilled and experienced business lady who builds rental houses. She is married to Samwel Cheruiyot. They have two children aged five and two.

Zeddy started her business in 2005 with 10,000 KES startup capital, working in Eldoret town. She has been in this business for the past six years with an income of about $245 per month.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for 53,000 KES from KADET LTD, her 4th loan. She will use the money to buy cement, sand and paints to build more rental houses and make more income.

loans.use: to pay for cement, sand and paints

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq; he is 45 years old, married and has four children.

Saleh has had a shop selling household pots and plastic items since 2000. He is well known in his local area and has an excellent reputation.

 He is requesting a $2400 loan to make more shelves and a sliding door for his shop. He is aiming to develop his work and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To make more shelves and a sliding door for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more firewood and cooking materials to add to her business

loans.name: Donya

texts.ar: دنيا عمرها 24 سنة عزباء تعمل في بيع الهواتف وخطوط التعبئة والاكسسوار للهواتف النقالة لها في عملها سنتين تحب عملها وهي مثابرة وطموحة تسعى الى تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي لها ولعائلتها فهي تساعد العائلة ماديا فهي مثابرة وطموحة تعمل بجد ونشاط تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعةالى شراء بضاعة للمحل وتقوية المصلحة بشراء خطوط تعبئة للهواتف النقالة وكومبيوتر نقال للعمل
texts.en: Donya is 24 years old and single. She works selling mobile phones, mobile phone lines and mobile phone accessories. She has two years of experience in her line of work. She likes her work, and she is dilligent and ambitious in her work. She is trying to improve the financial and social position of both herself and her family, seeing as she is a contributer to her family's income. It is because she wants to help her family that she is so diligent and ambitious in her work, and it is for the same reason that she works very hard. With a loan from al-Majmoua, Donya would like to buy goods for her business, including mobile phone lines and a laptop computer.

loans.use: to purchase goods and supplies for her mobile phone store such as mobile phone lines and a laptop computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase peppers, oranges, bananas, oil and other products

loans.name: Volodya

texts.en:
Volodya H. is 48 years old. He lives in Tsakhkunk village in the area of Sevan with his wife and his son, who is a student. 

For over 20 years, Volodya has been engaged in farming.  He raises cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Also he grows potatoes and wheat, most of which he sells in Hrazdan market. Volodya’s wife helps him in his occupation and thus they keep their family, develop their farm and pay for their son’s education. 

Volodya intends to buy a truck, which will allow him to move his farm animals to mountains, to deliver fodder for his farm animals and to distribute potatoes and wheat to market. Therefore, Volodya asks Kiva lenders for a 1,000,000 AMD loan.

loans.use: to buy a truck

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bales of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children.

In 2000, Firas opened a nursery. He sells seedlings and all kind of trees (seasonal, perennial). He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting $2500 loan to buy a large water pump and to increase sales. He aspires for a better future through good financial returns.

loans.use: To buy a large water pump and to increase sales.

loans.name: Dounya

texts.ar: دنيا تعمل في بيع الهواتف النقالة والاكسسوارات لها في عملها سنتين عزباء تحب عملها وتريد ان تصبح صاحبة محل خاص بها لها طموح كبير في تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي لها ولعائلتها تسعى الى التجدد في العمل والتطور تعاني من منافسة في محيطها العملي فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء اكسسوارات للهواتف وتقوية المصلحة وخطوط تعبئة للهواتف النقالة تتلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة وتسعى الى تحقيق ذاتها ومساعدة اهلها على تطوير نفسهم
texts.en: Dounya is unmarried. She works in a shop selling mobile phones and mobile phone accessories and has been doing this for 2 years. She loves her work and would like to own her own shop. She has a lot of ambition in wanting to improve her financial and social situation as well as her family's. She aspires to modernise and improve her business as she suffers from a lot of competition in her local area. With this loan she wants to purchase new accessories and mobile phone top-ups. She has the full support of her family and hopes to be independent and help them develop and improve.

loans.use: to purchase new mobile phone accessories and top-ups.

loans.name: Matura Ole

texts.en:
Matura Ole M. has been a business man operating a hotel for the last five years. He is 44 years old, married and blessed with five children.

He learned about KADET Ltd from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of abode. This is his first loan which he plans to spend to buy dry foodstuffs for the hotel (e.g. rice, sugar, flour, etc.) He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in the business and part for farming.

Matura’s dreams are to be the best and well-known businessman in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to buy dry food stuffs for the hotel, e.g rice, sugar, flour

loans.name: Mary Wambui

texts.en: Mary, the 65-year-old wife of Simon K. and mother of one, has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 32 years.  Introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, she is requesting her third loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  Mary repaid her previous loans in a timely fashion, and in the future hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Aliou F. est âgé de 24 ans et habite aux parcelles assainies, une localité avoisinante  du village d Yoff dans la banlieue. Il est marié et père  d’un enfant âgé  de 3 ans. Il évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce d’habits  dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Auparavant  il faisait l’activité d’éleveur dans son village d’origine. Il a choisi le commerce par passion. Et le but recherché est la réalisation de bénéfices afin de pouvoir supporter ses charges familiales. Il est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis septembre 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat d’habits  à vendre. Son objectif est de renforcer son fond de roulement, accroitre ses profits et améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr Aliou F. is 24 years old and lives in the Parcelles Assainies, a neighborhood of Dakar near to the village of Yoff in the suburbs.

He is married and father of a 3 year old child. 

He has developed his business for more than 10 years in the clothing trade in weekly markets. 

Previously he was a stock breeder in his village of origin.

 He chose this trade by passion. 

And the sought-after goal is the realization of profits in order to be able to support his family.

 He is member of the credit union of Yoff since September 2010.

 He requests a credit of 100.000 frs envisaged for the purchase of clothes to be sold.

 His objective is to increase his working capital, to increase his profits and to improve the social situation of its family.

loans.use: purchase of clothing for resale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, a 26-year-old resident of Paynesville, attended school and completed seventh grade. She lives with her boyfriend and their seven-year-old child who she is proud to be sending to a local school.

For three-and-a-half years, Lucy has been making and selling donuts, a business that is not as steady as she would like it to be, with periodic losses along with the gains. Lucy, who learned how to prepare donuts from her mother, is requesting a loan to purchase flour, sugar, baking powder and coal. In the future she wants to live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, baking powder and coal

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old Anahit G., who lives in the city of Vanador, has been selling women’s clothes for over 14 years. Purchasing clothes from Yerevan and Turkey, she resells them in the Vanadzor clothes market where she rents a stall. Now requesting her 12th loan for 1.000.000 AMD to buy dresses, skirts and ladies' trousers to resell, she has always made her repayments in a timely fashion.

Anahit lives with her husband and her daughter-in-law, while her son is currently in Russia.

loans.use: to buy dresses, skirts and ladies' trousers to resell

loans.name: Learn To Pay Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Learn To Pay” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mohamed C. is the leader of this group. The 29 year old is married to a driver and they have two children. Mohamed has been a businesswoman for seven years now, she sells sugar, rice, oil, soap, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, oil, soap, etc. in large scale to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bails of shoes to add her stock

loans.name: Charles Ngugi

texts.en:
Charles Ngugi K. has operated a motorcycle business in Naivasha town for the last five years. He is 38 years old and is married to Mary Wambui. They have four children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this will be his third loan. He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to open a retail shop to be run by his wife.

In the future, Charles hopes to buy his own taxi and operate it in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to open a retail shop

loans.name: James Ndungu

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He is 52 years old and is married to Felista Wanjira. They have five children.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, James hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto V. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 60 years old. Ernesto is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Ernesto plants and harvests rice for sale. Ernesto has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest or every five months.

In 2011, Ernesto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Ernesto is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Ernesto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase four bales of shoes to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, a 40-year-old married mother of seven children, all attending school, has a business selling bread and biscuits. She is requesting a loan to stock more bread and biscuits to sell. Rebecca hopes to pay for her children's education and build a concrete house with additional future business profits.

loans.use: to stock more bread and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Ignace

texts.en:
Ignace is 53 years old and is married with three children who are between 15 and 10 years old. He owns a shop selling bananas. He has owned this shop for about five years and the hours of this business are from 6am until 5pm every day. He employs two people to help him.

Ignace has now requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of bananas to sell. He hopes that through those additional goods he will earn more profits and these profits will allow him to keep reinvesting and start saving for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of bananas.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel O. is a farmer in his native town of Kisii in South Rift, Kenya. He is married  with two children aged seven and three years.

He has been doing mixed farming for the last eight years, producing tea, maize and beans and selling them to the Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market. He has two farmhands at his farm. He runs a hotel and a butchery in his local market for additional income.

Daniel has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will provide milk for use in the hotel and help him pay his children's school fees from its additional income. 

In the future, he will be focusing on buying a pick-up to transport his produce to the market.

Daniel says the challenge in farming is a lack of quality dairy breeds and general low produce from the farms. He is full of praise for Juhudi Kilimo for providing agricultural loans to farmers.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two bags of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, trousers, etc., in larger quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more retail goods to sell

loans.name: Veronica Mwikali

texts.en:
Veronica Mwikali K. has operated her salon in Naivasha town for the last three years. She is 38 years old and married to Michael Ndungu. They have four children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by her friend and this will be her third loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more cosmetics and hair products for her salon.

In future, Veronica hopes to grow her beauty shop and be able to handle many clients at once.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for the salon

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime L., from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya, is 51 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jaime has been planting and harvesting rice for sale for over 15 years, earning approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Jaime joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting his first loan of 18000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a 40-year-old married mother of six children ranging in age from eight to adulthood. Only their three youngest live at home with her. Annie didn't have a chance to go to school, and her husband works as a contractor. One of the challenges she faces is balancing her business responsibilities with those involved in being a mother.

For 23 years Annie has been selling food products; she now has a small convenience store that mainly sells food, soft drinks and beer but also several types of candy, soap, shampoo, toothpaste and some cleaning products. Now requesting her second loan with BRAC Liberia, she will use the money to enlarge her store and replace the wooden door with a steel one. In the future, Annie wants to build her own house.

loans.use: to make improvements in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulls and goats

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  G. est une femme  divorcée de 58 ans. Elle a en charge 2 enfants. Elle est commerçante  depuis plus de 10 ans et vend des marchandises diverses. Elle ne compte sur personne pour satisfaire ses besoins personnels, ce qui explique le choix de cette  activité génératrice de revenus.  Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis mai 2002. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs destiné à acheter des tissus, produits de beauté et autres produits divers dans le but de diversifier son activité de vente de glace. Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de payer la scolarité de sa fille et de renforcer son épargne ce qui l’aidera  à gérer les imprévus.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou G., age 58, is divorced and has two children to support. She's been a merchant for more than ten years, and sells various products. She counts on no one else to provide for herself, which explains why she choose this trade.

She's been a member of the Yoff bank since 2002. She's seeking a loan of XOF 150'000 to buy fabrics, beauty products, and other various items, in order to diversify her current business (selling ice). Her profits enable her to pay her daughter's school expenses and bolster her savings, which will help her manage unexpected events.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and beauty products

loans.name: Kebah

texts.en:
Kebah is 39 years old and is married with four children between the ages of five and 18. All of her children live at home with her. Her husband has his own business. For the past eight years, Kebah has been making soap. She has been working to improve her product and her business is growing.

Kebha is requesting a loan to purchase soap-making materials. In the future, she hopes to save money for her children.

loans.use: to purchase soap-making materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail goods to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 33 years old and married with eight children, six of whom go to school. She is currently in the charcoal-selling business. Alice is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. 

In the future, Alice hopes to use her extra profits to pay for her children’s school fees and build a concrete house.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny G. is 34 years old and married with a school-aged child. She is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano,Nueva Vizcaya. To make a living, Leny owns and operates a business raising crops. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Leny has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. 

Leny joined ASKI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Leny plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona F. is currently in a business of selling greens. She is 24 years old and married. She has two children and one goes to school. 

Lona borrowed a loan to stock more greens to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more greens to sell

loans.name: Mary Vic

texts.en:
Mary Vic D. C. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old. Mary Vic is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Mary Vic plants and harvests rice for sale. Mary Vic has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Mary Vic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Mary Vic is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Mary Vic from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand her business by buying a table and 4 chairs

loans.name: C6406 Turwanyubukene Group

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 37 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 5 and 15. Her business is well-organized and sells various sorts of fruit such as pineapples, bananas, passion fruit and so on. She employs one person to help her. She got into this business because it is profitable in her region and she has been successfully running it for four years. Mediatrice is the leader of a group called "Turwanyubukene" in the local language. The group includes seven members (three men and four women).
 
Mediatrice and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more products for their shops so that they can provide better service to their customers. The loan will impact the group members by helping them to purchase larger quantities of stock, which will allow them to earn more profits. With the extra income they earn, Mediatrice and her group hope to save some money and to reinvest in their businesses. Mediatrice hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits such as pineapples, bananas, passion fruit and so on.

loans.name: Nelsy Sofia

texts.es: Nelsy Sofia M. S. es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 12 y 15 años; ella iniciò el negocio de vender mercancias impulsada por la necesidad de generar un ingreso familiar, para apoyar la gestion de su esposo en el hogar, pero sobre todo para atender a su familia y trabajar independientemente,  con tal de ser su propio jefe. Este es el segundo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo y gradualmente sus ganancias, tema en el cual trabaja cuando acude a finanaciamientos. Con su credikiva comprarà chancletas, libretas, sueteres, camisas, hilos, botones, desodorantes y jeans para la venta.  Su sueño es tener otro punto de ventas en un centro comercial, donde logre expandise con mayor facilidad. Su màximo desafio es lograr comprar lo que la gente necesita y le solicita,  porque tiene muy poco capital con relaciòn al aumento de sus clientes. Mientras tanto continua rotando rapidamente sus inventarios para ver la utilidad,  reinvertirla y cubrir sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Nelsy Sofia M. S. is married and has two children aged 12 and 15.  She started her business selling merchandise as she needed to make an income for her family so that she could support her husband in running their household.  Above all, she wanted to be able to look after her family, work independently and be her own boss.

This is Nelsy's second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  By working with the organization, she has managed to increase her working capital and gradually increase her profits.  She will use her Kiva loan to buy thongs (flip flops), notebooks, sweaters, shirts, threads, buttons, deodorants and jeans to sell.  Her dream is to own another sales location in a shopping mall where she will be able to expand more easily.  Her main challenge is being able to buy what people need and are requesting because she has very little capital in relation to the increase in her number of customers.  In the meantime, she continues to experience a rapid turnover of stock, make profits, re-invest them and cover her family expenses.

loans.use: to buy thongs (flip flops), notebooks, sweaters, shirts, threads, buttons, deodorants and jeans to sell

loans.name: C9333 Twubakane Group

texts.en:
Isaac is 31 years old and is married with two children, aged one and three years old. He is the president of the group which is called "Twubakane" in the local language. Isaac is the first person on the left side. He owns a business selling foodstuffs such as sugar, rice, salt, bread, etc. This group contains seven members: three women and four men.

Isaac and his group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their businesses through purchasing more goods. Through this expansion, Isaac and his group will be able to earn more profit, which will allow them to save in the future and to pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like rice, sugar, bread and so on.

loans.name: C2394 Urugero Group

texts.en:
Pascal is 38 years old and is married with four children between the ages 2 and 9 and four dependent relatives. He is the president of a group which is called "Urugero" in the local language. The group is composed of eight people: four men and four women. Pascal is the first person on the left side. He sells bananas, sorghum, maize and so on. This business is well-organized. He works from 6:30am until 4pm every day and he has three years of experience.

Pascal and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more products in larger quantities. With the resulting profit, Pascal and his team will be able to save in the future and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To purchase more products like bananas, sorghum, maize and so on.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Pablo I. tiene 25 años de edad y vive en el barrio el centro de Marcovia Choluteca, Juan es una persona emprendedora y muy dedicado a su negocio propio, que es venta de abarroteria en general, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitacion desde hace 4 años,  su pulperia se encuentra en punto estrategico, la afluencia de personas es muy buena y esto hace que tenga muchos clientes.
Juan es honrado y trabajador.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir su negocio.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y tener una bonita familia.
texts.en: Sr. Juan Pablo I. is 25 years old and lives in the central neighborhood of Marcovia in Choluteca department. Juan is an enterprising person and very dedicated to his business, which is selling groceries out of his house. He has done this for 4 years. His store is in a strategic location, where the people are very well off, so he has many customers. Juan is honorable and hardworking. He will use the loan to purchase groceries to stock his business. His goal is to make his business grow and to have a nice family.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, sugar, butter, margarine, oil, bread, salt, churros, sodas, chicken, sausages, milk, cheese, beef and pork

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Roberto M. llegó a Medellín con la esperanza de comenzar una nueva vida después de la separación con su esposa. Desde el 2010 se ha dedicado a vender controles para el televisor y estuches para estos controles, gracias a un amigo quien le colaboró para tomar este trabajo. Roberto es un vendedor ambulante e independiente, y actualmente necesita capital para comprar mercancía y así permitir que su negocio crezca. Su mayor sueño es poder, algún día comprarse una moto, no sólo por facilidad en sus ventas si no porque así podrá ir a todos los lugares de la ciudad y ofrecer sus productos a muchas mas personas.
texts.en: Roberto M. came to Medellín with the hope of beginning a new life after separating from his wife. Since 2010 he has worked selling television remote controls and protective cases for these remotes, thanks to a friend who helped him get started in this work. Roberto is an independent traveling salesman, and right now he needs capital to buy merchandise, which will allow his business to grow. His greatest dream is to some day be able to buy a motorcycle. Not only would this make his sales easier, but it would also allow him to go all over the city and offer his products to many more people.

loans.use: to purchase television remote controls and cases for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 800 kg of yams and other items

loans.name: Nantenin

texts.fr:
Madame NANTENIN K. est une femme âgée de 46 ans qui vit avec ses 6 enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire à SANANKOROBA, une commune rurale de la préfecture de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro(deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
NANTENIN n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école  pour des raisons familiales, alors très tôt elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’articles divers  tels les habits, les pochettes, les chaussures, les parures etc. 
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, NANTENIN est à son deuxième prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, quelques douzaines d’habits pour enfants et 50 paires de chaussures de différentes sortes, auprès des grossistes du grand marché de BAMAKO. Elle effectue sa vente à la maison, au  marché de KANGABA et en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de SANANKOROBA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Madame NANTENIN K. espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, aider le mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités. 
NANTENIN ambitionne diversifier davantage ses activités et devenir grossiste en habillements et chaussures à SANANKOROBA
texts.en:
Mrs. Nantenin K. is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Sanankoroba with her six children and her husband in a nuclear family. Sanankoroba is a rural village in the prefecture of Kati, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.)

Nantenin’s family situation did not give her the opportunity to attend school. Very early on she got involved in income generating activities such as the purchase and sale of various items, for example; clothing, small purses, shoes, fine accessories etc.

After having fully repaid her first loan, Nantenin is on her second individual loan. She is planning to use it to buy a few dozens sets of children clothing and 50 pairs of different kind of shoes from wholesalers at the Grand Market of Bamako. She sells from her home, at the Kangaba market and door-to-door in the various neighborhoods of Sanankoroba. She retails for cash and on credit to customers who are women and men.

Mrs. Nantenin K. hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25, 000 Francs CFA that she will use to reimburse her loan, help her husband provide for the family’s expenses and reinvest the rest in her activity.
Nantenin’s ambition is to diversify her activity further and become a wholesaler of clothing and shoes in Sanankoroba.

loans.use: to purchase various items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoe making supplies.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un regroupement de 5 femmes ayant en moyenne 47 ans, 6 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à Sélingué, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la préfecture de YANFOLILA (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce du poisson avec MAWA K., la présidente du groupe.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 40kg de poissons. Elle s’approvisionne à la  carrière (un village où existe un marché aux poissons) en gros auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente en gros et en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché de SELINGUE et BAMAKO, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of  five women averaging 47 years of age and six children, who live in traditional families in Sélingué, the main settlement in a rural community in the Yanfolila Prefecture (the third administrative region of Mal0. They are on their seventh collaboration cycle with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. The group members sell fish, which is what Mawa K. does, for example. She is the group’s leader. She plans to use her loan to purchase 40 kg [100 lbs] of fish. She stocks up Carière, a village with a fish market, buying wholesale. She sells wholesale and retail, for cash, and sometimes on credit, at the markets of Selingue and Bamako, to a customer base composed essentially of women.

She expects to achieve an average monthly benefit of 30,000 West African Francs, a part of which will be used to help her husband with everyday household expenses, and the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena se dedica  a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y el crédito lo necesita para  aumentar la mercadería al por mayor, como ser arroz, azúcar, fideos, cereales etc., para mejorar su margen de ganancia y así podrá equipar su tienda con mas productos. Vive  en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Urb. Mercurio de la ciudad de El Alto, es casada  tiene tres  hijos.
texts.en:
María Elena sells basic need items and needs the loan to buy more stock items at wholesale like: rice, sugar, noodles, cereals, etc. to improve her profit margin and stock her store with more products.

She lives in her own house located in El Alto’s Urbanización Mercurio zone.  She’s married and has three children.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Lafiabougou Group

texts.fr:
LAFIABOUGOU est un regroupement de 6 femmes ayant en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à Selingué, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la préfecture de YANFOLILA (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels le poisson avec TATA Y..
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 40 kg de poissons. Elle s’approvisionne à la  carrière, qui est un grand marché  de poissons à Selingué, auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au même marché de Selingué et à domicile, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Lafiabougou is a group of six women averaging 40 years of age, with four children, who live in traditional families in Sélingué, the main settlement in a rural community in the Yanfolila Prefecture (the third administrative region of Mal0. They are on their seventh collaboration cycle with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. The group members sell various articles, such as fish, which is what  Tata Y. does, for example. She plans to use her loan to purchase 40 kg [100 lbs] of fish. She buys her stock from wholesalers at the Carrière fish market of Selingué.   She sells   at the  same Selingué market  and out of her house, to a customer base composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to achieve an average monthly benefit of 40,000 West African Francs, a part of which will be used to help her husband with everyday household expenses, and the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs for his eatery where he serves his customers lunch

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos V. tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el barrio el Centro de Marcovia Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y calzado usado, Carlos es honrado y muy dedicado a su negocio, el cual tiene 4 años de tenerlo, tiene varios clientes de marcovia y de lugares como santa cruz y monjaras tambien distribuye su producto en las meloneras y en las diferentes azucareras de la localidad.
Carlos se levanta todos los dias a las cinco de la mañana para salir a vender su producto y dos dias de la semana los deja para cobrar ya que vende su producto al credito. 
Su esposa se dedica a la elaboracion de refrescos naturales para vender.
juntos trabajan duro para salir adelante con sus hijos.
su meta es crecer poco a poco con su negocio y que le genere ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos V., 39, lives in the El Centro de Marcovia neighborhood in Choluteca.  He sells used clothes and shoes.  He is honest and very dedicated to his business which he’s been doing for 4 years.  He has several customers in Marcovia and in places like Santa Cruz and Monjaras too.  He also sells his product at the local melon packing firms and sugar mills.

Carlos rises daily at 5am to go out to sell and he dedicated two days a week for payment collection since he sells on credit.  

His wife makes natural beverages to sell.  Together they work hard to get ahead with their children.  His goal is to gradually grow with his business so that it will generate profits leading to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes and used shoes.

loans.name: Duo Nohemi Group

texts.es:
DUO NOHEMI

El dúo denominado Nohemí, es integrada  por la señora Rosa Felipa E. R., casada, y madre D. una niña D. 3 años D. edad, y quien se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. consumo diario, en su domicilio desD. hace varios años, es la líder D. este dúo,  quien tiene como sueño y reto agrandar su negocio, poco a poco y apoyar a su esposo quien también es un pequeño empresario  D. carpintería, y como pareja tienen el anhelo D. darle una buen educación a su hija  y prepararla para un futuro mejor esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. productos comestibles D. primera nececidad. También la señora  María  Gregoria G., quien es vendedora D. diversos productos por catalogo, perfumes,  cosméticos, desinfectantes etc. Y también venta D. servilletas D. manera ambulante  ha contribuido en el sostenimiento  y educación D. sus 3 hijos, y sus sueños es que su hija logre culminar el nivel básico este año, lo cual demanda en ella más esmero por el gasto económico,  por lo que ella necesita D. capital para lograr surtir y comprar materia prima para la elavoracion D. cervilletas para su clientela.
texts.en:
NOHEMI DUO

The duo called “Nohemí” is maD. up of Mrs. Rosa Felipa E. R., married and mother of a three year old girl, who has sold groceries from home for several years and is the leader of this duo.  Her dream and challenge is to enlarge her business gradually and help her carpenter husband, who is also a small businessman.  As a couple they hope to proviD. their daughter with a good education and to prepare her for a better future.  She is asking for this loan to buy groceries.

Also, Mrs. María Gregoria G., who sells various catalogue-based products like perfume, cosmetics, disinfectants, etc. and also sells napkins door-to-door.  She has contributed to her three children’s support and education.  Her dream is that her daughter completes elementary school this year which demands more from her because of the costs involved.  She needs a loan to stock up and buy raw materials to make the napkins for her customers.

loans.use: to buy groceries and raw materials.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: La señora Elva se dedica a la comercialización de juegos para niños y vende en los colegios de la ciudad;el crédito lo utilizará para refaccionar parte de su casa (necesita nueva pintura y arreglos interiores); su esposo es rentista jubilado; estas dos actividades son la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos familiares; vive en casa propia ubicada en al zona de Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto, es casada y tiene seis hijos.
texts.en:
Elva sells children’s toys at schools and in the city.  She will use the loan to repair part of her house (it needs new paint and some interior repairs).  Her husband is a pensioned retiree.  These two activities are their sources of income to meet family expenses.  

She lives in her own house located in El Alto’s Río Seco zone.  She’s married and has six children.

loans.use: to buy paint and do some interior home repairs.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es: El señor Fermín es chofer y socio propietario en el sindicato de autotransporte Eduardo Avaroa; su esposa trabaja en una tienda donde vende exclusivamente ropa de bebe. El crédito lo requiere para el arreglo de la caja de velocidades de su auto  para mayor seguridad suya y de los pasajeros, pues últimamente ha estado fallando. Vive en casa en alquiler ubicada en la zona Pasankeri  en la ciudad de La Paz,  es casado y tiene un hijo.
texts.en:
Fermín is a driver and an owner member of the Eduardo Avaroa transportation syndicate; his wife works in a store that sells infant wear exclusively.

He needs the loan to repair his car’s gearbox to have better security both for himself and for his passengers because it’s been failing recently.

He lives in a rented house located in La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.  He’s married and has a son.

loans.use: to repair his car's gearbox.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel R., es una confeccionista que eligiò trabajar en la lìnea de cortina y cubrelechos porque le gusta ver adornado los interiores de los hogares y es una foma de reflejar su delicadeza y buen gusto. Ella iniciò este negocio hace 30 años cuando habia trabajado 15 en la Zona franca de Barranquilla en una empresa de confecciones; su decisiòn estuvo impulsada porque necesitaba manejar su propio tiempo debido a las responsabilidades domèsticas en su familia, especialmente en su hijo de 20 años de edad a quien ha sacado adelante con sus esfuerzo y quien la ha motivado a lograr obtener una vivienda aplicando toda su energia al trabajo y ahorrando para este propòsito. Este es el sexto fiananciamento que Isabel hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con ellos   ha conseguido mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y tambien ha conseguido apoyar el emprendimiento de su hijo en otro negocio. Su maximo desafio fue lograr cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar una vez separada de su esposo, pero ella reconoce que con el tiempo, sus esfuerzos se han visto reflejados en lo que hoy ha logrado con su tenacidad y disciplina. Mientras tanto Isabel sueña con adicionar un local a su vivienda, para separar el espacio productivo del familia y lograr mayor sociego y trabaja para que su utilidades no sean menores de un 24 %  que es el margen que relativamente maneja y que tiene una  tendencia al crecimiento.Isabel en la actualidad aplica a su credikiva con el cual comprarà  remates de telas que le han ofrecido con buenos descuentos y ella lo aprovecharà para aumentar sus utilidades en cada prenda que elabore.
texts.en:
Isabel R. is a seamstress who chose to work in the line of curtains and bed covers because likes to see homes be decorated inside, and it's a way to reflect her delicacy and good taste. She began this business 30 years ago, when she used to work in a sewing business in the French zone of Barranquilla. Her decision was influenced by the fact that she needed to manage her own time due to her familial responsibilities, especially to her 20 year old son who she has helped to get ahead and who has motivated her to buy a home, applying all her energy to work and saving for this purpose. 

This is Isabel's sixth loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With them, she has been able to improve her living conditions and has also gotten help in supporting her son start up another business. Her biggest challenge was to cover all the costs of her home after she separated from her husband, but she realizes that with time her efforts have been reflected in what she has been able to achieve today with her tenacity and discipline.  

Meanwhile, Isabel dreams of adding a store to her home, to separate the work space from the family space and give her more peace.  She also works to manage a profit margin of no less than 24% and to make that grow.  Currently Isabel is applying for a Kiva loan that she will use to buy fabric borders that have been offered at a good discount price, and she will take advantage of it to increase her profits on every garment that she makes.

loans.use: to buy fabric borders at good prices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy waste for recycling

loans.name: Mi Buen Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Mi Buen Jesus esta integrado por cuatro Mujeres que se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo y todas son comerciantes,  a continuacion de detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan: 

Esta es la historia de doña Benita García quien tiene 52 años de edad, no tiene hijos que dependan de ella vive con su esposo el señor Eliodoro Corea, tienen casa propia y aqui es donde tiene su pequeña pulperia en donde vende abarroteria en general y refrescos, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 1 año, el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en su negocio ya que desea ampliarlo para poner mas mercaderia.

La joven Karen Yaqueline A. tiene 21 años de edad, esta soltera y vive con sus dos hermanos en la colonia Morazan de San Lorenzo, Karen se dedica desde hace 18 meses a la venta de cosmeticos en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo, sus mayores clientes son los maestros de las escuelas. vende su producto de contado y al credito.
el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de perfumes y cremas.

la sra. Santos Isabela F. tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, Santos vive en la casa de un familiar en la colonia Buena Vista Sur de San Lorenzo.
Santos Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada clasificada, esta ropa la sale a vender a los pueblos cercanos de San Lorenzo y tiene la ayuda de su hijo varon, sus ventas son de lunes a sabado, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa usada clasificada, le han encargado muchas calsontas y camisetas para ir a bañar a la playa en semana santa.

Y como cuarto integrante del grupo la señora Lidia Yesenia C. L. quien tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos, viven en la colonia residencial Panchita, ahi tiene su negocio que es la venta de golosinas, desayunos y almuerzos.
tiene muchos clientes ya que el sabor de sus comidas es muy exquisito.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de verduras, carnes, frijoles, arroz, manteca, pescado, camarones y todo lo que necesita para prepar sus comidas.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
The 'Mi Buen Jesus' community bank is made up of four women who have known each other for a long time and are all saleswomen.  We will provide details about the different business activities that they carry out here.

Benita García is 52 years old.  She doesn't have any dependent children and lives with her husband Eliodoro Corea.  They own their own home and this is where Benita has her small grocery store where she sells general groceries and soft drinks.  She has had her store for one year and will invest her loan in her business as she would like to expand it so that she can stock more merchandise.

Karen Yaqueline A. is a young woman of 21.  She is single and lives with her two siblings in Morazan residential development, in San Lorenzo.  Karen has been selling cosmetics in the neighborhoods and residential developments of San Lorenzo for 18 months.  Her biggest customers are the teachers in the local schools.  She sells her products for cash and on credit.  She will use her loan to buy perfumes and creams.

Santos Isabela F. is 48 years old.  She is a single mother and has two children.  Santos lives in a family member's home in Buena Vista Sur residential development, in San Lorenzo.  Santos' business is selling used clothing.  She sells her clothing in neighboring villages and has the help of her son.  She makes her sales from Monday to Saturday.  Santos will use her loan to buy used clothes.  She has a lot of orders for shorts and t-shirts for going to the beach during Semana Santa (Holy Week).

The fourth member of the group is Lidia Yesenia C. L. who is 36 years old, married, and has two children.  They live in the Panchita residential development which is where Lidia has her business selling sweets, breakfasts and lunches.  She has a lot of customers as her meals are delicious.  She will use her loan to buy vegetables, meat, beans, rice, butter, fish, shrimp and everything she needs to prepare her meals.  Her goal is to grow her business in order to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to expand her business, used clothes, creams, cosmetics, perfumes, vegetables, meat, beans, rice, sugar, butter, pasta, sauces, milk, cheese, soft cheese, mortadella, chorizo, chicken, fish, shrimp, pork, beef, tortillas, corn flour, wheat flour and eggs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edgar Alexander

texts.es: Edgar tiene una tienda en el Barrio Santo Domingo, al suroccidente de la ciudad e Barranquilla,  donde vende al detalle todos los productos de la canasta familiar; desde que iniciò este negocio siempre pensó en lograr satisfacer las necesidades de alimento de los hogares vecinos, porque antes de su emprendimento  las amas de casa, no tenian como hacerlo de una manera economica, en unidades de medias posibles de comprar y sobre todo que estuviera muy cerca su casa. Su sueño ahora es adicionarle una gran miscelanea, hasta convertirla en un almacen, asi mismo conseguir un sitio para construir un establecimiento donde funcione  su granero. Mientras tanto trabaja diariamente en amplias  jornadas y con un margen de rentabilidad  no menor del 20%, para lograr alcanzar sus metas personales y familiares. Con su credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo,  comprará ranchos, viveres, carnes, bebidas y licores, para surtir su tienda y aumentar su capital de trabajo, pues con esta compra de contado, logrará sostener los precios a sus clientes y obtener unas mejores utilidades en su negocio, lo cual garantiza el éxito de esta inversiòn.
texts.en:
Edgar has a store in the neighborhood of Santo Domingo, in the southwest of the city of Barranquilla, where he sells all of the staple goods. Since he began this business he has always thought about satisfying the food needs of the neighboring homes, because before he began his store the housewives didn't have a place to go and buy things that were affordable, on a small scale and, most importantly, very close to home.

His dream is to add a great selection of things, until he becomes a warehouse. He would also like to get a site to construct a building for a granary. Meanwhile, he works long shifts every day and maintains a profit margin of at least 20% to meet his personal and familial goals. 

With his Kiva loan, which is his first with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, he will buy food, provisions, meat, drinks and liquor to stock his store and increase his business capital. With this cash purchase, he will be able to maintain prices for his customers and get better profits from his business, which guarantees the success of this investment.

loans.use: to buy food, provisions, meat, drinks and liquors

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es:
María Inés forma parte del banco comunal “Lontué I”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Molina. 
Ella se dedica a realizar y vender productos de repostería desde hace 4 años. Todo su quehacer lo realiza desde su casa y vende sus productos al comercio establecido. Específicamente queques y brazos de reina. Durante la temporada de verano se dedica a vender helados artesanales y durante ésta temporada de otoño invierno, venderá comida rápida en un carro.
Su mercadería la compra usualmente en distribuidoras y supermercados mayoristas.  
Con el préstamo comprará insumos para sus productos de repostería y su carro de comida rápida. 
Sus motivaciones son surgir y para esto sus metas son tener un local establecido. Su sueño a nivel personal es tener éste local en su propia casa, debido a problemas de salud, María Inés no puede trabajar en otro lugar. 
María Inés está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que la han impulsado a seguir adelante con su negocio, lo que es una gran motivación para ella. Respecto a las reuniones, éstas son muy amenas y le sirven como distracción en sus ratos libres. El crédito ha sido un apoyo fundamental para su negocio, ya que con éste invertirá en su negocio. Las capacitaciones han sido esenciales para organizar la contabilidad de su negocio. 
Molina es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, ubicada en la región del Maule. Se caracteriza principalmente por ser uno de los grandes polos de la industria vitivinícola chilena. Además de las vides, está la industria frutícola, destacando la producción de manzanas, peras y kiwis.
texts.en:
Maria Ines is a member of the “Lontue 1” communal bank, located in the city of Molina. She has sold confectionery products for 4 years. All her work is done from her house and she sells her products, specifically, cakes and swiss rolls, to commercial establishments. During the summer, Maria Ines sells artisan ice creams, and during the autumn and winter, she sells fast food from a cart. Her merchandise is usually bought by distributors and wholesale supermarkets.

With this loan Maria Ines will buy supplies to make confectionery products and for her fast food cart. Her motivations are to get ahead, and to do so, her goal is to have an established store. Her personal dream is to have this store in her own house, due to her health problems. Maria Ines can't work in any other place. 

Maria Ines is very content and grateful for the help offered through Fondo Esperanza. It has motivated her to forge ahead with her business and is a great motivation for her. With respect to the group meetings, they are very useful and serve as a distraction during her free time. The loans have been a fundamental help for her business, enabling her to invest in her enterprise. The training sessions have been essential in organizing the accounting for her business.

Molina is town in the central zone of Chile, located in the Maule region. It is characterized, principally, as being one of the grand poles of Chile's grape-growing industry. In addition to the vineyards, there is the fruit growing industry, especially the production of apples, pears, and kiwis.

loans.use: TO BUY SUPPLIES FOR HER CONFECTIONERY PRODUCTS AND HER FAST FOOD CART

loans.name: Santos Estela

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Estela A. tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Gonzalo Posadas quien se dedica a compra y venta de dolares en la frontera de El Amatillo, tienen dos hijos.
La señora Santos A. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una de pulperia desde hace varios años, en su pulperia vende queso, pollo, carnes, refrescos ,jabon, azucar, café, leña para la 
Cocina y todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, su negocio lo abre de lunes a domingo.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar abarroteria y asi surtir su pulperia ya que se ha descapitalizado un poco.
para esta epoca de semana santa las ventas son buenas y desea estar preparada para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Santos Estela A. is 42 years old and married to Señor Gonzalo Posadas who works buying and selling dollars in the border town of El Amatillo. They have two children.

Señora Santos A. works selling products for daily use. For several years she has had a grocery store where she sells cheese, chicken, meat, soft drinks, soap, sugar, coffee, firewood for the kitchen, and everything related to the family bread basket. Her business is open from Monday to Sunday. 

She will use the loan to buy more stock and supply the grocery store since the inventory is a bit low at present. During this time of Holy Week sales are good and she wants to be prepared to serve her clients.

loans.use: To buy bathroom tissue, soaps, tooth paste, sanitary napkins, razors, batteries, milk, cereal, lard, oil, salt, beans, bread, fried dough, condiments, soups, spaghetti, eggs, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Grece Lorena

texts.es: Grece Lorena C. es una joven de 22 años, propietaria de la “Miscelanea Grece” que iniciò cuando decidió convertir  el primer dormitorio de su vivienda, en un pequeño almacen de variedades, aprovechando la ubicaciòn de su casa, que se encuentra en un corredor muy concurrido del Municipio de Puerto Colombia, donde vive con su esposo, empleado de una farmacia del municipio  y su hijo menor que hoy tiene 2 años de edad.  Grace iniiciò vendiendo solamente ropa para damas e infantil, pero  gradualmente amplió su surtido agregandole útiles escolares y detalles que solicitaban sus clientes en otros lugares y que le dieron a ella la idea, de ofrecerlos tambien para comodidad de sus compradores y porque le significarian mayores ventas como hasta el momento ha logrado; asi fuè como avanzó y hoy tiene en su surtido ademàs de ropa femenina, la lìnea infantil de vestidos, utiles educativos, accesorios para damas, y articulos de modistería. Con sus credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, comprarà mercancia variada especialmente ropa y accesorios femeninos, pues su meta es surtir su negocio para aprovechar el dia de la madre que se avecina y dirigirà todos sus esfuerzos a aumentar su venta, aprovechando ese mes que es una de las temporadas, que impacta el incremento de sus ventas. Mientras tando continua aumentando sus capital de trabajo y manejando una rotaciòn de inventarios no menor de 25 dias y una rentabilidad promedia de 30%; y aunque su mayor desafio es la competencia la combate con precios y con servicios efectivos, que logra mediante la compra de contado de mercancias y la atenciòn personalizada de sus clientes al mismo tiempo.
texts.en: Grece Lorena C., 22, is the owner of a store called “Miscelanea Grece” that she started when she decided to make her biggest bedroom in her house into a small variety store.  She took advantage of the location of the house on a busy street in Puerto Colombia.  There she lives with her husband who works in a town pharmacy and her son who is 2.  Grece started selling only women and children's clothing but gradually she widened her assortment of merchandise to include school supplies and articles that her customers asked for from other stores and they gave her the idea.  This made it easier for the buyers and because it meant larger sales for her, and she has succeeded.  That is how she got ahead and now she has a selection of  women's clothing, children's clothing, school supplies and articles, women's accessories and sewing supplies.  With her Kiva loan that is her first financing from Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she will buy assorted merchandise, especially women's clothing and accessories, since her goal for the business is to be stocked for Mother's Day that is approaching and this season should mean an increase in sales.  She will also continue increasing her working capital and handling inventory turnover of no less that 25 days and an average profitability of 30%.  And although her biggest problem is competition with prices and services, she succeeds by  purchasing on credit and giving personalized attention to her customers.

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise, especially clothing and accessories for women

loans.name: Solidario Rubi Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO RUBI: 
ESTE GRUPO ESTA FORMADO POR TRES SEÑORAS LAS CUALES SON.
Doña Myrna Leticia, es vendedora de ropa Nueva y Usada.solicita el prestamo para la compra de ropa nueva y usada.
Doña Marta Julia, tiene una carniceria desde hace años.solicita el prestamo para la compra de reses para la venta.
