Doña Juana Nolverta,es vendedora ambulante de electrodomesticos.
Juana Nolverta es la presidenta de este grupo se inicio vendiendo ropa Usada que le enviava su hermana de los departamentos despues vendia comida en su domicilio por las noches y en las mañanas vendia refacciones,con las ganacias compro dos bajias de china de usos domesticos para venderlos al credito y asi ganarle un poco mas a los ocho meses de comerciar vajias pudo comprar 5 mas y asi a podido aumentar su negocio y mantener su negocio y tambien a mantener a sus dos hijas porque es madre soltera.solicita este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en vajillas de china de usos domesticos.
texts.en:
The Ruby Solidarity Group consists of three women. They are as follows:

Doña Myrna Leticia sells new and used clothing. She is requesting a loan to buy additional inventory.

Doña Marta Julia has managed a butcher shop for several years. She is requesting a loan to buy beef to sell.

Doña Juana Noverta sells household appliances as a traveling merchant. She is the group president and started out selling used clothes by traveling with her sister to different departments. Afterwards, she sold food from her home at night. In the mornings, she sold spare parts. With the earnings, she bought two sets of china for household use that she sold on credit. With the little money that she earned, she continued to sell dinnerware for eight months until she was able to buy five more sets. This enabled her to expand and maintain her business, as well as support her two daughters since she is a single mother. Juana is requesting a loan to buy more fine china for household use.

loans.use: To purchase fine dinnerware to sell.

loans.name: Angel Orlando

texts.es: El señor Ángel tiene 31 años se dedica  a manejar su automóvil , con el cual presta servicios de taxi dentro de la cuidad , empezó a trabajar como taxista desde adquirió su unidad de transporte la cual compro con sus ahorros ya que anteriormente trabajaba en auto alquilado y como obrero en construcciones diversas , estos trabajos le permitieron ahorrar lo suficiente para adquirir su taxi esta ganando aproximadamente s/280 nuevos soles semanales, los desafíos que enfrenta es que no tiene el tiempo suficiente para dedicarse a manejar su taxi , ya que apoya a sus padres en una bodega que ellos tienen , su meta en el futuro es adquirir otra unidad de transporte para darla en alquiler y así poder obtener mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia , el dinero será invertido en darle mantenimiento a su unidad de transporte como cambiarle de llantas cambio de aceites entre otros el señor ángel esta muy contento con la ayuda que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Sr. Ángel is 31 years old and drives his own automobile in order to provide taxi services throughout the city. He started working as a taxi driver since acquiring his own vehicle with his savings. Ángel previously rented a car and worked as a construction worker on different projects. This work allowed him to save enough money to buy a taxi. He earns approximately 280 PEN each week. The challenges he faces include not having enough time to maintain his taxi. He has the support of his parents who manage a grocery store. His goal for the future is to acquire another vehicle that he can rent out so that he can generate more income to provide for his family’s welfare.

The funds will be invested in the maintenance of his vehicle, such as replacing the tires and changing the oil. Sr. Ángel is very pleased with the assistance that has been given to him.

loans.use: To replace the tires on his taxi and perform vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: José Nicolás

texts.es: José Nicolás P. O. es un joven de 31 años de edad, que vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos de la edades de 1 a 9 años,  en  el barrio el Carmen de Galapa;  allí tiene su negocio llamado : “Textiles Gedeón”, mediante el cual se dedica a  la fabricación de hamacas, oficio aprendido cuando trabajó como empleado en una industria textil, donde adquirió gran experiencia, para un tiempo después independizarse y comprar maquinarias de segunda;  con sus utilidades José gradualmente ha mejorado su infraestructura, pero requiere aumentar su capital de trabajo para atender nuevos clientes;  su mercado está ubicado en las ciudades de Cartagena y Barraquilla, esta última donde es  más conocido porque allí está ubicado su taller; este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con ella comprará materiales para la fabricación de hamacas que tiene encargadas, inversión que garantiza su éxito porque lo hace sobre pedidos y por su gran experiencia en el manejo de la clientela. Su sueño más adelante es convertirse en un exportador y aumentar cada día  el nivel de vida de su familia, mientras tanto sigue trabajando para ampliar sus ventas y aumentar su margen de rentabilidad que no es menor del 42%
texts.en:
José Nicolás P. O. is a young man who is 31 years of age.  He lives with his wife and three children who are the between the ages of 1 and 9.  They live in the neighborhood of El Carmen in southern Barranquilla.  There he has a business called “Textiles Gedeón” where he manufactures hammocks.  José learned this trade when he worked at a textile factory, a place where he gained a great deal of experience.  After some time José became independent and purchased secondhand equipment with his earnings.  He gradually improved his infrastructure, but he needs to increase his operating capital so that he can attract new customers.  His markets are in the cities of Cartagena and Barranquilla, with the latter being the location of his workshop.  

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He wants to buy materials for manufacturing hammocks that have been ordered.  This investment will guarantee his success because he will be able to complete his orders and create a good experience when managing his customers.  His dream later on is to become an exporter so that he can raise the standard of living for his family.  In the meantime, José is continually working to increase his sales and achieve a profit margin of no less than 42%.

loans.use: To purchase thread and yarn in bulk.

loans.name: Solidario Las Esmeraldas Group

texts.es:
Solidario las Esmeraldas
Este grupo está conformado por tres señoras, Ángela Daniela I. R. de 21 años, Vera Judith P. N.  de 26 años y Eva Judith N. G.,

Ángela es la presidenta del grupo ella vende cosméticos, perfumería y también donas cuatro veces a la semana. Lunes, miércoles, viernes y sábados. Es vendedora ambulante pasa dejando pedidos en diferentes panaderías y a familias particulares,Solicita el credito para la compra de productos de cosmeticos. 

Doña Eva de 47 años tiene dos hijos aun a su cargo, tiene una librería, al inicio era  una tienda con el tiempo se convirtió en librería , ella es viuda tiene dos hijos que aun estudian y desea ampliar su negocio y surtirlo,solicita el credito para lacompra de papeleria y utiles escolares. 

Vera de 26 años tiene 2 hijos uno de ellos estudia, tiene su venta de regalos ubicada en el mercado municipal ella tiene Venta de regalos para toda ocasión es madre soltera y anhela seguir trabajando y tener su propio capital para mantener a sus hijos,solicita el credito para la compra de regalos para toda ocacion.
texts.en:
The Emeralds Solidarity Group

This group consists of three women:   Ángela R. (age 21), Vera P. (age 26), and Eva N..  Ángela is the group president and sells cosmetics and perfumes.  She also sells donuts four times a week:  Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays, and Saturdays.  Ángela works as a traveling merchant, taking orders from different bakeries and private family households.  She is requesting a loan to buy cosmetic products.  

Doña Eva is 47 years old and has two dependent children.  She manages a bookstore.  Eva started her business as a general store but over time she converted it into a bookstore.  She is a widow and has two children who are in school.  Eva wants to expand her business and restock it.  She is requesting a loan to buy stationery and school supplies.

Vera is 26 years old and has two children, one of whom is in school.  She has a gift shop located at the municipal market.  Vera sells gifts for all occasions.  She is a single mother who wants to continue working so that she can have her own capital for supporting her children.  Vera is requesting a loan to buy gifts for all occasions.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata  es socia del Banco Comunal Socos, tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos.
Honorata se dedica la preparación y venta D. comida, se inició hace 7 años, para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos D. la casa y le va bien. Honorata vive en el distrito D. Socos y los sábados y domingos se levanta temprano para viajar a Ayacucho. En el mercado Nery García Zarate, tiene un puesto donD. venD. comidas como: Mondongo, Puca picante, Cau cau, Lomo Saltado, Garbanzo, Pallar.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D.: arroz, fideos, azúcar, entre otros para la preparación D. alimentos. Los demás días D. la semana se dedica a la agricultura siembra cereales.
Le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal, porque pueD. acceder a los créditos y pueD. ahorrar ya que en la casa no se pueD. lo que ahorro en lo ciclos anteriores lo invirtió en su negocio.
Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Honorata is a member of the Communal Bank “Socos”. She is 56 years old, married, and has six children.

Honorata prepares and sells food. She started her business seven years ago so that she could help her husband with the household expenses and is now doing well. Honorata lives in the District of Socos and wakes up early on Saturdays and Sundays so that she can travel to Ayacucho. At the Nery García Zarate Market, she has a stand where she sells food such as tripe stew, “puca picante” (a dish consisting of pork, roasted potatoes, peanuts, and peppers), “cau cau” (beef tripe and potatoes), marinated steak and potatoes, chickpeas, and butter beans.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of rice, noodles, sugar, and other ingredients for preparing her dishes. On the other days of the week, she engages in farm work by growing grains. Honorata enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because she is able to access loans and accumulate savings. Since she already has a home, she did not set asiD. savings in previous cycles so that she could invest in her business. Her dream is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, noodles, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es socia del Banco Comunal Socos, tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. 27, 24, 18 y 11 años. Se dedica a la venta D. cereales. Leonor tiene un molino en el distrito D. Socos, compra cereales, los procesa, lo trae a Ayacucho y lo venD. en el mercado Nery García Zarate, Mercado Chorro, Mercado Playa Grau, entre sus caseras.El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. cereales. 
Le gusta las reuniones del Banco Comunal por el acceso a los créditos, los ahorros y capacitaciones que recibe D. su promotora. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca, que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Leonor is a member of the Communal Bank “Socos”. She is married and has four children (ages 27, 24, 18, and 11). Leonor sells grain and has a mill in the District of Socos. She buys the grain, processes it, and brings it to Ayacucho to sell at the Nery García Zarate Market, the Chorro Market, the Playa Grau Market, and other places. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of grain.

Leonor enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because she has access to loans, savings, and training classes conducted by her loan officer. Her dream is to grow her business so that her children can become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase grain.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol tiene 41años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia. Hace más D. 9 años se ha dedicado al comercio, pero desD. hace 2 años decidió incursionar en L. venta D. animales ovino, es así que adquiere estos animales D. los establos más lejanos D. L. zona rural y lo consigue a un menor precio, al cabo D. un tiempo y luego que los haya alimentado hasta obtener un peso exacto los en L. feria ganadera D. su ciudad. Sin embargo durante los días D. semana se dedica a vender anticuchos (comida típica)  D. manera ambulante, sea en L. esquina D. su casa o también en L. feria D. pelea D. gallos, que se encuentra cerca D. su casa. Su esposo y sus hijas, son las personas que siempre están a su lado y saben que estas dos actividades es su fuente D. ingresos económicos. Durante este tiempo D. trabajo ha visto L. rentabilidad del negocio D. venta D. animales, por ello espera aumentar su capital D. trabajo. Es su crédito número 16 que tiene con MFP,  esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y que su banco comunal  es un grupo unido que ha superado muchos obstáculos, en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual y colaboradora por lo que se ha ganado L. estima D. los demás integrantes D. su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. más ovejas.
texts.en:
Marisol is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has engaged in traD. for more than nine years, but two years ago, she decided to start selling sheep. Marisol acquires these animals from distant stables in rural areas so that she can get a lower price. She feeds the animals over time until they reach the exact weight so that she can sell them later at the livestock fair in the city. On the weekdays, she sells “anticuchos” (a traditional dish of grilled meats) as a street vendor on the corner outsiD. of her house and also at the cockfighting fair that is held near her home. Her husband and daughters are always by her siD. and know that these two businesses are a source of income. During this time, her business of selling animals is profitable so she hopes to increase her operating capital.

This is her sixteenth loan with MFP. Marisol is pleased to know that she has financial support and that her Communal Bank is a close-knit group that has overcome many obstacles. Throughout this time she has demonstrated that she is prompt and helpful. As a result, she has gained the respect of the other members of her group. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more sheep.

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys forma parte del banco comunal “Lontué I”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Molina.
Ella se dedica a vender abarrotes, cecinas, lácteos y un surtido de productos en un local que arrienda desde hace 23 años. Su hermana y sobrina le ayudan en la atención de su negocio. 
Su mercadería la compra usualmente en distribuidoras y supermercados mayoristas.
Con éste préstamo comprará mercadería para su local. 
Debido a problemas de salud que Gladys ha presentado, su negocio no ha prosperado éste último tiempo, ya que las ganancias que ha obtenido, ha debido invertirlas en medicamentos y atenciones de salud. Sin embargo, en la actualidad su situación ha mejorado.
Gladys vive junto a su padre y dos hermanos. Su sueño es tener una vida más confortable, que le permita seguir trabajando. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, debido a las facilidades de pago e inversiones que podrá realizar para su negocio. Las reuniones para ella son un momento de distracción, ya que éstas son muy gratas. 
Molina es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, ubicada en la región del Maule. Se caracteriza principalmente por ser uno de los grandes polos de la industria vitivinícola chilena. Además de las vides, está la industria frutícola, destacando la producción de manzanas, peras y kiwis.
texts.en:
Gladys is part of the Communal Bank “Lontué I” which is in the city of Molina. She has been selling groceries, cured meats, dairy products, and an assortment of other goods from a rented space for the past 23 years. Her sister and niece help her with managing this business. Her merchandise is usually acquired from distributors and wholesale supermarkets. With this loan, she will buy merchandise for her store.

Due to health problems Gladys has faced, her business has not prospered as of late. Her earnings have been spent on medicines and health care. Nonetheless, her current situation has improved.

Gladys lives with her father and two siblings. Her dream is to have a more comfortable life that will allow her to continue working. She is very pleased and grateful for the loan provided by Fondo Esperanza, as well as with the convenient payment options and investments that have been made in her business. The meetings provide a moment of distraction for her since she finds them to be quite pleasant.

Molina is a community in central Chile, located in the region of Maule. It is known for being one of the great centers of the Chilean wine industry. In addition to the vineyards, the fruit industry also produces apples, pears, and kiwis.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Gertrudis

texts.es:
Maria Gertrudis Cañon desde la linda Bogotà, ciudad capital de Colombia , nos dice que  le fue muy bien con su anterior credikiva, porque respondió a todos los encargos que sus clientes habian anotado en su guia especializada de productos; asi mismo adquirió articulos en promocion con las que pudo ofrecer mejores precios a sus compradores y aumentò la rotaciòn de su mercancia.  En la actualidad está estudiando belleza integral y esto es una gran novedad, porque adicionará un ingreso mas,  una vez aprenda y promueva el servicio a domicilio de manicure, pedicure y asesorará a sus clientes respecto a productos que para su imagen requieren y que ella misma puede venderles. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: “Gracias por la oportunidad que me han brindado, por creer en mi y por tener ingresos adicionales para mi familia.” Ahora está aplicando a su segundo credikiva y necesita hacer adecuaciones locativas para su propósito de diversificarse, por eso ha recurrido a este financiamiento.
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Maria igrese al siguiente enlace:
 http://kiva.org/lend/204888
texts.en:
Maria Gertrudis Cañon is from the beautiful city of Bogotà, the capital of Colombia. She says that she did very well with her previous Kiva loan because she was able to fulfill all of the orders her customers placed with her through specialty catalogs. In addition, she purchased sale items so that she could offer them at better prices to her customers and increase her product rotation.

Maria is currently studying cosmetology. This is a big step for her because she will be able to earn more income. Once she learns how to administer manicures and pedicures and begins providing these services from her home, she will be able to advise her customers as to what beauty products they require and then be able to sell them.

Maria has the following message to the Kiva lenders: “Thank you for the opportunity you have given me and for believing in me. As a result, I have extra income for my family.” Now she is applying for her second Kiva loan and needs to make a few adjustments to her purchases so that she can diversify. It is for this reason that she has returned to secure financing. To learn more about Maria’s story, please click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/204888

loans.use: To purchase a variety of merchandise to diversify her inventory.

loans.name: Solidario Betzabe Group

texts.es:
Solidario Betzabe: este grupo esta formado por tres señoras las cuales son, Maria Guadalupe D. 19 años casada y tiene un hijo ella se dedica a su tienda desD. hace tres años ella venD. productos comestibles D. primera nececidad, ella noscuenta que nececita este credito para la compra D. mercaderia en productos comestibles D. primera nececidad  para su tienda ya que tiene mucha demanda D. sus clientes y nececita capital para trabajar y aumentar su ganancia.

Marta B., D. 24 años tiene un hijo y se dedica a la venta D. granizadas y frutas tambien venD. tamales en el merado D. su comunidad desD. hace 4 años,ella solicita el credito para la compra D. especies para elavorar tamales ya que por lo mismo nececita capital para trabajar ya que en los ultimos dias a tenido mucha demanda D. sus clientes.

Margarita C. S., D. 42 años ella tiene 6 hijos y es casada se dedica a la siembra D. tomate y chile pimiento junta mente con su esposo desD. hace mas D. 20 años nos cuenta que nececita mucho cuidado con la siembra y el abono ella ayuda a su esposo con la siembra y cuando hay cosecha ella venD. el tomate y el chle por cajas en el mercado nos cuenta que nececita este credito porque nececita comprar mas semillas para almacenar porque a veses se escasea y es cuando no pueden sembrar y tambien para comprar abono para abonar la siembra para que desarrolle bien.
texts.en:
Betzabe Solidarity Group

This group consists of the following three women:

Maria Guadalupe is 19 years old, married, and has one child.  For the past three years, she has been managing a store where she sells basic food products.  She says that she needs a loan to buy merchandise for her store because there is great demand from her customers.  Maria needs capital in order to work and increase her earnings.  

Marta B. is 24 years old and has one child.  She sells snow cones and fruits, but she also has been offering tamales at the market in her community for four years.  Marta is requesting a loan to buy spices for flavoring the tamales.  She is also in need of operating capital because she has recently experienced more demand from her customers.

Margarita C. S. is 42 years old, married, and has six children.  She and her husband have been growing tomatoes and chili peppers for more than 20 years.  Margarita says that these crops require a great amount of attention and compost.  She helps her husband with growing these crops.  Once the tomatoes and chili peppers are harvested, she sells them by the case at the market.  She says she needs this loan to buy more seeds to store for moments when seeds are scarce and she is not able to buy them.  Margarita will also buy compost to fertilize her crops so that they will develop well.

loans.use: To purchase food products and spices for tamales.

loans.name: Marleth

texts.es: Marleth Rodríguez  vive en el suroccidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla y allí mismo está ubicado  su propio negocio; ella es una mujer viuda que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 11 a 17 años, con los que sueña ver convertidos en unos profesionales de mucho éxito y que son su inspiración diaria en el trabajo. Desde el año 1998 inició su negocio con un crédito que le hicieron a su esposo y desde ese momento no se ha detenido; ella vende ropa femenina para damas  principalmente y en menos proporción  ropa infantil y masculina, la cual distribuye mediante pedidos entre sus clientes, otorgándole un crédito moderado para que puedan acceder a artículos que de contado posiblemente no estarían a su alcance.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva que el cuarto financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual realizará mejoramiento de las condiciones habitacionales: empañete, adecuaciones del cuarto de baño y de la cocina. Con su anterior financiamiento logró surtir su negocio con  mercancías nuevas, lo  cual  se constituyó en un ligero aumento en el ingreso familiar. Su sueño es dirigir su negocio a la venta de papelería en un punto comercial donde pueda ubicarse como un gran almacén. Su desafío  más importante es el pequeño capital de trabajo que en la actualidad maneja,  y que muchas veces no alcanza para responder oportunamente a sus clientes. Mientras tanto Marleth continua trabajando con una rentabilidad neta  promedia  de un 12% para lograr multiplicarlo.
texts.en: Marleth Rodríguez  lives in the suburbs of the city of Barranquilla and her business is located in the same area.  She is a widowed woman that has 3 children of the ages from 11 to 17 years, which she hopes to see become successful professionals and who are her daily inspiration in her work.  Since the year 1998 when she started her business with a loan that her husband took out, she has not stopped for a moment.  She sells clothing for ladies chiefly and, in a smaller proportion, clothes for men and children, which she distributes by means of orders from among her clients.  She offers them a moderate credit so they can agree to buy articles that would not possibly be within their reach with cash.  Currently she is applying for her fourth loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will carry out improvements of her housing conditions: steaming and adapting the bathroom and kitchen.  With her previous loan she managed to supply her business with new merchandise, which has resulted in a slight increase in the family income.  Her dream is to manage a stationary business in a commercial location where it would be seen as a great store.  Her most  important challenge is the small amount of working capital that she currently handles, and that many times she does not have enough to respond opportunely to her clients.  In the meantime Marleth continues working to multiply her average net profit margin of 12%.

loans.use: to improve her housing conditions: specifically the bathroom and kitchen

loans.name: Sarwari's Group

texts.en:
Sarwari belongs to Jaranwala which is a small city located in Punjab province, Pakistan. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 20 years. She is 37 years old, married to M. A. and has six children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 

M. A. does a private job. After his day job, he operates a fruit selling business. He is a very hard-working person and got a good reputation among his clients for the good quality of his fruit and services. 

Sarwari has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s fruit selling business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell.  He has been operating this business for the past 20 years and Sarwari is hopeful that an investment will be a good step towards the positive growth of his business. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application with Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sarwari.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit for fruit selling business.

loans.name: Luz Angela

texts.es: Luz Ángela C. D. F., es una mujer viuda, madre D. 3 hijos en las edades D. 25 a 30 años,  dedicada a la comercialización D. mercancía mediante guías especializadas D. productos, actividad que inició desD. el año 2007, cuando su hijo le prestó dinero para hacerlo y comenzó vendiendo cosméticos que compraba a través D. revistas y también donD. encontraba descuentos. Este es el segundo financiamiento que recibe D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará calzado, ropa femenina aprovechando que se acerca el día D. las madre y tiene mercancías encargadas,  para que las familias hagan su respectivo obsequio. Su sueño es tener una confección donD. ella misma pueda diseñar y confeccionar su propia ropa, pero su gran desafío es mejorar las condiciones físicas D. su vivienda para este propósito. Mientras tanto Luz Ángela continua esforzándose todos los días por conseguir aumentar sus ingresos  y trabajando con una rentabilidad promedia no menor del 15 %, con una proyección D. incrementarla.
texts.en: Luz Ángela C. D. F. is a widowed woman and the mother of 3 children age 25 to 30 years.  She is dedicated to the sale of merchandise by means of specialized product guides, an activity that she started in the year 2007, when her son lent her money to do it.  She began selling cosmetics that she bought from magazines and also where she found discounts.  This is her second loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy footwear and women's clothes, taking advantage of the fact that mothers day approaches and ensuring that she has merchandise in stock, so that the families can purchase their respective gifts.  Her dream is to have a workshop where she can design and make her own clothing, but her greatest challenge is to improve the physical conditions of her dwelling for this purpose.  In the meantime Luz Ángela continues to endeavor every day to manage to enlarge her income, working with an average profit margin of no less than 15%, with a projection of increasing it.

loans.use: to buy footwear and women's clothing.

loans.name: Esteban Proto Miranda Suescun

texts.es:
Esteban lleva 30 años trabajando día a día como vendedor ambulante desde las 6:00a.m. Hasta las 6:00p.m. A pesar de ser un vendedor ambulante desde hace 3 años se radico en un mismo sector donde sus productos se venden con muy buenos resultados, él vende legumbres de cosecha por lo cual hay temporadas donde los resultados no llegan sus expectativas.
 
Se siente orgulloso y contento por ser independiente, aunque a veces no cuenta con el capital para comprar mercancía, ya que periódicamente don Esteban debe surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Esteban has worked day by day for 30 years as a traveling salesman from 6:00a.m.  to  6:00p.m.  In spite of being a traveling salesman, he has been located in the same sector for 3 years, where his products are sold with very good results.  He sells vegetable crops for which there are seasons when the results do not reach his expectations.  

He feels proud and happy at being independent, although at times he can not rely on having the capital to buy merchandise, since periodically Don Esteban must re-supply his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his fruit and vegetable business

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
Desde Hace 15 años Martha luz trabaja vendiendo productos de revista y ropa con ayuda de una sobrina y una amiga, labor que su madre le enseñó desde muy pequeña, Martha tiene 3 hijos y se siente una mujer afortunada por tener un trabajo que le permite estar junto a ellos acompañándolos en todos los momentos que deben vivir en su proceso de crecimiento, le gusta estar en su hogar y hacerse cargo de él. Sin embargo ella desde las 10:00am sale a ofrecer sus productos hasta las 5:00pm y aunque no tiene que cumplir un horario le gusta tener disciplina en su trabajo.
Martha es una mujer muy emprendedora y actualmente necesita invertir capital para comprar más mercancía tanto de los catálogos como la ropa que suele venderle a sus clientes, pero en este momento no posee el capital necesario que hará que su negocio sea mas prospero y prometedor.
texts.en:
For 15 years Martha Luz has worked selling products from magazines and clothing, with the help of a niece and a friend. Her mother taught her this work from a very young age. Martha has 3 children and feels like a lucky woman because she has a job that allows her to be together with them throughout all of the moments as they grow up. She likes to be in her home and to take care of it. Nevertheless, from 10am to 5pm she leaves to offer her products, and even though she doesn't have to keep a certain schedule she likes to have discipline in her work. 

Martha is a very enterprising woman and currently she needs to invest capital in the purchase of more merchandise both from catalogs and the clothing that she usually sells to her clients. She doesn't have the capital that she needs to make her business more prosperous and promising.

loans.use: to supply catalog merchandise and clothing

loans.name: Luz Marina De Fátima

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una mujer luchadora que desde hace 19 años conoce el significado de trabajar en las calles, pues la falta de oportunidades la obligaron a conocer la ley del rebusque, que se ha convertido en su fuente de sustento. Es así como esta emprendedora es vendedora ambulante de productos de legumbrería, especialmente del tradicional aguacate. 
 
Sus jornadas laborales son largas, desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde, Luz Marina ofrece sus productos a los transeúntes y tiene que soportar las inclemencias del clima, pues como ella misma lo afirma el invierno no es bueno para su negocio. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para surtir su negocio,  porque en ocasiones no le alcanza para comprar buena mercancía y así aumentar ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a hardworking woman who for 19 years has known what it's like to work in the streets, since the lack of opportunities have forced her to learn the law of gathering, which has become her source of sustenance. She is enterprising this way and is a mobile saleswoman of legume products, especially the traditional avocado. 

Her work shifts are long, from 6am to 6pm. Luz Marina offers her products to passersby and has to deal with inclement weather. She tells us herself that winter is not good for business. Currently she needs a loan to stock her business, because on occasion she is not able to buy good merchandise and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to stock her legume store

loans.name: Lucila Del Socorro

texts.es:
Hace 10 años Lucila es una trabajadora independiente que confecciona todo tipo de prendas de vestir, labor que aprendió en una empresa donde fue empleada durante 14 años pero desafortunadamente por un recorte de personal, Lucila tuvo que emprender un nuevo reto.

Actualmente ella trabaja en su taller para sacar a sus 2 hijos adelante, quincenalmente le envían 300 prendas para terminarlas, lo que le ocupa la mayor parte de su tiempo. Lucila necesita comprar una máquina recubridora que agilice sus procesos y le permita entregar sus pedidos a tiempo y con mayor calidad, pero carece del capital para dicha compra; es consciente que con ésta máquina mejorará el taller, su sueño es poder tener el espacio necesario para trabajar y día a día, aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
For 10 years Lucila has been working independently making all kinds of clothing, a skill that she learned in a store where she worked for 14 years. Unfortunately, due to personnel cuts, Lucila had to begin a new challenge.

Currently she works in her workshop with the goal of helping her two children to get ahead. Every 15 days she is sent 300 garments to finish, which occupies the majority of her time. Lucila needs to buy a coverstitch machine that will streamline her processes and help her to get her assignments in on time and with better quality, but she doesn't have the funds to make the purchase. She knows that with this machine she will improve her workshop. Her dream is to have the necessary space to work and, day-by-day, to increase production.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch machine

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusra lives in Jaranwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, famous for its agriculture industry. She has lived there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Rasheed Park for the past 30 years. She is a widow and had a very difficult time after the death of her husband. She relied on house rent income which she used to raise her children. Now her children are grown up and have started working. So Nusrat spends most of her time at home doing her household responsibilities. 

She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her elder son has a motorbike rental business and her younger son operates a grocery store in the market. Her daughters stay at home and help their mother in her housework. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her younger son’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy daily use items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, etc. which will enable him to make more sales and earn larger profits. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and Nusrat is hopeful that an investment will bring even  more profits to him and she will be able to save some profits for her daughter’s marriage.   

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She has proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time in the previous loan year. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La señora Pabla R. tiene 54 años de edad, esta soltera y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, Tiene mas de 30 años de vivir en la colonia Buena Vista Centro, ahi vive con un hijo y una nieta, los otros dos hijos viven en los Estados Unidos, Pabla se separo de su esposo hace unos años, doña Pabla se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora.
El credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para tener bien surtida su pulperia ya que se aproxima la semana santa y en esta semana las ventas son buenas.
Su sueño es que sus hijos puedan estar legalmente en los estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pabla R., 54, is single and sells groceries in a store located in her house.  She’s lived in the Buena Vista Centro neighborhood for over 30 years; she lives there with a son and granddaughter.  Her other children live in the United States.  Pabla separated from her husband a few years ago.  Her tenacity characterizes her.  

She will use the loan to buy groceries to stock her store because Holy Week is approaching and sales are good that week.  

Her dream is that her children will be able to be in the United States legally.

loans.use: to buy milk, soap, toilet paper, oatmeal, cereal, coffee, cookies, bread, snacks, batteries, candles, beans, corn flour, lard, oil, margarine, eggs, sweets, deodorants, sardines, hair gel, noodles, tomato sauce, mortadella, ham, sausages, soft drinks, juices and water in cans and bags.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara forma parte del banco comunal “Lontué I”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Molina.
Ella se dedica a vender comida rápida desde hace 20 años aproximadamente, ofrece sus productos en un carro, específicamente papas fritas. Sus clientes son frecuentes y varios. Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras y supermercados mayoristas. 
Con el préstamo comprará papas, sal y aceite.
Su meta para su negocio es tener un local establecido, donde pueda ofrecer y vender su comida rápida a sus clientes. 
Sus sueños a nivel personal son tener una vida más confortable, específicamente salud y trabajo. 
Clara vive junto a su esposo, hija de 25 años y nieta de 7 meses de edad. 
Clara está muy contenta y agradecida de Fondo esperanza. Ella dice ser una fanática de Fondo esperanza. Además que las reuniones con las demás socias del banco comunal, le sirven como distractor en sus ratos libres. 
Molina es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, ubicada en la región del Maule. Se caracteriza principalmente por ser uno de los grandes polos de la industria vitivinícola chilena. Además de las vides, está la industria frutícola, destacando la producción de manzanas, peras y kiwis.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of the “Lontué I” communal bank in the city of Molina.  She has sold fast food for the last 20 years approximately.  She sells from a cart, specifically fried potatoes.  Her customers are varied and frequent.  She buys her merchandise from distributors and from wholesale supermarkets.  She will use the loan to buy potatoes, salt and oil.

Her goal for the business is to have an established locale where she can sell her fast food to her customers and her dream at a personal level is to have a more comfortable life, specifically health and work. Clara lives with her husband, her 25 year old daughter and her 7 month old granddaughter.

She is very happy and grateful to Fondo Esperanza.  She says she’s a huge fan of Fondo Esperanza and that the meetings with the other bank members are a real distraction for her in her free time.

Molina is a commune in central Chile located in the Maule region.  It’s known mainly for being one of the large centers of Chile’s wine industry.  Aside from grapevines, it also has a fruit producing industry in which apples, pears and kiwis predominate.

loans.use: to buy potoates, oil and salt.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 55 años, vive en su casa propia con el menor de sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 30 años decidió tener una granja de animales menores como cuyes y desde entonces se dedica en la atención y alimentación de éstos. Parte del forraje que ofrece a sus animales ella mismo los cultiva, ya que posee terrenos de cultivo, ahí siembra alfalfa y cada dos meses están listas para ser cosechadas. Considera que la crianza de cuyes es una  opción rentable, pues le genera ganancias que le permite sostener a su familia, sin embargo la bajas temperaturas perjudican en su crianza, muriéndose algunos de frío, por ello ha tomado medidas de prevención, por tanto espera comprar materiales para restaurar sus galpón, asimismo comprará pollos para que aumente la cantidad que tiene. Por otro lado también se dedica a la venta de productos  alimenticios y los ofrece en otras ciudades, entonces cada 15 días viaja para así generarse más ingresos económicos. Es su crédito número 9 que tiene con MFP, considera que pertenecer a su banco comunal le ha traído varias ventajas que hoy agradece ya que pudo  acceder a un crédito  para mejorar su negocio y en la actualidad renueva esa confianza con el firme compromiso de seguir siendo responsable. En esta ocasión invertirá el crédito que solicita, en la compra de mercadería para su negocio que realiza en sus viajes y también más cuyes productores y gallinas.
texts.en:
Lucia, 55, lives in her own house with the youngest of her three children.  Thirty years ago she decided to have a farm to raise small animals like guinea pigs; since then she’s been dedicated to caring for and feeding these animals.  Part of the forage she feeds them she grows herself since she has farmland where she grows alfalfa that’s ready for harvest every two months.  She considers raising guinea pig to be a profitable option because it generates income that allows her to support her family.  However, low temperatures affect production because the cold kills some of the animals. Because of this, she’s taken some preventive measures: she hopes to buy supplies to repair her sheds and chickens to increase the number she has She also sells foodstuffs in other cities that she visits every two weeks to sell and earn more income.

This is her 9th loan with MFP.  She thinks that belonging to a communal bank has brought her many advantages that today she’s grateful for because she was able to access a loan to improve her business and the trust placed in her is today being renewed with her firm commitment to continue being responsible.  

On this occasion, she will use the loan to buy merchandise for the business she carries out on her trips and also to buy more breeding guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Cristina Felicidad

texts.es: La Sra.  Cristina se dedica a la Confeccion de ropa de distintos tipos, ya sea para varón o para mujer, como también al arreglo y  reducción de tamaño  en pantalones y camisas, cambio d ecuellos, cambio de cierres,  principalmente su actividad lo realiza en su domicilio para lo cual solicita el crédito para la compra de una maquina collereta la que le permitirá realizar trabajos de mejor calidad, ya tiene bastante clientela y es una persona muy conocida en el barrio por el buen trabajo que realiza , vive en su domicilio con su esposo y su hija  de dos años, es una persona muy trabajadora y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cristina works as a seamstress and makes all kinds of clothing for men and women.  She also does alterations on trousers and shirts, and changes collars and zippers.  She mainly works out of her home and is requesting a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine to improve on work quality.

She has many customers and is very well-known in the neighborhood for the good job she does.  Cristina lives with her husband and two-year-old daughter.  She is a hard worker and grateful to the institution for the support received.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Jimena Janeth

texts.es: La señora Jimena  se dedica a trabajar como dibujante,  quien hace dibujos particularmente para estudiantes a quienes  en sus unidades educativas les dan dichos trabajos, su familia esta compuesta por su persona, su esposo quien trabaja en otra provincia razón por la que se ausenta a veces por largo tiempo de su domicilio y su niña de 6 meses de edad, la señora para colaborar a los ingresos familiares se dedico a trabajar como dibujante. Ya que la actividad lo realiza en su domicilio vio por conveniente abrir una librería para mejorar sus ingresos. Razón por la que solicito crédito para la compra de material escolar y también material para realizar sus dibujos, es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de superación que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jimena works as a draftswoman and makes drawings for students who are given projects at school.  Her family is comprised of herself, her husband who works in another province and is away from home for long periods of time, and their 6-month-old daughter.  She contributes to the family income with her work as a draftswoman.  

Since she does her job from home she believes it would be a good idea to open a bookstore to increase income.  She plans to use the loan to buy school and drawing materials.  She is a hard worker and intent on getting ahead, and grateful to the institution for the support received.

loans.use: To buy materials to open a bookstore

loans.name: Ritza Zulema

texts.es:
doña Ritza Zulema O. tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Arenas de la ciudad de Choluteca, Ritza se dedica a la venta de sandias en su vehiculo desde hace mas de 2 años. reparte la fruta en varias colonias y caserios cercanos a choluteca.
Ritza cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para cubrir con los gastos del hogar, su esposo trabaja en una gasolinera.
Ritza es madre de 2 hijos los cuales estan pequeños, en sus tiempos libres lo dedica a la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de sandias al por mayor.
la sandia es una fruta que se consume mucho en esta zona.
texts.en:
Doña Ritza Zulema Ordóñez is 35 years old and lives in Barrio Arenas in the city of Choluteca.  She's been selling watermelons out of her vehicle for over two years, distributing the fruit throughout the colonies and rural areas close to Choluteca.

Her husband, who works at a gas station, helps her cover household expenses.  Ritza is the mother of two small children and in her free time does work for the church.

She plans to use the loan to buy wholesale watermelon which is the fruit with the highest consumption rate in the area.

loans.use: To buy watermelons

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es: Lupe tiene 40 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en casa D. sus padres. ElL. se dedica a dos actividades, L. primera es L. venta D. leñan, trabajo que lo realiza desD. hace 2 años y L. segunda es L. venta D. pan, ambos le generan las ganancias suficientes para sostener a su familia. Es así que se levanta muy temprano para ir a L. panadería para preparar y repartir pan a las bodegas o tiendas D. su comunidad, es por ello que día a día se esfuerza para productor en cantidad y poder cubrir L. demanda D. sus clientes, por ello trabaja junto a una persona que ha contratado para L. preparación D. panes, además que elL. aporta en L. preparación D. este alimento diario.  En cuanto a L. venta D. leña, compra por troncos al que luego manda a cortar y los venD. en trozos durante el fin D. semana. Por ahora Lupe desea incurisonar en L. venta D. animales menores, para generarse más ingresos. Es su crédito número con MFP, durante este tiempo ha tenido una experiencia positiva  y valora bastante a cada integrante D. su banco comunal D. L. que siempre estará agradecida. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. más animales menores.
texts.en:
Lupe is 40 years old and lives with her three children in her parent's home.  She has two jobs, one selling firewood, which she has been doing for two years, and the other selling bread.  They generate enough income to support her family.  She get up very early to bake bread and distribute it to the stores in the community.  She works hard to produce large quantities to meet customer demand and has hired someone to help with the preparation.

As far as firewood sales is concerned, she buys tree trunks which she sends off to be cut and then sells the pieces on the weekends.

But now Lupe wants to go into the business of small animal sales in order to increase her income.  She has had other loans through MFP and has always found the experience to be positive.  She values all the members of her communal bank and is always grateful.  She plans to buy more small animals with the loan.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 66 años, vive en compañía de su esposa y el menor  de sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 20 años se dedica a realizar bellos bordados típicos de los pueblos aledaños a su zona, trabaja generalmente en las noches en su casa ya que en el día trabaja de manera dependiente en una carpintería, de esta manera ha logrado mejorar sus ingresos a lo largo de sus años. Trabaja junto a su esposa y comparte esta labor que los une hasta ahora, los trabajos que realiza son mediante encargo de sus clientes que permanentemente solicitan de sus trabajos  y después de un mes viaja a repartir las faldas bordadas  a sus clientes y ellos al contando le pagan. Reconoce que ya no tiene esa misma fortaleza física y por eso demora un poco más en producir sus bordados, sin embargo ha perfeccionado en la calidad y los acabados de sus bordados y eso mantiene la fidelidad de sus clientes en seguir solicitando en su producción. Es su crédito número 8 con MFP, el banco comunal que integra significa mucho para el ya que aprendió muchas cosas positivas que lo ayudan en su vida diaria más que nada en el aspecto económico de la cual esta muy agradecido y por su parte seguirá trabajando con ese mismo sentido de responsabilidad. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de hilos y telas para seguir bordando los pedidos de sus clientes y con una parte pagará los estudios universitarios del menor de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan is 66 years old and lives with his wife and the youngest of his four children in their own home.  For over 20 years he has been making beautiful embroidered garments which are typical in the villages in the area.  He generally works at home at night since during the day he works for a carpenter which has allowed him to increase his income over the years.  He and his wife share the embroidery activity that has kept them united.  

Their work is based on orders constantly being placed by customers.  After a month he delivers the embroidered skirts to customers and collects payment in cash.  He admits that he is not as physically strong as he used to be and takes a little longer to finish the embroidery, but he has perfected the quality and finish and this keeps customers loyal and coming back.

This is his 8th loan through MFP.  The communal bank means a lot to him because he has been able to learn many positive things that have helped him in his daily life.  He is especially grateful for the economic training.  He plans to continue working with a sense of responsibility.

He will use the loan to buy thread and fabric to continue embroidering orders for customers.  Part of the loan will go toward a university education for his children.

loans.use: To buy thread and fabric

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: El Sr.  Alfredo  de 46 años,  de estado civil soltero, con dos  hijos, tiene ya 10 años dedicándose a la venta de CDs y DVDs  actualmente de forma ambulante e independiente es originario de la ciudad de La Paz. El Sr. Alfredo  se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la demanda que posee. El  tiene un buen historial de deuda, es cliente antiguo  de la institución  con ejemplar comportamiento, además es uno de los pocos clientes que posee cuenta de ahorro  en la institución, vive en la Zona los Lotes   ubicado al  Sur de nuestra ciudad,	el dinero del crédito es para comprar un lote de películas y videos, es una persona responsable y trabajadora que esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 46, is single and has two children.  He’s been selling CDs and DVDs for the last 10 years independently and in an itinerant manner.  He is from the city of La Paz.

He found himself in need of requesting a loan from our institution due to demand he has.  He has a good credit history; he’s a longstanding client of the institution with exemplary behavior.  Besides, he’s one of the few clients having a savings account in the institution.  He lives in the Los Lotes zone located in the south side of our city.  

The money from the loan is to buy a batch of movies and videos.  He is a responsible, hard working person who’s grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy DVDs and music videos.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es:
Danilo, tiene 42 años de edad, es originario de la comunidad El Consuelo localizada en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, es soltero, de oficio agricultor, se ha dedicado a la siembra y mantenimiento de café. Inicio a la edad de 11 años de edad, aprendió a cortar café y almacenarlo ayudaba a su papa a realizar estas labores esto lo hacia antes de ir a la escuela la cual le quedaba a hora y media caminando. Después se traslado a estudiar su secundaria en Pueblo Nuevo, solo logro estudiar hasta primer año de la secundaria debido ala guerra de 1980 fue reclutado para  prestar servicio militar, el tuvo que escapar para evitar la guerra. Su papa  le dejo de herencia 2 manzanas de tierra con siembra de café de eso ha sobrevivido y también se dedico comprar y vender ganado. Actualmente el vende su productos en Pueblo Nuevo y a vendedores ambulantes, le gustaría vender su café donde le ofrezcan un mejor precio o negociar directamente con el comprador extranjero.
Solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de dos manzanas de café, compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra. Le seria de gran ayuda este préstamo pues obtendría una mejor calidad y rendimiento en su cosecha de café, conseguir mas clientes que quieran comprar su café. 
Le gustaría en un futuro cercano ampliar su siembra de café , mejorar su vivienda, siempre seguir sembrando café pues es un rubro que conoce bien y disfruta sembrar. Dentro de sus metas esta comprar una motocicleta, comprar ganado y tener su propio centro de acopio de café.
texts.en:
Danilo, 42, is from the community of El Consuelo located in the town of Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí municipality.  He’s single and his occupation is coffee farming. He started working at the age of 11; he learned how to pick and store the coffee helping his father do these tasks.   He would work before going to school which was a one and a half hour walk away.  He then went to middle school in Pueblo Nuevo but was only able to finish the first year of middle school because he was recruited to serve in the military during the 1980 war.  He had to run away in order to avoid the war.  His father left him two manzanas (1 Manzana = 1.68 acres) of farm land planted with coffee which has served to support him; he also became a livestock merchant.  He currently sells his products in Pueblo Nuevo and to street vendors.   He’d like to sell his coffee where prices are better or negotiate directly with foreign buyers.

He is asking for the loan to maintain his two manzanas of coffee, to buy farming supplies and to pay labor costs.  It will be of great help to him because he’ll get a better quality and higher yields of coffee and more customers who will want to buy it.

In the near future he’d like to expand his coffee plantation, make improvements to his house and always continue growing coffee because this is a line of work he knows well and enjoys doing.  Within his goals is the purchase of a motorcycle, to buy cattle and to have his own coffee gathering center.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee plantation, to buy supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Don Manuel tiene 60 años de edad, es originario de la comunidad llamada El Consuelo localizada en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, esta casado, es padre de familia, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales tiene 3 a cargos, el es agricultor, lleva 40 años en esta actividad, hoy en día se dedica a la siembra de café y crianza de ganado. Empezó a la edad de 15 años de edad ayudando a su papa el estudiaba por la mañana y en las tardes laboraba con su papa estudio hasta cuarto grado de primaria debido a que sus padres eran muy pobres además eran 9 hermanos  a todos no se les podían pagar la escuela así que tuvo que ayudar a su papa a trabajar y llevar alimento a su hogar. A los 22 años decidió casarse le fue difícil pues tuvo que trabajar el doble de lo usual  durante 2 meses para poder comprar el vestido de novia de su esposa. Después su papa le  vendió un pedazo de tierra para que la trabajara  y así lo hizo conto con el apoyo de sus esposa después vendió ese pedazo de tierra para comprar un terreno mas grande y sembró café y también crio ganado así fueron sobreviviendo hasta el día de hoy el y su familia. El espera comercializar su producto directamente con compradores en Estados Unidos. 
El solicito el préstamo para mantenimiento de 2.5 manzana de café, pago de mano de obra, compra de abono. Esto le ayudara a mantener en buenas condiciones su cosecha, obtener un mejor rendimiento en la producción de café. Tiene dentro su planes futuros comprar una  mas de tierra para siembra de café con un sistema tecnificado y tener una producción de café orgánico. Dentro de su meta próxima sembrar 3 manzanas de frijol y dos manzanas de maíz.
texts.en:
Manuel is 60 years old and a native of the community called El Consuelo (The Consolation), located in Pueblo Nuevo (New Town) in the municipality of Esteli. He is married and the father of a family with 8 children, of whom 3 are still in his charge. Manuel is a farmer with 40 years in this activity. Now he plants coffee and raises cattle.

At the age of 15 he began helping his father. Manuel studied only to the 4th grade of primary school because his parents were very poor and he was one of 9 children. They couldn't pay for schooling for all the children, so he had to help his father to work and bring food to his home. At the age of 22, he decided to marry but it was difficult. He had to work twice as hard for 2 months to be able to afford a wedding dress for his wife. Then, his father sold him a small piece of land to work and he made it count, with the help of his wife. Later, he sold this piece of land to buy a larger plot and plant coffee, and also, raise cattle. Thus Manuel and his family have survived until the present. He hopes to sell his coffee directly to buyers in the United States.

Manuel requests a loan to maintain his 4.375 acres of coffee, to pay laborers, and to buy manure. This will help him to keep his harvest in good condition, and obtain a better production of coffee. He intends to buy more land in the future for planting coffee, using a highly technical system that will produce organic coffee. Among his short-term  goals is to sow 5.25 acres of beans and 3.5 acres of corn.

loans.use: TO FERTILIZE AND MAINTAIN 4.375 ACRES OF COFFEE TREES

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan dedicado al servicio de transporte durante  siete años atrás gracias al sacrificio que realizo durante ese tiempo pudo comprarse su propio vehículo con el cual actualmente se encuentra trabajando y sosteniendo a su familia  con los ingresos que genera. El crédito que solicita el cliente es para comprar repuestos para su movilidad ya que presento algunos desperfectos. Pero una vez subsanados los daños de su vehículo se pondrá a trabajar nuevamente desde muy temprano hasta altas horas de la noche para así reunir dinero para comprarse otro vehículo y así poder tener mas ingresos, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señor Juan has worked in transportation services for six years.  Because of the sacrifices that he has made he was able to buy his own vehicle that he currently uses for work.  The income from this job supports his family.  

He is requesting a loan to purchase parts for his vehicle so that he can repair it.  After he fixes his vehicle he will be able to work again from very early until late at night to raise money to buy another vehicle and generate more income.  

He is very grateful to the institution for the support they offer.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Jose Ariel

texts.es:
José, tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero nacido en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, estudio Ingeniería Industrial, actualmente es dueño de un cibercafé, en Pueblo Nuevo lleva dos años en este negocio. Inicio en este negocio por la necesidad de trabajar pues no tenia un trabajo formal. Primero empezó con una pulpería donde vende jugos, galletas ,snacks y  agrego un servicio mas que es el de recargar minutos en los celulares y el servicio de internet en las computadoras lo hizo con capital de trabajo propio, el tenia 27 años cuando puso este negocio de llamadas internacionales y servicio de internet café, hoy en día tiene dos personas que le ayudan a atender a los clientes pues la mayoría de su clientela son estudiantes de secundaria y personas aledañas a la comunidad.
El solicito el préstamo para comprar 3 computadoras nuevas, pues esto le ayudara a dar un mejor servicio, atraer mas clientes, darle una mejor presentación a su negocio. En el futuro le gustaría incrementar más el número de computadoras y cabinas telefónicas para llamadas internacionales. Tiene como meta tener un centro técnico de computación para dar clases de computación a los jóvenes de Pueblo Nuevo y contribuir con el desarrollo rural de la comunidad y así mismo poner en práctica lo que aprendió en la universidad
texts.en:
José is 31 years old and single.  He was born in Pueblo Nuevo in the town of Estelí.  He studied industrial engineering and for the past two years has owned an internet cafe in Pueblo Nuevo.  He started this business because he needed to work, but didn't have a formal job.    He first started a small store where he sold juices, sweets, snacks and then he added cell phone recharging and computer internet services.  He did all this with his own working capital.  He was 27 when he started his internet cafe and international calling business.  Today he has two employees that help him wait on customers.  The majority of his customers are high school students and people from the surrounding community. 

He is requesting a loan to buy 3 new computers as this will help him to offer better service, attract more customers and give his business a better presentation.  In the future he would like to buy more computers and increase then number of telephone booths for international calls.  His goal is to have a computer training center and offer classes to the youth of Pueblo Nuevo and contribute to the development of this rural community.   This way he will also be able to put into practice what he learned in the university.

loans.use: to purchase 3 new computers for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Reyna Elizabeth

texts.es:
la sra. Reyna Elizabeth C. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el barrio las Arenas de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion.
Reyna es madre de 3 hijos los cuales estan estudiando en la escuela publica de su comunidad.
Reyna cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar, su esposo trabaja en una llantera.
doña Reyna se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para elaborar sus ricas tortillas. 
sus tiempos libres lo dedica  a la iglesia. 
juntos con su esposo trabajan duro para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reyna is 40 years old, lives in Las Arenas in the city of Choluteca and works making and selling tortillas. She runs her business from home. 

Reyna is the mother of three children, who study in the town’s public school. Reyna depends on her husbnad to take care of household expenses. Her husband works in a tire shop.

Reyna gets up at 4:00 in the morning every day to prepare her tortillas. She devotes her free time to church. Together, with her husband, she works hard to give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy wood, lime, water and corn

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ene

texts.es: Ene tiene 60 años y vive en compañía de su hija en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, por tanto posee terrenos que le fue heredado por sus padres, ahí cultiva maíz, papa, zanahoria, productos que le genera ganancias además que le demanda tiempo, esfuerzo e inversión para obtener una buena producción, ya que debe comprar fertilizantes, para preveer la plaga de insectos que perjudican sus plantas. Una vez cosechada es transportada en el mercado de su localidad. Su mayor deseo es incrementar la cantidad de productos que siembra, pero para ello deberá analizar los factores y prevenir los posibles riesgos como por ejemplo sequías o  lluvias intensas que perjudican la siembra. Es su crédito número 10  con MFP, aprende bastante del trabajo grupal que siempre desarrolla y que en esta ocasión le trae muchas satisfacciones, agradece bastante por el apoyo que ha recibido de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar zanahoria.
texts.en:
Ene is 60 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter. For over 10 years she has worked in agriculture. She owns land which she inherited from her parents. There she grows corn, potatoes, carrots and other products that not only generate income but also require time and effort. In order to achieve good production, Ene must invest in fertilizer in order to prevent damage from harmful insects. 

Once harvested, Ene brings her crops to the local marketplace. She wishes to increase the amount of products that she plants. In order to do this, she must consider all factors and prevent possible risks to her crops such as draught or heavy rain. This is her 10th credit with Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP). She continues to develop upon what she has learned from working with her community bank and she is grateful for all the support that she has received. With the loan Ene is requesting, she will buy sacks of fertilizer in order to plant carrots.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Atanacia

texts.es:
La Sra. Atanacia tiene 42 años y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 están en edad escolar, durante toda su vida vendió pescado ya que su marido es pescador.
La profesión lo adquirió de su madre, ella comentó que cuando era niña ellos vivían al costado del río y después de una crecida (aumento del nivel del agua, previa a una inundación) se mudaron a una zona de mayor altura.
Posee casa propia, y confesó que no sabe hacer otra cosa que vender pescado.
Tiene dos sueños, uno de ellos es que todos sus hijos tengan casa propia y la otra es la oportunidad de mejorar su casa para que pueda vender los pescados allí mismo.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito, mediante Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Atanacia is 42 years old and has 3 children, 2 of whom are school-aged.  All her life she has sold fish, as her husband is a fisherman.
She acquired the profession from her mother.  She tells us that when she was a girl, her family lived beside a river.  After a "crecida" (an rise in the water level just before a flood) they moved to an area of higher ground.
Sra. Atanacia has her own house and confessed that she's never known any other work than selling fish.
She has two dreams.  One is that her children have their own homes one day, and the other is to have the opportunity to improve her house so that she can sell her fish from her home. 
Sra. Atanacia is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity to access a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy tiene 33 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en casa del local de un centro educativo de su zona. Vende comida desde hace un año y medio en el cafetín de una escuela de su localidad y atiende todos los días, durante la temporada escolar, en este trabajo lo ayudan sus hijos, ya que durante la hora del refrigerio es cuando viene más gente y sola no se da abasto, de la misma forma necesita de ayuda durante la noche cuando es el otro turno. De esta manera ha logrado generarse un capital más, sostenible que le permite mejorar en su economía y cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, quienes son su mayor motivación para seguir trabajando. Además en su puesto de ventas llega a vender golosinas y gaseosas variadas, por lo que su establecimiento ha tenido mucha acogida, y por ello necesita de más capital para asegurar mayores ganancias e implementar mejor su puesto con vitrinas y mesas. Es su crédito número 3 con MFP, durante este tiempo de trabajo con su banco comunal ha visto los beneficios de unir esfuerzos para lograr el bien común del crecimiento económico de la cual esta muy agradecida y seguirá adelante con este mismo esfuerzo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cajas de golosinas y gaseosas al por mayor.
texts.en: Edy is 33 years old.  She lives in a house with her 3 children in the nieghborhood of an educational center of her region.  She has been selling food in the cafe of a neighborhood school for a year and a half.  Edy serves people everyday during the school year.  Her children help her with the work, as during the refreshment break a lot of people come and she can't keep up by herself.  Likewise, she needs help during the evening when it is the other shift.  Working like this, she has been able to generate more sustainable capital, which has allowed her to improve her finanaces and to pay for her children's necesities.  Her children are her main motivation to keep working.  In her sales post she sells sweets and various sodas, and her establishment has been very well recieved.  That is the reason she needs more capital- to ensure greater earnings and to implement improvements to her stall, such as adding display cases and tables.  This is her 3rd loan with MFP.  During the time Edy has worked with her commual bank, she has seen the benefits of uniting efforts for the common good of financial growth, and she is very grateful.  She will continue to move forward with the same effort.  With the loan that she is requesting, Edy will invest in the purchase of boxes of wholesale sweets and sodas.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.es:
doña Maria Ana O. tiene 54 años de edad, vive en el barrio las Arenas de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de sandias en su casa de habitacion, Maria es una mujer de avanzada edad que ya no tiene
hijos pequeños, ademas cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y juntos trabajan duro para salir adelante.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de sandias al por mayor, dicha fruta es muy sabrosa y tiene bastante demanda.
su tiempo libre lo dedica a la iglesia.
texts.en:
Maria Ana O. is 54 years old and lives in Las Arenas neighborhood, in the city of Choluteca.  Her business is selling watermelons from her home.  Maria is an older woman who no longer has young children.  She has the support of her husband and together they work hard to get ahead in life.

Maria will use her loan to buy watermelons wholesale.  This fruit is very tasty and in demand.

Maria devotes her spare time to her church.

loans.use: to buy watermelons

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ademar

texts.es: El Sr. Ademar Vive en la localidad de el torno, es de ocupación moto taxista, hace unos tres año que se dedica a esta actividad, hace un par de meses que esta viviendo con su pareja, ya que  esta formando su propio hogar, el destino del crédito es para la compra de una motocicleta y así poder incrementar sus ingresos, su pareja se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en el mercado de la localidad desde niña, ya que sus padres siempre vendieron en el mercado, el es nacido en el departamento de Chuquisaca, cuando era niño sus padres se vinieron a la ciudad de santa cruz en busca de nuevos horizontes, ya que la vida es difícil en el campo de Chuquisaca, El Sr. Ademar esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Ademar lives in the neighbourhood of El Torno. His job is driving a motorcycle taxi; he’s been doing this for three years. For the last two months he’s been living with his fiancee and making a home with her. With the loan Ademar plans to buy a motorcycle and thus earn more money. 

His fiancee has sold groceries in the local market since she was a young girl, a job her parents also did. 

Ademar was born in the department of Chuquisaca. When he was a boy, his parents moved to the town of Santa Cruz in search of a better future as life in Chuquisaca was difficult. He is grateful for the support that the institution of Emprender (Kiva partner) provides.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen forma parte del banco comunal “Lontué I”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Molina. Ella se dedica al corte y confección de ropa, desde hace 10 años. Carmen trabaja desde su casa, confeccionando sábanas, cortinas y pantalones para niños y adultos de polar. Es una tela muy abrigadora, especial para la temporada de invierno. Además está realizando como novedad, faldas de polar. Innovación que ha tenido bastante llegada de clientela. Lo que le generará mayores ganancias. Su mercadería la compra principalmente en distribuidoras de telas, sin embargo en la actualidad está encargando las telas y otros insumos a la ciudad de Santiago, ya que es más económico. 
Con el préstamo comprará telas, cierres, botones y tijeras.
Carmen vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 25, 17 y 5 años de edad. Los dos hijos mayores la ayudan en su negocio a promocionar sus confecciones. 
La meta de Carmen es construir un taller y su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales. Además quiere comprar otra máquina de coser, ya que quiere asociarse con su madre, en el negocio de la confección. 
Carmen está muy agradecida y contenta del crédito recibido por Fondo esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir en su negocio. Respecto a las reuniones con las demás socias, éstas le sirven como distracción. Con las capacitaciones ella ha aprendido a registrar sus ingresos, gastos y clientes, quienes le hacen pedidos y Carmen va anotando. 

Molina es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, ubicada en la región del Maule. Se caracteriza principalmente por ser uno de los grandes polos de la industria vitivinícola chilena. Además de las vides, está la industria frutícola, destacando la producción de manzanas, peras y kiwis.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Lontué I Community Bank in the town of Molina. She has earned her living sewing for the last ten years. She works out of her house making bedding, drapes, and fleece pants for children and adults. Fleece is a warm fabric especially in the winter. She’s also experimenting with making skirts out of fleece, and they have been welcomed by her customers and will bring in some extra income. Carmen generally buys her merchandise from fabric distributors, but currently she’s been buying the fabric and other supplies from Santiago at cheaper prices. With the loan she plans to buy more fabric, buttons, and scissors.

Carmen lives with her husband and their three children aged 26, 17, and 5. The two oldest help her promote the business. Her goal is to build a workshop, and her dream is for her children to get good jobs. She also wants to buy another sewing machine so that her mother can be part of the business.

Carmen is very grateful and happy with the money she has received from Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza as it has enabled her to invest in her business. As for the meetings with the other members, she has found them to be a good way of meeting people. The training sessions have taught her how to record her income and expenses, and how to keep track of customers’ orders.

Molina is a community in the centre of Chile, located in Maule region. It is known mainly as one of the chief centres of the Chilean winemaking industry. As well as grapes, other fruits are grown there especiallly apples, pears, and kiwis.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zips, buttons and scissors

loans.name: Ondina

texts.es:
la sra. Ondina S. S. tiene 47 años de edad, vive en la colonia el Sitio de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa.
Ondina trabaja de niñera.
el credito lo utilizara para hacerle unas mejoras al baño de su casa, desea reparar la tuberia, repellar, pulir, poner ceramica, instalarle una puerta y poner un tanque para almacenar agua.
Ondina obtiene un salario mensual fijo por el trabajo de niñera, esta haciendo estas mejoras para tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y para su familia.
su meta es terminar de constriur su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
47-year old Sra. Ondina S. lives in the neighbourhood of El Sitio in the town of Teguicigalpa. She works as a nanny.

She plans to use the loan to make improvements to the bathroom in her house. She wants to repair the pipes, plaster the walls, install tiles, add a door, and put in a water storage tank. 

Ondina receives a regular monthly salary from her job as a nanny. She is making these improvements to her house so she and her family can have a better standard of living. Her goal is to gradually finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, pipes, tiles, a door, and a water tank

loans.name: Teddy

texts.es:
Teddy, es casada, tiene 24 años, una hija de 3 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Obreras.
Solicita un crédito de S/. 1500.00.
Tiene una vidriería.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de vidrios, aluminios y accesorios para vidriería. 
Teddy y su esposo tienen una vidriería en la avenida Arenales. Ellos recién llevan unos meses de casados y estan sacando adelante su negocio. Su esposo aprendió de esta actividad de sus padres, pues ellos también tienen una vidriería. Teddy ingreso a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de su suegra, con éste es el segundo ciclo que está. Le gusta FINCA Perú, por la accesibilidad a los créditos y puede ahorrar.
Su meta es ahorrar para comprarse un terreno, construir su casa y que su hija tenga una buena educación.
texts.en:
Teddy is 24 years old, married, and has a 3 year-old daughter.  She belongs to the 'Obreras' community bank and is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles.  Teddy will invest her loan in buying glass, aluminum and accessories for the glassworks that she and her husband own which is located on Arenales Avenue.  The couple have been married for just a few months and they are getting ahead in their business.
