Teddy's husband learned this trade from his parents as they also owned a glassworks.  Teddy joined FINCA Peru through an invite from her mother-in-law.  This is her second loan cycle.  Teddy likes FINCA Peru because their loans are accessible and it is possible to save.  Her goals are to save up to buy a plot of land, to build a house and for her daughter to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy glass, aluminum and accessories for a glassworks

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna, tiene 34 años es madre soltera con un hijo de 13 años. Pertenece al banco comunal Obreras.
Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general.
Solicita un crédito de S/. 3 000.00.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, jabones, harina y huevos, entre otros.
Reyna antes tenia una tienda alquilada, poco a poco fue ahorrando cuando FINCA Perú todavía trabaja en dólares llegó a ahorrar $ 7 000 dólares y se compró su terreno y comenzó la construcción de su casa. Ahora su tienda está en su casa propia y le va bien. En está oportunidad está ahorrando para la construcción del segundo piso de su casa.
Su sueño es tener una tienda grande y que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Reyna is 34 years old, a single mother, and has a 13 year-old son.  She is a member of the Obreras (Workers) community bank.

Reyna has a grocery store and is requesting a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles.  She will invest her loan in buying merchandise for her store such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, soap, flour and eggs.

Reyna used to rent a store but she gradually saved money with FINCA Peru from the time when they still worked in dollars.  She managed to save 7,000 dollars, bought a plot of land and started building her own home.  Now her store is located in her home and is doing well.  Reyna is currently saving to build a second storey on her home.  Her dream is to have a big store and for her son to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, soap, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Fuerza Trabajadora (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Fuerza Trabajadora esta conformado por 9 mujeres y un hombre que trabajan en diferentes actividades como el comercio, la agricultura, cría de animales, etc. y esto les ha permitido mejorar la economía de sus hogares, son personas emprendedoras y siempre ven la vida de una manera positiva.  Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la tercera ciudad  más importante  del país, Cuenca tiene muchos lugares turísticos en donde se puede admirar la belleza de la naturaleza.

La Señora. Nora S. vive por el sector de Todos Santos en la ciudad de Cuenca. Tiene 33 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 13 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio, su segunda hija en una escuelita de la ciudad y su ultimo hijo está en el pre kínder. Su esposo labora como mesero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Nora vende comida rápida (hot dogs, hamburgesas, papas fritas, etc.), se dedica a esta actividad hace 4 años y labora de lunes a sábados solo por las tardes. También vende cosméticos de la marca Yanbal hace 5 años,en esta actividad no tiene ni día ni horario fijo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermana quien es socia activa del mismo. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y productos para su negocio de comida rápida como: pan, carne, salchichas, papas, colas, etc.

Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Fuerza Trabajadora” (Workforce) consists of nine women and one man who work in different activities such as trade, agriculture, livestock breeding, and other businesses that enable them to improve their household finances. The members are enterprising individuals who always approach life in a positive manner. They live in Cuenca, the third largest city in Ecuador. Cuenca has many tourist attractions where its natural beauty can be admired.

Sra. Nora S. lives in the District of Todos Santos in the city of Cuenca. She is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 14, 13, and 4). The first child is in high school, the second child attends a school in the city, and the last child is in pre-kindergarten. Her husband works as a waiter. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Doña Nora sells fast food such as hot dogs, hamburgers, fries, and other items. She has been in this business for four years and works Monday through Saturday, but only in the afternoons. Nora has also been selling cosmetics from the Yanbal line for five years. In her cosmetics business, she does not have specific days or an established schedule by which she works.

This is the first loan she is receiving from the Communal Bank after being invited by her sister, who is also an active member. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics and supplies for her fast food business such as bread, meat, sausages, potatoes, sodas, and other items.

Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and supplies for a fast food business such as bread, meat, sausages, potatoes, sodas, and other items.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 36 años es casada, con 3 hijos ( 14, 12, 7 años). Pertenece al banco comunal Obreras de FINCA Peru. 
Tiene un horno donde prepara panes.
Solicita un crédito de S/. 2 000.00.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de leña y harina.
Mercedes tiene su horno artesanal en su casa donde prepara panes chaplas (un pan tipico local) y los distribuye por mayor a diversas bodegas de la región. También tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general en su casa. Ingreso a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de una vecina y le gusta porque le facilitan los créditos y puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es poder comprar maquinarias para su panadería y preparar otro tipo de panes.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 36 years old, married, and has three children (ages 14, 12, and 7). She is a member of the Communal Bank “Obreras” (Workers), which is part of FINCA Peru. Mercedes has an oven that she uses for preparing bread. She is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN to invest in the purchase of firewood and flour.

Mercedes has an artisan oven in her house that she uses for baking “chaplas” (traditional local bread). She distributes her goods in bulk to different stores in the region. Mercedes also manages a grocery store in her home. A neighbor invited her to join FINCA Peru and she now enjoys the convenience of the loans and has the ability to save.

Her dream is to buy machines for her bakery so that she can produce other types of bread.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and flour.

loans.name: Viviana Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Viviana, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos niños de 12, 10 años  y un bebito de apenas 8 meses de nacido, los dos mayores están en escuela. Su marido es mecánico automotriz.
 
Ella es una gran madre y ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos que ocasionan sus hijos y la familia se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa, en estos últimos meses mas a vendido en su casa ya que como su bebé esta pequeño no ha podido salir mucho pero a pesar de esto sus clientes la visitan. Su mercadería  la compra en Guayaquil y lleva cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal tres años y le gusta la ayuda y las facilidades que les otorga el  banco.

Su sueño es tener casa propia ya que vive arrendando.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi. This place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. It is also where the famous Panama hats are made.

One can meet Sra. Viviana in this place. She is 28 years old, in a common law relationship, and has two children (ages 12 and 10) and an eight month old baby. The two older children are in school. Her husband is an automobile mechanic.

Viviana is a good mother and homemaker who helps her husband with the expenses incurred by their children and their family by selling all types of clothing. She sells door-to-door and also from her home. In recent months, she has sold more from home because her baby is still little and she is not able to go out frequently. Despite her situation, her customers come to visit her. Her merchandise is purchased in Guayaquil and she has been in this business for five years.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. Viviana has been with the Communal Bank for three years and enjoys the assistance and services that have been provided. Her dream is to have her own home because she currently lives in a rental property.

loans.use: To purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis, es un joven de 29 años de edad, originario de Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, soltero, de oficio agricultor. Inicio ayudando a su papa a la edad de 12 años de edad así fue adquiriendo mas experiencia , cuando cumplió 20 años de edad se dedico a trabajar en la huerta , sembró media manzana de tomate que le permitió tener algo de ganancia y así poder continuar trabajando. Después decidió irse a trabajar fuera de Nicaragua estuvo  4 años trabajando en el extranjero para poder conseguir capital de trabajo , el estudio hasta cuarto año de la secundaria , tomo un curso de informática y electrónica ,pero al dedicarse a trabajar solo en el campo no pudo seguir estudiando mas, pues no tenia muchos recursos para continuar. Aunque ha si do un trabajo duro el  ha sabido seguir adelante pues sembrar es una de las actividades que mas le gusta.
Solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento  y siembra de tomate tipo floración , pues le ayudara a conseguir a cubrir costos tales como pago de mano de obra ,compra de gasolina para motor de siembra ,insumos, fertilizantes, espera tener una buen cosecha. 
En el futuro desea lograr comprar su propia tierra, su casa. Su principal meta es sacar el mejor cultivo de tomate es la época de siembra  de hortalizas para poder adquirir otro terreno propio y sembrar mas.
texts.en:
Luis is a young man who is 29 years of age and single. He is originally from Pueblo Nuevo in the city of Estelí. Luis is a farmer by trade. He started helping his father at the age of 12 and gained more experience ever since. When he turned 20 years old, he went to work on a vegetable farm where he planted approximately 0.8 acres of tomatoes. This enabled him to earn some income so that he could continue working. Afterwards he decided to leave Nicaragua to go work abroad in order to continue accumulating capital for his work. Luis studied through the fourth year of high school, taking courses in computer science and electronics. However, he decided to work alone in the fields because he could not continue his studies due to a lack of financial resources. Even though the work is hard, he moves forward with his farm work since planting is one of the activities he enjoys most.

Luis is requesting a loan to maintain and plant flowering tomatoes. This will enable him to cover expenses such as labor, gasoline for his motorized plow, supplies, and fertilizers. He hopes to have a good harvest. In the future, Luis wants to buy his own land and a house. His main goal is to achieve the best crop of tomatoes since this is the season for planting vegetables. He wants to acquire another piece of land so that he can plant more.

loans.use: Pay for expenses related to planting and maintaining his tomato crop.

loans.name: Lexy Lorena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí conocimos a Lexy, tiene 22 de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres. Estudia para Licenciada en Ciencias De La Educación en la Universidad De Manta. Lleva en el Banco Comunal dos años  y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido seguir con su negocio y estudiar al mismo tiempo.

Ella tienen una tienda de abarrotes en su casa en la cual además de vender productos de primera necesidad también vende artículos de bazar, útiles escolares, helados entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 16h00 ya que a esa hora tiene que ir a su Universidad a seguir preparándose para el futuro, su papá le ayuda de allí en adelante hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que tiene su tienda 5 años y que le ha ido muy bien. Con su negocio ella ayuda a sus padres y también se ayuda con sus estudios.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, útiles escolares más que todo ya esta es la época de entrada a clases.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio  y terminar su Licenciatura.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi. This place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. It is also where the famous Panama hats are made.

One can meet Sra. Lexy in this place. She is 22 years old, single, and lives at home with her parents. She is studying for her Bachelors of Science degree in Education at the University of Manta. Lexy has been with the Communal Bank for two years and enjoys the fact that she has been able to continue with her business and her studies at the same time.

She manages a grocery store in her home where she sells basic necessities as well as bazaar items, school supplies, ice cream, and other products. Lexy works every day from 6:30am to 4pm before leaving for her classes at the University where she is continuing to prepare for her future. Her father continues to manage the store until 8pm. She says that she has worked in her store for five years and has done very well. With this business, Lexy has been able to help her parents and pay for her education.

This loan will be used to restock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, and more school supplies since classes have already started. Her goals are to move forward in her business and finish her degree.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, and school supplies.

loans.name: Maricela Magdalena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí conocimos Maricela, tiene 24 de edad, es soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres. Estudia fisioterapia en la Universidad Laica Eloy Alfaro de Manta. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya tres ciclos y le gusta la facilidad de pago de los créditos.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo de distintas marcas nacionales y extranjeras, entre las marcas que ella vende están Unimoda, Nivi, Nuestra piel, entre otras, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, trabaja todos los días ya que ella aprovecha para venderles a sus compañeras de clases que también son sus clientes. Nos cuenta que deja a crédito y cobra los fines de semana. Ella empezó este negocio hace un año y fue con el primer crédito que hizo en el banco comunal,  esto le ha ayudado para seguir con sus estudios que gracias a Dios este año culmina.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Sus sueños son seguir incrementando su negocio y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi. This place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. It is also where the famous Panama hats are made.

One can meet Sra. Maricela in this place. She is 24 years old, single, and lives at home with her parents. She is studying physical therapy at Laica Eloy Alfaro University in Manta. Maricela has been with the Communal Bank for three loan cycles and enjoys the convenient repayment options.

She sells clothing through catalogs of various domestic and foreign brands. The brands that she sells include Unimoda, Nivi, Nuestra Piel, and others. Maricela sells door-to-door and through orders. She works every day and takes advantage of selling to her classmates as well as her customers. Maricela says she offers her products on credit and collects payment on the weekends. She started this business a year ago with the first loan she received from the Communal Bank. As a result, her business has helped her continue her studies. She thanks God that she will finish this year.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. Her dreams are to continue growing her business and pursue her profession.

loans.use: To purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Flerida Lucia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Flerida, tiene 35 años, es casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, la mayor estudia en la escuela. Su esposo es militar. Ella es Ing. Comercial.
 
Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza  en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local con vitrinas, también vende a base de pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00  hasta las 18h00, deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería compra en Guayaquil y también viaja hasta Ipiales (Colombia) y Huaquillas (Perú), nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio  15 años.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace 13 años  y le gusta por la unión que hay en el grupo.
 
Sus sueños es tener un almacén grande donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi. This place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. It is also where the famous Panama hats are made.

One can meet Sra. Flerida in this place. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children (ages 7 and 4). The older child is in school. Her husband is in the military. Flerida has a business degree.

She sells all types of clothing door-to-door, but most of her sales are conducted from her home where she has a small shop with display cabinets. Flerida also generates sales from orders submitted from her customers. She works every day from 9am to 6pm. Flerida offers her goods on credit and collects payment every fifteen days. Her merchandise is purchased in Guayaquil, but she also travels as far as Ipiales (Colombia) and Huaquillas (Peru). She says that she has been in this business for 15 years.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. She joined the Communal Bank when it first started 13 years ago and enjoys being part of the group. Her dreams include having a larger store where she can sell her products.

loans.use: To purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Patricia Jakeline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Patricia, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de  dos hijos de 5 y 3  años, el mayor este año empieza su primer año de escuela. Vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal  seis años  y le gusta por los créditos adicionales que brinda la institución.

Tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres, la misma que es  en sociedad con su mamá, además de vender productos de primera necesidad también vende artículos de bazar, útiles escolares, ciertas medicinas  entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 19h00, nos cuenta que llevan con este negocio 8 años y que le ha ido muy bien, los productos los compran en Manta ya que allá le salen más baratos y encuentra más variedad.

Con este crédito va a comprar útiles escolares ya esta es la época de entrada a clases y es lo que más necesitan  sus clientes.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio  y que este crezca cada dia mas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi. This place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. It is also where the famous Panama hats are made.

One can meet Sra. Patricia in this place. She is 32 years old and a single mother of two children (ages 5 and 3). The older child is starting his first year of school. Patricia lives at her parents’ house. She has been with the Communal Bank for six years and enjoys the additional loans that Fundación ESPOIR has provided for her.

Patricia has a store in her parents’ home that she manages with her mother. In addition to selling basic necessities, they also offer bazaar items, school supplies, certain medicines, and other products. Patricia works every day from 6:30am to 7pm. She says that she has been in this business for eight years and has done very well. Her products are purchased in Manta because the prices are lower and a greater variety is available.

This loan will be used to buy school supplies since classes have started and her customers have a greater need for these items. Her goal is to move forward in her business and grow more each day.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Ayda Celeste

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ayda, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada pero no ha podido tener hijos. Su esposo es taxista. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos se ha podido financiar su negocio.

Ella además de atender su hogar y a su esposo también se dedica a la elaboración de productos y manualidades hechos en fomix, nos cuenta que le hacen muchos pedidos  más que todo para fiestas infantiles. A ella le encanta lo que hace ya que con sus obras hace feliz a muchos niños, comenta. Trabaja todos los días por varias horas y cuando tiene muchos pedidos casi todo el dia, lleva 9 años dedicada a esta labor que le ha traído muchos beneficios económicos y espirituales.

Este crédito es para comprar materiales para elaborar sus manualidades (artículos para fiestas), ella necesita fomix, pinturas, cartulina, pegamentos, entre otras cosas que utiliza.
 
Su sueño es tener buena salud ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi. This place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. It is also where the famous Panama hats are made.

One can meet Sra. Ayda in this place. She is 54 years old, married, and has no children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Ayda has been with the Communal Bank almost since the beginning. She enjoys being a member because of the loans that have helped to finance her business.

In addition to taking care of her home and her husband, Ayda manufactures products and crafts made of foam. She says that she receives many orders for children’s parties. Ayda enjoys her job because many children have said how happy they are with her work. She works every day for several hours. When she has several orders, Ayda works for almost the entire day. She has been in this business for nine years and it has brought her many financial and spiritual benefits.

This loan will be used to buy materials for making crafts (party favors). She needs craft foam, paints, construction paper, adhesives, and other items. Her wish is that she and her husband have good health.

loans.use: To purchase craft foam, paints, construction paper, adhesives, and other items.

loans.name: Esmeraldas Yasmin

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yasmin, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 19 y 13 años, el mayor estudia en la Universidad y el menor en colegio, ambos viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante vende pescado.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, también vende bajo pedidos. Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esta hora el ambiente es más fresco. Ella deja los productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería le trae una sobrina desde Guayaquil,  nos cuenta que empezó  su negocio hace 13 años y que lo hizo con el primer crédito que recibió del banco  y que gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella tiene su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi. This place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. It is also where the famous Panama hats are made.

One can meet Sra. Yasmin in this place. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children (ages 19 and 13). The older child is studying at the university while the younger one is in high school. Both of them live with her. Her husband is a fish merchant.

Yasmin sells all types of clothing door-to-door as well as through orders. She works three days each week, mostly in the mornings because the weather is much cooler. Yasmin offers her products on credit and collects payment every fifteen days. Her merchandise is brought in from Guayaquil by her niece. Yasmin says that she started her business thirteen years ago with the first loan she received from the Communal Bank. She thanks God that she has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. She has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and enjoys having access to the loans for her business.

Her dream is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: To purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Vuthy S. N. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $1.25 per day. Her husband always assists the farm field. This couple has been married for many years and has two children.  One of their children, a daughter, is a grocery seller by the border of Thailand. Vuthy S. N. sees that her daughter’s business is profitable and she hopes to improve it further by accumulating a larger quantity of groceries inventory through a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her daughter's groceries business

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia F. is 32 years, married, and has four children. Sofia owns and operates a taxi business.  She has five years of experience in this business. Sofia is requesting a loan for 2,900 WST, which she will use to purchase car parts and paints.  She plans to use the profit from her business, estimated to be 400 talas or $167 per week, to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Sofia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Sofia's seventh loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase car parts and paints

loans.name: Vanuvanu

texts.en:
Vanuvanu, who is 35 years of age, married, and the mother of four children, owns and operates a business that bakes and sells specialty goods and delicacies in the local community. With two years of experience in this business, she is requesting her second loan for WST $1450 to purchase additional cooking ingredients. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Vanuvanu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Amusia

texts.en:
Amusia L. is 51 years old, married, and has seven children. Amusia owns and operates a taxi business.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Amusia is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase car parts and petrol to run the taxi.  She plans to use the profit from her business, estimated to be 260 talas or $108 per week, to improve and expand her business.

Amusia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Amusia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase car parts and petrol

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan H. is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband earn a living by growing rice crops on their own farmland. This couple has been working in this sector since their children were very young.  They currently have four children -- three of them are married and live independently, while the remaining one is still single and helps them in their farming business. 

Presently, Chan H.’s house is very old and a few parts are broken. She very much wants to repair it but lacks cash on hand. Thus, Chan H. would like to ask for loan to repair her broken house. She believes that his loan will give her whole family a good environment for living.

loans.use: to repair her broken house

loans.name: Toavalu

texts.en:
Toavalu is 42 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a business selling lavalavas (printed wraps worn by both men and women). Toavalu has one year of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Toavalu plans to use the profit from her business, estimated to be 125 USD a week, to improve and expand. 

Toavalu joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services and this is her first loan with SPBD. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and material

loans.name: Tuitoga

texts.en:
Tuitoga is 35 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell. Tuitoga has three years of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase seeds, seedlings, and young crops to cultivate.  Tuitoga plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 146 USD weekly) to improve and expand. 

Tuitoga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services and this is her third loan with SPBD. Most of SPBD’s clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings, and young crops to cultivate

loans.name: Alofisa

texts.en:
Alofisa is 46 years old and married with seven children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro to sell. Alofisa has three years of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to cultivate.  Alofisa plans to use the profit from her business, estimated to be 167 USD per week, to improve and expand. 

Alofisa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services and this is her third loan with SPBD. Most of SPBD’s clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings, and crops to cultivate

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 46 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a business planting harvesting taro to sell and has many years of experience in this business. Sylvia is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 188 USD weekly) to improve and expand.

Sylvia joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services. This is her second loan with SPBD. Most of SPBD’s clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers

loans.name: Fiailoa

texts.en:
Fiailoa is 61 years old and married with ten children between the ages of 23 and 40. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro to sell. Fiailoa has two years of experience in this business. 

Fiailoa joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services and this will be her second loan. Most of SPBD’s clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. Fiailoa is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  Fiailoa plans to use the profit from her business (which is estimated to be 208 USD weekly) to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers

loans.name: Leata

texts.en:
Leata I. is 28 years old, married, and has one child. Leata owns and operates a business, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has three years of experience in this business. Leata is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business, estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week, to improve and expand her business.

Leata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Leata's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase weed killers

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long M. is 40 years old and a married woman from the province of Kompong Cham. In order to fix the needs of the family, Long M. sells a few grocery goods out of her home. She has over ten years' experience in this sector and earns approximately $2.50 per day. Her husband is a local fisherman to help support the family. They have been married for years and have seven single children, none of them yet employed. Some of them are still in school and the others assist Long M. in selling grocery items. Long M. will use her loan to support her husband’s business by the purchase of more fish feed and fishing equipment.

loans.use: to assist her husband purchase fish food and fishing equipment

loans.name: Asega

texts.en:
Asega is 54 years of age and married with 5 children. Asega owns and operates a business venture selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women). She has 2 years of experience in this business. Asega needs a loan of 2,500 WST to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 520 WST or US $133 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Asega joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Asega's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Georgette works hard to support her family.

She has a water refilling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from room rentals. Georgette is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more water containers for her water-refilling business.

Georgette has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers for her water-refilling business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pio

texts.en:
Pio A. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 52 years old. Pio is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Pio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Pio has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest, or every five months, for these activities.

In 2011, Pio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pio is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca P. is 55 years old and has a common-law husband and two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Francisca runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan for 29,500 PHP  from NWTF, which she will use to buy more products to sell in her general store. Francisca has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, bread, sugar, canned goods, soap, etc. In the future Francisca would like to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en: Gerlie B. is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cosmetics sales business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for 25,000 PHP from NWTF, which she will use to purchase cosmetics and beauty supplies for her cosmetics sales business.  Gerlie has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from a beauty salon.  Gerlie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and beauty supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 52 years old and married with 5 children. Carolina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Carolina has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, softdrinks, soap, sugar, etc..

In the future, Carolina would like to build and expand her business for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan T. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas,Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 21 years old. Ryan is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Ryan owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ryan has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest, or every five months, for these activities.

In 2011, Ryan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ryan is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ryan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 39 years old and married with 6 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Susan has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. Susan requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her basket weaving business. Susan has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her basket weaving business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shiella

texts.en:
Shiella A. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 27 years old, married, and has two infant children. To make a living, Shiella owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Shiella has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Shiella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shiella is requesting a loan for 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase services to increase crop yield. This loan will be Shiella's first loan  from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Villamor

texts.en:
Villamor G. lives in the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 56 years old, married and has one child. For the last 33 years, he has made a living as a rice farmer and now earns about 8,000 PHP a month from his work.

Earlier this year, Villamor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for his first loan, for 30,000 PHP, to buy fertilizer. He plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve his family's living conditions. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and women and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for a rice farm.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio G. lives in the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 59 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. For the last 30 years, he has made a living by growing rice and currently earns about 30,000 PHP every five months, when he harvests his crop.

Earlier this year, Virgilio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for his first loan, for 25,000 PHP, to buy fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve his family's living conditions.  

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and women and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for a rice farm.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 51 years old and married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a food stall in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase grocery items to sell in her stall.

Lolita has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the food stall for 30 years and also earns an income from a bakeshop.

Lolita aspires to do some home improvements.


*This picture was taken during market day.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a new kitchen to cook meals for her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 60 years old and married. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for vegetables.

Edna has been farming vegetables for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to do some improvement of her livelihood and business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for vegetable garden.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies.

Erlinda has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea H. is a 67-year-old woman who has been living in Phnom Penh. She has learned how to combine different kinds of tree roots for natural medicines and she uses her knowledge to earn a profit for supporting the needs of the family. 

Her husband is currently a recycling seller - he buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods he deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. 

She has six children: three are married and live away from home, and the other three are single and live under her care. Chea H.'s husband wishes to earn an additional income. Chea H. would like to ask for a loan in order to support her husband’s business to purchase used goods for resale.

loans.use: to purchase used goods for resale

loans.name: Lamosa

texts.en:
Lamosa M. is 39 years old,  married, and has four children. Lamosa owns and operates a business venture, selling bamboo handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Lamosa is requesting a loan for 2,900 WST to purchase additional handicrafts to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business, estimated to be 400 talas or $167 per week, to improve and expand her business.

In 2009, Lamosa  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Lamosa 's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margaret is 26 and married with 2 children. Margaret owns & operates a store  selling food & daily use products in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.

Margaret needs a loan of 1000 Samoan tala (WST) to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or roughly US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Margaret joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Margaret's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim T., 52, is a widow who stays at home to manage her household doing such things as cooking meals, washing clothes, cleaning, and managing cash flow.

She doesn’t have a life partner as she has been divorced from her husband for many years. She currently lives with six children, four of whom are single and two of whom are married. Two of them have jobs as sewing workers and receive a monthly salary. Sim T. often depends on her employed children.

Recently, Sim T. has had a problem with her living condition as her house is broken down and it is not safe to live in. Because of this, Sim T. would like to request a loan in order to build new house.  With the rest of the funds, she will have a well dug for her family to use.

loans.use: to build new house and dig a well for her family

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 52 years old and has six children, five of whom are grown and live on their own. Her youngest child is 12 and still in school. For the last 12 years, Teresa has made a living by growing vegetables, tea, maize and bananas near her home in Kisii, Kenya. She sells all of her produce in a local market, except for her tea, which she sells to the Kenyan Tea Development Authority. Her main problems at the moment are a slow economy and diseases that sometimes affect her crops.

Teresa is applying for a loan for 35,000 KES to buy and insure a dairy cow. She plans to use some of milk it produces at family meals, and will sell the rest in a local market to pay for the education of her youngest child. In the future, she would also like to earn additional money by opening a cereals shop in the local market.

loans.use: To buy and insure a cow

loans.name: Safarbek

texts.ru: Давлатошоев Сафарбек проживает в районе Фархор. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Жена, домохозяйка. Брат занимается растениеводством. Сам он тоже занимается растениеводством. У него большой земельный участок, где он выращивает овощи и сеет пшеницу. Он в основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Safarbek D. lives in the Farkhor region. Aged 30. Married, with two children. Lives together with his parents. His wife is a homemaker. His brother is a farmer. He is also a farmer. He has a big land plot, where he grows vegetables and wheat. He mainly grows vegetables for retail. He has been in this line of work for six years. He is taking out a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock has been a farmer in Kisii Town in South Rift, Kenya where he lives with his family. His farm produces tea, coffee, milk and vegetables which are sold mainly to Kenya Tea Development Authority and Keya Co-operative Society. He is married with eight children, six of them still in school. He works as a builder for additional income.

Enock has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the cow will provide milk for family consumption and to sell to help educate the children. He plans to open a retail shop in the local market to help him subsidize the income from farming and building.

Enock adds that Juhudi Kilimo has helped its clients with farming knowledge through training and the loans have had a great impact on quite a number of families in the area.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zohidjon

texts.ru: Калонов Зохидчон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 35 лет. Он женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Зохидчон предоставляет услугу, такси. Он развозит людей по маршруту Каратог-Турсунзаде. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Zohidjon K. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 35 years old, married, and has four children. His wife is a housewife. Zohidjon provides a taxi service. He carries people on a route between Karatog and Tursun-zoda. He has been doing this work for ten years.  He is taking out a loan to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a better breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 42 years old, is married to Josephine who operates a grocery stall for extra income; together they have five children .He operates a carpentry shop at Kinyanjui road. David has been running this business for five years. 

This is his third loan with KADET LTD and he hopes it will boost his business so that he can meet his customers' demand. He desires to open another shop near the city center.

loans.use: to buy timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Кутбиддинов Дилшод проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 25 лет. Холост. Образование-среднее. Занимается торговлей на рынке. У  него имеется торговая точка, где он продает хозяйственные товары. В этой области более 5 лет. Кредит берет для покупки пульта, батареек и панели телефонов.
texts.en: Dilshod K. lives in Vahdat.  He is 25 years old and single. He has a high school education.  He works trading in the market.  He has a shop where he sells household goods. He has been doing this for more than five years. He is taking out a loan to buy remote controls, batteries, and cell phone covers.

loans.use: to buy remote controls, batteries, and cell phone covers

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 43 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Fely has a Ready-To-Wear (clothing) business in the Philippines. Fely requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy RTW (clothing) to sell.

Fely has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Fely would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 40 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc to sell. 

Gemma has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Gemma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz V. is 59 years old, married, and has four children.  Ma. Luz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan for 14,000 PHP from NWTF, which she will use to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.  Ma. Luz has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.
Ma. Luz aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean, a hardworking entrepreneur, has operated a RTW(clothing) business in the Philippines for 10 years. She also farms sugarcane. Mary Jean, who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF, is now requesting a loan of PHP 29,500 to buy more clothes to sell. She dreams of saving enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros D. is 29 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Milagros has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Milagros is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP from  NWTF, which she will use to buy seasonings such as onions, garlic, etc. to sell.  Milagros has been in this business for eight years.  In the future, Milagros would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonings such as onions and garlic to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 48 years old, married and has two children. For the last 15 years, she has helped provide for her family by working hard in her sari-sari (or variety) store. When she is not working in the store, she also raises pigs as a way to generate additional income for her family. She is applying for a new loan, her eleventh, for PHP 23,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to generate enough income to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eliberto

texts.es:
Eliberto tiene 33 años de edad y es separado. Vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos a cargo. Viven en la zona urbana marginal del distrito de La Victoria en el norte de Perú, el cual no cuenta con agua potable, solo energía eléctrica. La zona donde vive es pequeña y la actividad principal es la agricultura.

Eliberto se dedica a la fundición y producción de ollas. Cuenta con 06 años de experiencia en el rubro. Este negocio le genera muy buenos ingresos. Realiza esta actividad en la parte posterior de su vivienda. Actualmente, su casa no está construida de buena material. Eliberto piensa construir su vivienda de material noble para darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Eliberto cuenta con buenas referencias comerciales y crediticias. Es muy trabajador y bastante entregado a su familia. Trabaja duro para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Eliberto is 33 years old and separated. He lives in his own house with his three children who are in his care. They live in the outlying urban zone of La Victoria district in northern Peru, where there is electricity but no potable water. The area where they live is small and mainly agricultural. Eliberto earns a living smelting and making pots and pans. He has 6 years' experience in this field, which generates very good income for him. He does his work in the area behind his home. 

Right now, his house is not built of good materials. Eliberto is thinking about building his home out of solid building materials so he can give his children a better quality of life. Therefore he thought it best to request a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Eliberto has good business and credit references. He is very industrious and devoted to his family, and he works hard to build a better life for them.

loans.use: to build his house from better materials

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
Evelia tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en el caserío  La Mónicas en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Evelia se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral como patos, pavos y gallinas. Los cria en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Una vez que los  engorda los  comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más de 3 años. El destino del crédito será para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales para que logren un tamaño y peso ideal y venderlos a un mejor precio. Tambien pretende hacer mejoras en su corral para mejor proteger sus animales. Asi podrá incrementar sus inventarios y por ende las ventas. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Evelia, 29, is married and has 3 children. She lives in her own house in the tiny village of La Mónicas in the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area around Piura, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque Region. She lives in the rural part of this district, and doesn't have basic services. 

Evelia raises and sells poultry, such as ducks, turkeys, and chickens. She raises them in a pen behind her house. Once she fattens them up she sells them in the local market. She has done this for more than 3 years. The loan will be used to purchase commercial feed for her animals to help them reach an ideal size and weight and fetch a better price. She also hopes to make improvements to her pen to better protect her animals. That way she can increase the number of birds she has and consequently her sales. For these reasons, she thought it best to request a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase commercial feed for her animals and to fix the pens for her poultry

loans.name: Delvith

texts.en: Delvith E. is married and has six children.  She  works hard to support her family.  She buys and sells bananas in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from a general store.  Delvith is requesting a loan for 29,000 PHP from NWTF, which she will use to purchase more stock of bananas for her banana business.  Delvith has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of bananas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en: Analie is 43 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is still in school. For the last 20 years, she has made a living by making and selling fried fish, and has applied for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more ingredients to cook and sell to her customers. Her goal is to continue working hard and expanding her business so that she can provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a business selling fried fish

loans.name: Chroeng

texts.en:
Chroeng R. is a 37-year-old woman who works as a professional teacher in the province of Kompong Cham. She earns an average income of $2.50 a day from her current job.  Her husband works as a chef and as a rice farmer. This couple is blessed with two children who are still not yet enrolled in school. 

Chroeng R. has problems with her house, which has many broken parts, and doesn’t have enough money to repair it. In order to solve this problem, Chroeng R. has requested a loan to repair her broken house.

loans.use: to repair her broken house

loans.name: Tagaymurod

texts.ru: Курбонов Тагаймурод проживает в районе Фархор. Возраст, 52 года. Женат. Имеет 6 детей. Дети живут отдельно. Сам он имеет средне - техническое образование, инженер. По специальности проработал 30 лет. Сейчас он занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. В этом ему помогает жена. Он в основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Tagaymurod K. lives in Farkhor. He is 52 years old, married, and has six children. His children do not live with him. He has a vocational education as an engineer. He worked in his field for thirty years. Now he works in agriculture.  He rents the plot of land where he grows vegetables. His wife helps him. He primarily grows vegetables for sale. He has been doing this work for six years.  He is taking out a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene  2 hijos dependientes. Vive junto a su familia en un caserio del distrito de Tambogrande, na zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Se dedica a la crianza de ovinos y aves de corral como pavos y gallinas. Los cria en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Una vez que los engorda los comercializa en el mercado local. Ademas cuenta con un pequeño terreno agricola donde tiene sembrado limon el cual cosecha semanalmente  Tiene una antigüedad de mas de 3 años en su negocio. Solicita un credito para la compra de alimentos para engorde de ovinos y aves de corral y para la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón. Desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable, lo que la ayudará mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 42, is married and has 2 dependent children. They all live in a tiny village in the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area around Piura, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region. She lives in the rural part of this district and does not have basic services. 

She raises sheep and poultry such as turkeys and chickens in a pen behind her house. Once she fattens them up, she sells them in the local market. In addition, she has a small farm where she has planted lemon trees which she harvests every week. She has more than 3 years' experience in her business. She is requesting the loan in order to buy commercial feeds to fatten her sheep and poultry, and to buy fertilizers for her lemon grove. She wants to continue investing in her business in order to achieve an adequate income, so she can help improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase commercial feed for her animals and fertilizers for her lemon grove

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a farmer in his hometown of Kitale in Westen Kenya where he resides with his family of six children, all schooling. His farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables with all sold to the local market. Ezekiel gets additional income from his rental houses.

Ezekiel has requested a loan of 51,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income will go a long way in providing basic family needs such as education of the children. He hopes to own four quality dairy cows in future to make his milk production a stable source of income.

Ezekiel points to the high cost of animal feed during dry seasons and to animal diseases as the greatest challenges to the farming business. He remains grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services.

loans.use: to purchase  and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20203050113) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong in Bắc Ninh province.  She is married and has 2 adult children.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  This loan will be her 2nd loan from SEDA.  She  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (20203050113) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2010, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  hỗ trợ tài chính cho các thành viên gần gũi trong gia đình của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and has six children.

Moussa is a blacksmith and he has owned a shop for casting iron repair of cars since 1996. He has a long experience in this field. He has an excellent reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a new hydraulic press machine. He aspires for a better future through good financial returns.

loans.use: To buy a new hydraulic press machine.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin tiene 35 años de edad. Vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos menores de edad en el distrito de Reque en el norte de Perú. La zona donde vive es rural y no cuenta con servicios básicos (agua potable y energía eléctrica). El agua para su consumo viene de un pozo.  Su casa es hecha de material rustico (adobe y calamina). 

Martin se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mas de 20 años. Todo sus cultivos los siembra en terrenos propios que están ubicados en un sector de su caserío. El riego para sus plantas viene del Rio Reque, donde bombea con una pequeña motobomba. El destino del credito es para sembrar un pequeño terreno de zanahoria. Desea comprar abonos y semilla y también pagar la mano de obra tanto para  la siembra y cosecha. Sus productos agricolas los vende en el Mercado de Moshoqueque, un mercado grande y con bastante movimiento. Martin ya ha manejado otros créditos de Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) y los cancelo todos de manera puntual. Su mayor anhelo es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Martin, 35, lives in his own house with his wife and two minor children in Reque District in northern Peru.  The area where he lives is rural and does not have basic services (potable water and electric power).  Water for their consumption comes from a well.  His house is made of flimsy materials (adobe and plywood).

Martin has been a farmer for about 20 years.  His crops all grow on land of his own located in a sector of his hamlet.  Irrigation for the crops comes from the Roque River which he draws out with a small pump.  

The loan will be used to plant carrots on a small tract of land.  He wants to buy manure and seed as well as paying labor costs for the planting and harvesting.  He sells his farm products in Moshoqueque Market, a large market with lots of activity.

Martin has had previous Edpyme Alternativa loans which he paid back punctually.  His greatest wish is to continue investing in his business to increase income and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and seed for his carrot crops.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn V. (20203050012) is a 29-year-old male living in the town of Yên Phong in Bắc Ninh province.  He is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, H. makes and sells general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  

H. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital.  This loan is his 3rd loan from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Nguyễn V. (20203050012) là 29 tuổi nam.  Anh ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Anh ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .
