Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his furniture business

loans.name: Ray

texts.en:
Ray M. is 31 years old and is a mother to four children -- one is single and the other three are married and have already started their new families. She was once married but has been divorced from her husband many years ago. 

In the beginning of 2000, Ray M. built a small store. In her shop she sells snack products, soft drinks, plastic products and other necessary items to the neighbors who live near her house in the village.  

Ray M. hopes to enlarge her business and is applying for a loan to accumulate a larger number of  items to sell. This will allow her to increase her income and ensure her entire family can attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: to increase her store inventory

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
Y. Nguyễn Thị (20203050015) is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Y. Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, Y. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Y. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND per month from these activities.
In 2009, Y. joined Kiva partner, SEDA, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Y. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA. This loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offering. Y. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. The loan will be her third from SEDA. Y. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SEDA
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.use: to purchase tools and other equipment

loans.name: Yanina Deysi

texts.es: Yanina tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene 01 hijo. Vive en casa propia junto a su familia en el distrito de Reque en el norte de Perú. La zona donde vive es rural y no cuenta con el servicio básico de agua potable, solo cuenta con energía eléctrica. El agua para su consumo viene de un pozo. Se dedica a la crianza de animales como pavos y gallinas y el engorde de toros. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el rubro. Cria los animales y  estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Con sus ingresos, Yanina puede ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja como agricultor, con el sostenimiento económico de su familia. Desea ampliar su negocio e invertir en la compra de más animales mayores como cerdos y toros. Tambien desea poner un techo a sus corrales para mejor proteger sus animales del sol. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Yanina, 28, is married and has a son.  She lives in her own house with her family in Reque District in northern Peru.  The zone where she lives is rural and does not have the basic service of potable water; it only has electricity.  Water for her consumption comes from a well.

She raises livestock like turkeys, chickens and cattle.  She has ten years experience in this line of work.  She raises the animals and as they reach good levels of growth she sells them to merchants that tend to visit the area where she lives.  Yanina uses her income to help her husband, who is a farmer, support the family.

She wants to expand the business and invest in the purchase of more large animals like pigs and bulls.  She also wants to roof her corrals to better protect the animals from the sun.  Because of this, she’s thought it wise to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to buy more cattle and repair her corrals.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 49 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells AVON & Natasha products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of AVON & Natasha products to sell.

Marlyn has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the AVON & Natasha products business for 11 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Marlyn aspires to save money to expand her business and send one of her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of AVON & Natasha products to sell.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is a 53-year-old accomplished and hard-working woman from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She lives in a small house in the outlying 'ger' districts of the city with her husband. Her husband is retired. They have two daughters, aged 30 and 32. Their daughters live apart from them. 

Altantsetseg  started running a children’s clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, in 2000. At the beginning stages of her business, she rented a stall at Narantuul from another person who had a rental contract with Narantuul. This was an unstable business situation for her because the middleman could dismiss her at any time. Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract with Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand.

However, in 2001, Altantsetseg had the opportunity to sign a rental contract directly with Narantuul in order to make her business more stable. As a result of her hard work, today she has 1,600,000 MNT in her working capital and she sells children’s clothes. 

Altantsetseg is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT). With this loan, she wants to purchase children’s clothes for spring to resell. She wants to expand her business with this loan and then to be able to improve her four grand-nieces' education.

loans.use: To purchase children’s clothes for spring to resell.

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
Hà Trương Thị (20203050013) is a 30-year-old woman who lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Hà owns and operates a furniture-making business in the manufacturing sector.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  Hà has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 6,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from business activities.

Hà joined SEDA in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She successfully repaid a previous SEDA loan of 7,840,000 VND, which was used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand her business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 8,736,000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw materials to expand her product offerings.  This will be her third loan from SEDA.  Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to expand product offerings in a furniture-making business

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two children, aged 18 and 25, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house, in the outlying 'ger' districts of the city. Her son attends public school while her husband works at a rural company. 

Tungalag supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, with help from her daughter. 

When she first began her business in 2000, she sold her handmade coats of various types at the stall of another person. Now her business has grown so that today her working capital is 3,000,000 MNT and she sells clothes imported from Ereen, a border city of China, as well as her handmade clothes in her stall. During these years, she has been successfully improving her living standards and her business with her earnings. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase clothing materials and she’ll sew coats for spring.

Her 2011 goal is to expand her business with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase materials to sew coats for spring.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan K., 33 years old, is married to Rith Bunthoeun, 41, and both of them are local fishermen. Every day in the early morning, she and her husband go to catch fresh fish using a variety of fishing implements. After fishing, they hurry up and bring their fish by motorbike to the market for resale. In addition, she feeds a few piglets behind her house for additional income.

Chan K. has two single children who still study in public school.  In order to earn more income, Chan K. would like to apply for a loan to buy two cows in order to breed them.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to breed them.

loans.name: Ulziinyam

texts.en:
Ulziinyam is 46-year-old professional seamstress and hard-working woman from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her husband and son in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer 'ger' district of the city. Her son attends primary school while her husband helps her with her business.

Ulziinyam started running her handmade clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, in 2005. 
  
Now her business has grown so that today her working capital is 1,200,000 MNT and she sells her handmade coats in her stall. During these years, she has been successfully improving her living and business with her business earnings. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase materials and she’ll sew coats for spring.

Her 2011 goal is to expand her business with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase materials to sew coats for spring.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is 50 years old and married with five children.  With two children in school, Rodrigo works very hard to provide for the family.

Rodrigo runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, groceries, etc. He has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, sugar, hair extensions, shampoo, etc.

In the future Rodrigo would like to save enough money so he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items for his sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 33 years old, married and the father of three children. He lives with eight family members, of whom only two work.

Ahmad has been the owner of a car painting shop since 2000. He has a long experience in this field going back to when he was a kid. He has an excellent reputation and he is well known in his area.

After benefiting from the old loan, now he is applying for a $2400 loan to buy a car's paint mixing machine. He is aiming to expand his business so he will be able to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a car's paint mixing machine.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 11 children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising livestock and food vending. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more stock for her sari-sari store business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her sari-sari (variety) store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Layana

texts.en:
Layana is a 34-year-old married woman, mother of one child, who works and lives with her small family in Nabatieh. Layana has been selling clothes, accessories, and perfumes since 2008. Layana works from her house, because she likes being a mother and managing her small business, and that's the only way to do both at the same time.

Layana has been an Al Majmoua borrower for six loan cycles. She is a  borrower in good standing, who knows how to invest in her business. She's requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new spring/summer collection. Her clients like visiting her and buying from her, because through coming to her house, they feel as if they are members of her small family and this is what encourages them to support her. She has smart customer care methods that she uses to attract more customers.

Layana hopes to expand her business more through introducing more products to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new spring/summer collection of clothing.

loans.name: Vat

texts.en:
Vat S. is a 41-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer since she was single. In addition, she currently sells fresh fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or that she buys from her wholesale supplier and other fisherman. 

Vat S. runs her business in the market and earns approximately $2.50 a day. Her husband is a local fisherman. The humble couple has three children who are no longer in school and are working with their businesses. Vat S. will use her loan in order to buy a plot of farmland so that she can plant more rice.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for her rice crops.

loans.name: Trương Thị Khuyên's Group

texts.en:
K. Nguyễn Thị (20203050010) is a 26-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. K. is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02).
K. is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, K. works for a brick  factory naer her house. After working  hour, she raises pigs and  chickens. K. has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND per month from  selling raising  products.
In 2009, K. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to buy food for  animal. The loan will be her third from SEDA. K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group
1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.
2.  Trương Thị H. (0) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.

About SEDA
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


K.  Nguyễn Thị (20203050010) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  K.  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa pH..  K.  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, K.  kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, K.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  K.  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  Trương Thị H. (0) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to buy  food for her  poultry

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina C. is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari store in the city of Toledo on the island of Cebu, a part of the Visayas islands of the Philippines. She has been in this business for a year. Divina earns extra income from selling food.

Divina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase goods for her sari-sari. Divina dreams of building and expanding her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
X. Trương Thị (20203050008) is a 22-year-old woman who lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 1 child, an infant. To make a living, X. owns and operates a furniture-making business in the manufacturing sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. X. has been engaged in this business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from business activities.

X. joined SEDA in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. X. has successfully repaid a previous SEDA loan of 6,496,000 VND, which was used to purchase  wood as  materials to expand her product offerings. X. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase . This will be her 3rd loan from SEDA. X. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

X. Trương Thị (20203050008) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 1 trẻ ở độ tuổi nhỏ.  Để kiếm sống, X. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  X. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, X. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2009, X. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  X. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  X. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch.  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase wood as material

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
U. Trương Thị (20203050009) is a 24-year-old woman who lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, U. owns and operates a furniture-making business in the manufacturing sector.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  U. has been engaged in this business for more than 4 years and earns approximately 6,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from business activities.

U. joined SEDA in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  U. has successfully repaid a previous SEDA loan of 6,944,000 VND, which was used to purchase raw materials to expand her product offerings.  U. is now requesting a new loan of 8,736,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  This will be her 3rd loan from SEDA.  U. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

U. Trương Thị (20203050009) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, U. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  U. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, U. kiếm được khoảng 6.000.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2009, U. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  U. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua ngU. liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  U. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase wood as material

loans.name: Kao

texts.en: Kao S. earns a living by cultivating rice crops in the province of Kompong Cham. She has many years' experience in this sector. She always grows her crops at least two times per year. Kao is married to Mr. Soung Art, 41, a mobile construction worker, who earns a profit of approximately $2 USD each day to share responsibility with Kao S. for providing for the family. The couple is blessed with two children who are employed as garment workers and have formal salaries. Kao S. will use her loan to buy a plowing machine to support her farming business.

loans.use: to buy a plowing machine

loans.name: Mrs. Hai Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of thirteen people who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes, all with the common aim of improving their families’ standard of living. Mrs. Hai has been selected B. the other members as the village bank president. She is a widow and has two children who are laborers. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice, some of which she sells, and some of which she uses to support her family.  In addition to farming, she also weaves silk cloth. She has a problem with her field because her soil is infertile. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Hai is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Safae

texts.en:
Safae is a 28-year-old divorced mother who works hard to fulfill her two children’s needs. She struggles to keep them happy and satisfied with her hard work so that they won't need their dad's help. She lives to keep her children in her warm, loving home and within eyesight.

Safae has been selling cosmetics and perfumes for four years. She has been an Al Majmoua borrower for four cycles, and it has been a good experience for her, since the previous loans positively affected her social and financial needs.

Safae is requesting another loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new perfume and cosmetic collections so she will have good and exciting offerings for the summer. She hopes to expand her business and open her own shop instead of going from one place to another to sell her goods.

loans.use: To buy new perfume and cosmetic collections

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en: Mrs. Nhanh was born in 1975.  She is married to Mr. Sareth, with whom she has five children; four are attending a local public school, while the youngest is 2 months old. She is a chicken breeder and a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family.  Her husband is an electrical repairman and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. They try to work hard, yet they earn little income. To improve their condition, Mrs. Nhanh is applying for a loan to buy a cow so she can start a cow breeding business. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Bunnary

texts.en: Mrs. Bunnary was born in 1967.  She is married to Mr. Sarun, with whom she has five children.  One repairs speakers, another is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are studying in a local public school.  She sells coffee, ice, and Khmer cake, through which she earns some income to support her family.  Her husband is a construction worker. At this time, she wants to start a new business, but she does not have enough money to begin. So Mrs. Bunnary is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Luisa's Group

texts.en:
Luisa A. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Luisa is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Luisa is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Luisa owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Luisa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Luisa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Hadijja

texts.en:
Hadijja is a twenty-seven-year-old single mother with one child and  she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after her child and her desire is to educate her child up to university.She has had a retail shop for five years and the business is at its break-even point. Her hardship is limited funds to meet the increasing demand of customers and her vision is to become a wholesaler and buildi a house.

Hadijja needs the loan facility to buy salt, sugar and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy salt, sugar and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey, who was born in 1967, is the mother of six children. Three are employed in garment factories, one is a farmer, and the others are attending local public school. She is married to Mr. Ret. 

Both of them are farmers who own a small piece of land where they can grow rice. They sell some part of the rice and the rest of the rice they keep to support their family. Aside from farming, they own an agriculture machine, and he is a palm juice collector. 

In the rice field, they face a problem because their land is infertile soil. So to improve the crop, Mrs. Srey is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, and with the rest of the loan she is going to buy a cart. 

Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoeun was born in 1973 and she is married to Mr. Phan. They have three children: one is a farmer, one is studying in the local public school, and the youngest is 3 years old. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she can grow rice. She sells some of the rice and keeps the rest to support her family. 

In the rice field, she has faced problems with infertile soil, insects, and its distance from an irrigation system. To improve her rice product, Mrs. Samoeun is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. She appears in the photo with her husband, a fisherman who cuts firewood for selling.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide for rice farming

loans.name: Mot

texts.en: Mot O. is a 50-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Kompong Cham province. She plants a rice crop that is her annual business. Besides this, she also works in the construction field as a requirement worker for extra-income. Her husband also earns money by working as a casual construction worker. Mot O. is looking for a loan to buy a motorcycle in order to ride to her work place. Mot O. has six children, five of whom are single and one is married and lives in their own house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle in order to ride to her work place

loans.name: Ntungo Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Muhammed is a twenty-eight-year-old married man with two children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a member of Ntungo Tukwatanize which, loosely translated, means "we should work together."  As a policy, every member of the group guarantees the other to access credit, however some members did not take the loan but accepted to guarantee their group members.

Muhammed has been a carpenter for five years and he is very proud of his business as he has been able to support his family with the income generated. He has a challenge of limited capital to meet the demands of his customers. 

Muhammed needs the loan to buy timber for his carpentry work.

loans.use: To buy timber for carpentry work.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Mrs. Pha is the mother of two children who are enrolled in local public school. She was born in 1982. She is married to Mr. Chruy and both of them are farmers who owns a small piece of land where they grow rice.  They sell part of the rice and use the rest of the rice to support their family.  They own an  agric machine.  Mr. Chruy is also a fisherman.

In their rice field, they face a problem because their field has infertile soil. In order to improve rice production, Mrs. Pha is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticides. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticides

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married with two children. With both children in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Evangeline has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as cigarettes, sardines, shampoo, rice, bread, etc. 

In the future Evangeline would like to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lakisa

texts.en:
Lakisa is a forty-three-year-old divorced woman with four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. After divorcing her husband who was the family breadwinner, she decided to venture into business in order to sustain the family and achieve her goal of educating her children. She has been in the textile business for twenty-five years starting with a working capital of 100,000 shillings. She now has 2,000,000 shillings.

 Her vision is to set up a boutique, buy a car, land, and build a house. Lakisa intends to use the loan facility to buy men's and women's clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Samon

texts.en: Mrs. Samon, who was born in 1972, is married to Mr. Saroeun. They have three children together and they attend local public school and help their parents’ businesses. She is a chicken and pig breeder who earns some income to support her family, while her husband is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he can grow rice, which is not sold, to support his family.  Other than farming, her husband is a construction worker who does work which is far away from his home. In order to help him reach his work, Mrs. Samon is applying for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for her husband's transport to work.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 38-year-old married father of three: Moustafa (8), Ahmad (7) and Mohamad (3). He's known as Abou Moustafa is his region. Abbas has been selling lupine seeds, beans, and corn for the last 27 years. Abbas was too small when he started working to help in his family's income and expenses.

He drives his carriage through many villages to sell his tasty cooked beans, corn, and lupine. Most of his customers are attracted to him through their kids who are the first advertisement for this tasty thing to eat. 

Abbas's favorite place to sell his goods is beside the seashore where most of the citizens go to spend a pleasurable time with their kids. 

Abbas is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the fifth time, in order to increase his goods, which will lead to an increase in his income. Abbas stated that he'll buy these goods at a very good price which will help in increasing his profit rate. 

Abbas hopes to be able to open a shop beside the seashore so that he can expand his business more and more in the future, and provide his children a happy childhood unlike the one he had.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who have selected Mrs. Sophy to be the group leader. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes that can increase their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Sophy was born in 1973. She owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries in order to earn some profit to support her family. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. In order to improve her business, Mrs. Sophy is applying for a loan to buy more groceries. Her husband, Mr. Yorn, is a palm juice collector and a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where he can grow rice, to not sell, to support his family. She is a mother of ten children, one of whom is an iron welder, while the other two are helping her to sell groceries, the other three are studying in local public school, and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Mrs. Nang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nang, born in 1962, was selected to be village bank president by the nine members that make up this group loan. They will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Nang is a widow with one child who is studying in the local public school. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice. She sells part of the rice crop and keeps the rest to support her family. In addition to farM., she also sells clothes and mosquito nets. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand. So to improve her business, Mrs. Nang is applying for a loan to buy more clothes and mosquito nets for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and mosquito nets for sale

loans.name: Thabita Group

texts.en:
Agnella C. is the leader of Thabita Group and she is the one seated in the photo. Agnella is 30 years old, married, and has four children who are ages 17, 14, 11, and four. Of the four children three are still attending school. 

She has a business of selling blankets, clothes, shoes, and cell phone accessories at her flea market in Gweru. Displayed in the picture are some of her products. She does not have any other sources of income apart from her husband’s; he is also self-employed. Her main challenge is low sales during mid-month. 

Agnella requested this loan through MicroKing for the purpose of buying blankets and shoes for resale ahead of the winter season. She says the extra income from this loan will help in paying for the three childrens' school fees. In the future she would like to own her own house and car.

loans.use: to buy clothes, blankets, and shoes for resale

loans.name: Mr. Raot Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of ten members who will use their portions for different purpoS. to improve their businesS.. Mr. Raot, who was born in 1957, has been selected by the other members to be village bank president. He is a tailor who earns some income to support his family while his wife, Mrs. Nhorn, is a farmer who grows rice on a 1.5-hectare plot of land. They sell part of the rice crop and keep the rest to support their family. In the rice field, they face problems because the soil is infertile. So to improve the rice product, Mr. Raot is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. The couple has two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other is a student.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for rice farming

loans.name: Simons

texts.en: Simons is a thirty-one-year-old married man with one child. He rents a house in Kasese Uganda. He has been in maize milling for two years as an employee. His hardship is power fluctuations and his vision is to own a machine and build a house. Simons intends to use the credit facility to buy a maize mill.

loans.use: to buy a maize mill

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Mrs. Lang who was born in 1952 is a widow with two children, one of whom is a laborer. The other is a seamstress in a garment factory. Mrs. Lang is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she grows rice, not to sell but to support her family. Beside farming, she is a chicken breeder. Although she tries to work hard, she can earn only a little income.  Mrs. Lang would like to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 44, married, and the father of two children Jad (6) and Nadine (3). Ahmad has been working in transportation since 2003; he uses his pickup to transport sand, stones and iron pillars to builders. He also uses it for many other things that need to be transported.

Ahmad wants to improve his business and his pickup is becoming small for the size of the work he's doing. That's why he's requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the sixth time. Through this loan, he can buy a new, wider pickup. 
Ahmad's repayment history is very good, he's a man with a good reputation in his area.

He hopes to give his children the healthiest and securest lives possible.

loans.use: to buy a new pickup to improve his business

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en:
Korpo a 41-year-old widow who lives in the Congo Town area. She has three children between the ages of 21 - 29; the oldest girl is a college student while the others are still in high school and also help with the business. 

Korpo owns and operates a leading food center or eatery where she cooks local dishes. She has been in this business for the past 7 years. 

Korpo is requesting a loan to purchase more food items like rice, beans, oil, etc. for her business but also to do some improvements like painting. She hopes to be an owner of a house and build another restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil and other food items

loans.name: Mrs. Lor Aing Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of thirteen people who will use their portions for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. Mrs. Lor Aing, born in 1972, was selected to be village bank president by the other members. She is a tailor and a pig and chicken breeder who earns some income to support her family while her husband, Mr. Sam, is a boat driver and string maker. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand. So to improve her business, Mrs. Lor Aing would like to apply for a loan to buy more piglets and chickens. The couple has one child who is 4 years old.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and chickens for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and soap

loans.name: Mrs. Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. N. is a village bank president who has been selected by fourteen members who make up this village bank loan. Their portion of the loan will be used for different purposes that can improve their family's standard of living. She was born in 1971. She is a pig breeder who can earn some profit to support her family, and besides this she is also a string maker. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. 

So to improve her business, Mrs. N. is applying for a loan to buy some more supplies to make string to sell. Her husband, Mr. Yoeun, is a construction worker. Through these activities, they support three children who are attending the local public school.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making string to sell

loans.name: Surgeon

texts.en: Surgeon is a twenty-seven-year-old married man with four children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has had a boutique for ten years. He started with 300,000 shillings and now he has a working capital of 3,000,000 shillings. His vision is expanding into a shopping centre and educating his children. Surgeon needs the loan facility to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sadress

texts.en: Sadress is a thirty-one-year-old married woman with four children and  she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the bar/lodge business for two years. She started with a working capital of 250,000 shillings and has now accumulated 4,500,000 shillings as working capital. Her hardship is high employee turnover and  her vision is business expansion and employing skilled manpower. Sadress needs the loan to buy beers to sell.

loans.use: To buy beers to sell.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is a forty-year-old married woman with three children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in clothes for ten years, starting with a working capital of 100,000 shillings and now has three million shillings. Her hardships are low sales and high transport costs and her vision is to own a boutique and build a house. Scovia needs the loan facility to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mrs. Oeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people who have made a village loan group have selected Mrs. Oeun to be their group president. Each will use their portion of the loan I. different ways to improve their businesses. 

Mrs. Oeun was born I. 1976. She is a chicken breeder and a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Thol, is a construction worker. Through this activity, they support three children, two of whom are seamstresses I. garment factories, while the third is studying I. the local public school. 

Although they try to work hard, they make very little income. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Oeun would like to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Edona

texts.en: Edona is a forty-year-old married woman with four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has dealt in cassava flour sales for seven years, starting with 20kgs, and now she sells 60 bags in a month. Her major hindrance is the poor transport network and her dream is to win tenders for supplying big hotels in the region. Edona needs the loan to buy bags of cassava flour for resale.

loans.use: To buy bags of cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mrs. Eng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Each of the thirteen people who have selected Mrs. Eng to be the village bank president will use their portion of the loan for different purposes, in order to improve their family's standard of living. Mrs. Eng is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she can grow crops to sell to earn some money to support her family. Besides farming, she is a chicken and pig breeder. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. 

So improve her situation, Mrs. Eng is requesting a loan to buy more chickens, piglets and pig and chicken food. Her husband, Mr. Sovan, is a construction worker. She is the mother of two children whom are too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy more chickens, piglets and feed for them

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 32 years old, married, and has two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in butchery business for seven years. He started his business with a capital of 200,000 shillings and now has two million shillings as working capital. His hardship is the high cost of cows; his hope for the future is to own a ranch and buy a car. Hussein intends to use this loan to buy cows to slaughter.

loans.use: To purchase cows for slaughtering

loans.name: Sokunthea's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. It is led by Mrs. Sokunthea, who has been selected by the other members. 

Mrs. Sokunthea was born in 1984. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school and one of whom is 2 years old.

She owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries to earn some profit to support her family. She is also a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Chamroeun, is a door-to-door ice cream seller. He is also a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he grows rice to support his family. 

Since her husband’s business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Sokunthea is asking for a loan to buy another ice box. With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy a piglet for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy another ice box

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Mr. Kov Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The nine people who make up this village bank loan will use their portions of the loan for different purposes that can improve their families' standard of living. 

Mr. Kov is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. He was born in 1964. He is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where he can grow rice. He sells some part of the rice and rest of the rice he keeps to support his family. 

His wife is a silk weaver. Through these activities, this couple supports four children, one of whom is a silk weaver while the others are studying in the local public school. 

In the rice field, Mr. Kov faces an obstacle because his field is infertile soil. So to improve his crop, Mr. Kov is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. Mrs. Ra is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. 

She is married to Mr. Nhor and they have two children. One is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other is studying in local public school. 

Mrs. Ra and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice. They sell part of the rice and rest of the rice they keep to support their family. 

Besides farming, Mr. Nhor breeds ducks. But now they face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to support their ducks. So Mrs. Ra is seeking a loan to buy duck food.

loans.use: to buy duck food

loans.name: Myanzi Tukolerewamu Women's Development Group

texts.en:
31-year-old Halima B. has been selling produce for the last twelve years in the Mityana trading center and food market. The happily married mother of four says her business has been growing by leaps and bounds principally due to her hard work, tenacity and organization.

Halima sells mostly coffee, bananas and beans, and the fact that she owns a farm has really come in handy. She says she is able to sell mostly crops she has harvested from her own garden. In this way she has cut down on her expenditures and increased her profits. She says she is able to make weekly profits to the tune of 50,000 KES.

Halima belongs to Myanzi Tukolerewamu Women's Group, Mityana. With this loan, she is going to buy high-grade manure to improve her farming.

loans.use: To purchase high-grade manure

loans.name: Gregoire

texts.en:
Gregoire H. is 45 years old, married, and has two children between 9 and 14 years old. He also takes care of one child who is 12 years old. Gregoire earns a living by selling second hand items, such as sheets and men`s, women's, and children's clothing.  He has been in this business for 20 years. His business is well-organized.  Gregoire works from 7 am to 7 pm every day except Saturday and he employs one person to help him. 

Gregoire is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more second hand items to sell. By expanding his business, Gregoire hopes to earn more profits.  With the profits, he will save for the future and reinvest in the business. Thus, he will create another job for the people in his community.

loans.use: To purchase second hand items to sell

loans.name: Vath

texts.en:
Mrs. Vath was born in 1974.  She is married to Mr. Sambath.  They are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice to sell and earn income as well as to feed their family.  Mr. Sambath is also a cow middleman.  Through these activities, they support two children -- one is a laborer and the other is studying in the local public school.  

Since her husband’s cattle trading business is going well, Mrs. Vath wants to expand it.  To achieve this purpose, she is applying for a loan to add their savings to buy a cow to resell.

loans.use: To buy a cow to resell

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Mrs. Bin was born in 1987. She is the mother of a child who is 1 month old. 

She and her husband, Mr. Bros Pov, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice. They sell part of the rice and rest of the rice they keep to support their family. He is also a motorcycle taxi driver. 

Recently, she wanted to start a new business, but her savings is not enough to support it. So Mrs. Bin is seeking a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Agbuidohoin

texts.fr: Mariée à un chauffeur, Mme G. a 42ans et  04 enfants en charge. Elle est revendeuse de céréales. En 2000, elle a commencé l’activité en s’approvisionnant à Anié et en revendant  au marché d’Akodesséwa (un quartier du Togo).  Elle veut assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants, aider son mari dans les charges du foyer  et avoir plu tard sa propre maison c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des céréales (maïs, haricot, soja) pour pouvoir  revendre et avoir plus de bénéfice.
texts.en: Married to a driver, Ms. G. is 42 years old and has four 4 children in her care. She sells cereals. In 2000, she started her business, buying her supplies in Anié and selling them at the market in Akodessewa (a district of Togo). She wants a better future for her children, supports her husband with household expenses and later she hopes to contribute to buy their own house. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy cereals (corn, beans, soy) in order to resell them and increase her profit.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: C4904 Amahoro Group

texts.en:
Elisabeth is 30 years old and she is single. She is the representative of a group called "Amahoro" in the local language. Elisabeth is the first person on the right in the picture. She owns a small shop that sells beans, sorghum and other goods. She has three years of experience. She employs eight persons in her business as helpers so that her business runs well.

Elisabeth and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more products like rice, cassava, breads, beans and so on.  With the profits, she will build a comfortable house. She also needs a refrigerator which will allow her to create a new business of selling cold soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase more products like rice, cassava, breads and beans to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok is married to Mr. Seng, and they have four children.   One is a laborer, another one is a driver who earns a low salary, and the others are attending the local public school. She and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow rice.  They sell some of the rice and they use the rest for their family.  Her husband is a traditional medicine seller. 

In order to improve her family's living standards, she wants to start a new business.  Mrs. Sok is applying for a loan to buy two cows for breeding.

loans.use: to buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Ayao

texts.fr: Il est couturier de profession. Âgé de 33ans il est marié à une revendeuse et réside à AHLIGO. Mr  Yao a ouvert son atelier en 2008. Il achète les tissus au Grand marché de Lomé et le transforme en rideau  dans son atelier à Bé Château pour revendre après. Ce premier  prêt  lui servira à acheter des tissus pour transformer  en rideau et des accessoires. Il veut avoir sa propre maison, assurer l’avenir de sa famille c’est pour cela il sollicite ce prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Ayao is a tailor by profession. He is 33 years old, married to a retailer and he lives in Ahligo. Mr. Ayao buys fabric at the Lomé Grand Market and makes curtains in his workshop located in Bé Château, which he opened in 2008, and then he sells the curtains.

With this first loan, he will be able to buy fabric to make into curtains and accessories. He is asking for the loan because he wants to have his own house, and to secure his family's future.

loans.use: to buy curtains and accessories

loans.name: Sok Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Sok Heng was born in 1952. He and wife, Mrs. Neang, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice.  They sell some of the rice and they use the rest to support their family.  They are chicken and duck breeders. Through these activities they support four children.  One is a laborer,  two are seamstresses in garment factories, and the other one is studying in the local public school. 

At present, he is facing the problem of his children’s work places being far away from their home. So Mr. Sok Heng is applying for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for his children's transportation to work.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Aguidi Kayissan

texts.fr: Agée de 41ans, Mme Aguidi est mère de 04 enfants et est mariée à un frigoriste. Elle est revendeuse de charbon de bois et de Komm (une nourriture du pays faite à base de maïs). Elle est dans cette activité il ya de cela 10ans, elle achète ses marchandises à Lomé et revend dans sa maison à Adamavo. Vues les conditions  de niveau de vie de sa famille, elle sollicite ce  sixième prêt  pour acheter 05 sacs de charbon de bois et du maïs pour préparer du Komm  afin de vendre pour avoir du bénéfice et s’occuper en partie des charges de la famille.
texts.en: 41 years old, Mrs. Aguidi is the mother of four and married to a refrigeratior technician. She sells charcoal and “komm” (a local dish on the base of corn). She has been in this business for 10 years. She stocks up in Lomé and sells out of her home in Adamavo. Given the life conditions of her family, she is seeking a sixth loan in order to buy five bags of charcoal and some corn for cooking “komm” for sale, so as to be to provide for part of the family expenses

loans.use: to buy charcoal and corn

loans.name: Myanzi Twekembe Women's Group

texts.en:
67-year-old Perusi B. is a happily married mother with eleven kids. She has been selling food in the Myanzi market in Mityana for twelve years now. She mostly sells bananas, cassava, maize, beans, rice, cabbage, etc.

Perusi figured this business would fulfill her desire for a reliable livelihood. Prior to that she was engaged in odd jobs in and around her village. Most of the time, though, she was a housewife and mother to her eleven children. To get into this business took persuasion from close friends and her family, especially her brother.

Perusi says this business generates 180,000 KES monthly in profits. With this loan she says she is going to purchase more bags of maize to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize to resell

loans.name: Kijubwe Women's Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
Joy T. is 52 years old, married and has seven children with three in school. She is also the leader of Kijubwe Women’s Group in Ntungamo. Joy has sold fish from Rubaare market and at other market places for at least 24 years. She usually buys the fish from fishermen and sells them at a profit. She is focused and energetic, which has enabled her to succeed.

Joy is able to make 70,000 UGX from her sales of fish as well as 50,000 UGX from banana sales in weekly income. Before her current business, she sold a local brew, waragi, but she does not regret the move now. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for resale leading to increased prosperity and growth.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: God Is Bless Group

texts.en:
Adama B. is 25 years old and married with two children who are attending primary school. She is the leader of this group. Adama sells earrings, chains, rings, body creams, soaps, etc. and has been doing so for three years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantities to add to her current stock.

Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “God Is Bless” group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 2,000,000 SLL. This loan will be divided equally five ways so that each will be able to invest in her own business.

loans.use: To buy her wares in large quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Bishobire

texts.en: Bishobire D. is 35 years old, married, and has three children.  They live in Ibanda. He has a business of selling bananas from Kitonzi B. He has been in this business for 10 years after saving from the sale of other produce, such as matooke (green plantains), and  from his farm. He is very hard working and works with his spouse selling to the local community. He is able to make 220,000 UGX as monthly income, which has enabled him to provide for their children. His dream is to be able to increase production so that he can increase his revenue. He is requesting a loan to purchase more farm inputs for improved productivity and output.

loans.use: To purchase more farm inputs for improved productivity and output.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more maize, coffee and beans to sell

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mère de 04 enfants, Akossiwa est mariée à un employé au port de Lomé et à 38ans. Elle est revendeuse de chaussures et sacs de friperie. Elle achète au marché de Hédzranawoé et revend devant le domicile de cette dernière.  Elle est dans cette activité il y a de cela 15ans. Elle sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter des chaussures et sacs de friperie vu qu’elle n’a plu assez de marchandises pour  revendre pour avoir de bénéfices. Akossiwa n’a pas  eu de difficulté pour payer le premier prêt.
texts.en: A mother of four, Akossiwa is 38 years old and married to a Lomé port employee.  She sells used clothing and shoes.  She purchases her stock at the Hédzranawoé market and sells it in front of her house.  She’s been working this way for 15 years.  She is asking for this second loan in order to purchase shoes and bags of secondhand clothing, since she no longer has enough inventory to sell to make a profit.  Akossiwa had no trouble paying back her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and secondhand clothing

loans.name: Morie's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Integrated Community Primary School based in Kenema city. This school was founded in September 1999 by D.P Musa-Koken to improve education in the district. The teachers of this institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone,  to seek a loan for 12,900,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, these teachers will be in a better position to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries will not let them do.

This will be the first loan that the teachers of the Integrated Community Primary School are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. Morie S. is the leader of this group.  Morie is 41 years old.  He was born in Gbatorma. Morie is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 18 years. He is married and has 2 children – 1 in primary school and the other in secondary school. Morie has requested a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to pay school fees for his children and to buy house building materials (cements, iron corrugated zincs, etc.).

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children and buy building materials for his house

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en:
Viviane is 54 years old and is married, with seven children between 12 and 22 years old.  Viviane has been running the pub for the past 3 years.  This business is well organized.  She employs 4 people to help her.  Viviane works from 8am to 11pm every day.

Viviane has requested her first loan from Vision Finance Company, s.a,  in order to expand her business by buying new materials and more beer, like Primus, and so on.  With an expansion, Viviane hopes to earn more profits than before.  With this profit, she will be able to buy her own house, pay school fees for her children and save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase new material and more beer

loans.name: Prosper Development Group

texts.en:
Enterprising people who blaze trails as a means of gaining a new lease on life invariably act as role models for many people in societies across the globe. The same can be said of Uganda, which in recent times has seen many enterprising people set up their own businesses and thereby inspiring others. One such person was an aunt to 35-year-old Cissy K..  Cissy has for the past decade been operating a beauty salon business in Mpigi Town. She credits her aunt with a prevailing pep talk that, at length, led her to open up her own new business horizons.

Cissy says hard work, resilience, courage and constant planning have been her stocks in trade. This mother of 4 was previously operating a restaurant.  In addition to her beauty salon, Cissy also operates a modest retail shop business. Weekly, she says the businesses generates for her 100,000 shillings in profit. With this loan, she  says she is going to purchase another hair dryer and more braids to be used in her salon. Cissy is affiliated with Prosper development Group-Mpigi.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer and braids for her salon

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
Farhod sells fabrics for sewing national women dresses at the market. He is married and has 3 children. Farhod has been in this business for 10 years. During this time he has learned that having a large assortment of goods that is on display all the time is the key to success in this kind of business. Farhod's prices are not high, making the goods more attractive to his customers. Farhod would like to borrow $3000 USD to increase his inventory. He hopes to develop this business further and increase his sales. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new fabrics

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is a small business owner from Khujand, Tajikistan. He works to support his family by selling clothing at a busy central market. Naimjon has been in business for about 4 years and makes around $200-$250 per month. Eventually he would like to open a second vending location to increase his sales and profits. 

Naimjon has requested a loan of $3000 USD to add to his working business capital. He has developed a good reputation and credit history with IMON International. We look forward to many more opportunities to assist Naimjon with the success of his business.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new fabrics

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Ministry of Education School in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1961 by the government of Sierra Leone in order to provide quality education to the children of the district.  The school is staffed with 20 teachers and has an enrollment of 400 pupils. 

The teachers of this school have requested a loan of SLL 13,700,000 for the entire group.  This is their first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders.   With the help of this loan, these teachers are in a stronger position to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries will not let them do.

Peter V. is the leader of the group. He is 55 years old. He was born in a village called Buninba. Peter is married and has 4 children – 2 in secondary school and 2 in college. Peter has been a teacher for 7 years. He will use his share of the loan to pay college fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay college fees for his children

loans.name: Abdujalol

texts.en:
K. Abdujalol is married and has children and grandchildren.  He has been selling cattle with his wife and children for more than 15 years. Their help has helped him progress in his business.   Abdujalol works hard to improve his family living and fulfill his fatherly responsibilities.  One of his main needs is the need to purchase more cattle to improve his business. For this reason Abdujalol went to IMON International and requested a loan of $1500 USD. Not only his business will benefit from it, but so will his family. Your support will really help him.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman M. was born in 1980 in Khashtarak village, in the area of Ijevan. He is married and has two children: a daughter and a son. 

Arman works at a construction materials shop as a shop assistant.  At the same time, Arman, his wife and his parents are engaged in animal breeding and land cultivation. On their farm they raise cows, pigs and chickens.  Through these activities, they provide for their family’s needs.

Arman intends to plant a garden which will allow him to increase his family’s income in future. In his farm, he will grow raspberries, apples, pears, potatoes and onions. Arman is asking for a 700,000 AMD loan to plant and to enclose his garden, and to buy the necessary seedlings.

loans.use: to build a commercial fruit and vegetable garden

loans.name: Mamajon

texts.en:
R. Mamajon is 52 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Mamajon is the sole breadwinner for his family, and his only income comes from raising large livestock and selling them at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from farms in the adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. 

Today Mamajon is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd is not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest a loan of 7000 Somoni into his business. In order to obtain this amount, Mamajon has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.
