Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA. is a 28-year-old single man living and working in Saida. BilA. works in a restaurant in order to continue his education. He is a hard worker and  is loved by all his friends. BilA. is a man with good reputation. He is a man who you can depend on.  He works hard to finish his studies in order to open his own business in the future and achieve his goals. 

BilA. is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to pay for his education fees.  This is his second cycle loan with A. Majmoua, the previous loan was used for the same aim.

loans.use: To pay for his education

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. C. is a woman of 38 years, married to Meshack Wekesa and together they have five children. They live in a place called Baharini in Eldoret. Her husband Meshack works as a security guard and helps to bring income to the family and Mary does maize farming.


This will be Mary's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan for the farm by buying maize seeds, fertilizers etc. She will use the income that she will get to buy two hectares of land. 


In the future, she wants to buy a tractor to help with the digging work and to hire to other farmers. Also, she wants to educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds, fertilizers etc

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 37 years old and married . She has been selling shoes and bags for one year, and her business is well-organized. She works from 6am until 7pm every day.  She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She will reinvest the profits in her business and save for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and bags for sale

loans.name: Jalol

texts.en:
Jalol is a farmer, not only devoted to his work but also to being the father of his family. He works hard raising cattle, which he takes out to graze in the early mornings. Without a doubt, it is not an easy task, but the love for his family gives his work reason and meaning. His wife is also engaged in this business. Currently, Jalol wants to improve his situation by increasing the number of his cattle, which in the long run will provide better financial income. If you support him, he will be forever grateful.    
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Marie C.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the KMDEC Pre-school – Moiwo Street, in Kenema city. This school was established in September 1960 by the Kenema District Educational Committee in order to produce quality education in the District. The school is staffed with 46 employees and has an enrollment for 1,230 pupils. 
 
Forty-six-year-old Marie C. C. is the leader of this group of teachers. Marie was born in Bonthe. She is married to a teacher and the couple has four children: two in primary school, one in secondary school and one in college. Marie has been serving in the teaching profession for 26 years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to pay her daughter’s college fees.

loans.use: To pay her daughter’s college fees

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA. is a 24 year-old single man living in Saida.  BilA. owns a clothing shop, which is the main source of living for him and his family.  BilA. is a hard-working man.  He's still young, but he started his own business 3 years ago in order to provide for his family and support them with the major things they  need.  BilA. is responsible for his brothers.   He is requesting a first-time loan from A. Majmoua to pay for his brothers' education expenses.  
He's very proud of them and also proud of himself, because he's trying hard to give them what he couldn't afford for himself: education!

loans.use: to pay for his brothers' education expenses

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen J. R. is 37 years old, married, and a mother of five children.  They live in Mosop in the outskirts of Eldoret.  She does maize farming in that area and has been in this business for eleven years.  She earns a monthly income of KES10,000.

This will be Hellen's third loan from KADET LTD.   She has repaid her other two loans successfully, and with this loan she plans to buy another piece of land for farming.  In the future, she plans to educate her children to the highest level, and also to continue with maize farming.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds, fertilizers etc

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine M. lives in Ijevan. She is married and has three daughters, all of whom are married. Her youngest daughter's family lives with her. 
Karine worked as an economist in a building organization until it closed in 1993. Then Karine and her husband rented a space in the Ijevan Central Market and started selling clothing and shoes. For the past 18 years, thanks to her profits, Karine has paid for her daughters’ educations and organized their weddings. A few years ago, with her business’ income, Karine supplied free sweets - chocolate, candy and cakes - to Ijevan School N4. 
This is Karine’s 10th loan from Nor Horizon and 2nd loan from Kiva.  She is seeking a 250,000 AMD loan to buy spring clothes and shoes from Yerevan.

loans.use: to buy spring clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas is a 35 year-old married man, living in Saida with his wife and 2 children. Firas has manufactured prefabs since 1995. His business is developing well, but the country's financial situation provides only slow growth or no growth at all.

Firas is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time in order to buy necessary tools for his business. He also needs the loan to pay expenses for his wife's giving birth to his third baby.  Firas is very excited about this baby and believes that everything will go fine after his birth.   Deep inside he feels that this baby will bring happiness, health, and love for his family, in addition to improving his business.
Firas hopes to expand his business through more marketing.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools for his business, and to pay for his wife's giving-birth expenses

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El señor Feliciano F., tiene 78 años de edad, es separado, vive en  la ciudad de Caacupe, distante a unos 60 kilómetros de la ciudad capital Asunción. Tiene 4 hijos y 2 hijas, todos sus hijos  son mayores de edad e independientes.
El Señor Feliciano vive en el barrio San Blas y en su domicilio cuenta con taller y local de venta de sus productos de artesanía en cuero desde hace más de  15 años.
Por más que el señor Feliciano tenga 78 años es fuerte y sigue trabajando en la artesanía con su hijo mayor. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cuero para fabricar más y  poder cumplir con un pedido grande que tiene.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva porque si obtiene el crédito será de gran utilidad para su actividad ya que mediante ello podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y a la vez aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Feliciano F., age 78, is divorced. He lives in the city of Caacupe about 60 kilometers distant from the capital city of Asunción. He has 4 sons and 2 daughters. All his children are adults and independent.

Señor Feliciano lives in the San Blas neighborhood. For more than 15 years he has had a workshop and store in his house selling his handcrafted leather products. Although Señor Feliciano is 78 years old, he is strong and continues working leather with his oldest son.

He is applying for the loan in order to purchase leather for making more products and to be able to fulfill a big order that he has. He is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva because if he obtains the loan it will be very useful for his business since it will give him the means to be able to satisfy the demand from his customers and, at the same time, increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase cured leather.

loans.name: Peter Mbuthia

texts.en:
Peter has been in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last seven years. He is 33 years old, married to Florence Wangari, and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD., by his friend, and this will be his third loan. He repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorcycle.

In the future, Peter hopes to buy a pickup truck which he will use to transport goods to and from the market.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en:
Khadra is a 50-year-old lady who has three children. She has a hobby creating and organizing plastic plants and flowers as decorations.  

Two years ago Khadra took a loan to start a small home-based business making this kind of decorations and selling them. Over these two years, her business has grown and gained a good reputation in the neighborhood.  She also started to give courses to teach how to make such things. 

Now Khadra is applying for a second loan in order to open a special independent store to sell her handmade decorations (plastic plants and flowers).

loans.use: To open a store of her own to sell her handmade decorations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is currently engaged in a business selling charcoal and bread. She is 45 years old, married, with seven children and only one goes to school.

 Margret took out a loan to stock more charcoal and paste to sell. She hopes to pay her children's school fees with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more charcoal and paste to sell.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 30 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 5 years old. She sells clothes. She has been in business for three years and has two employees in her shop to help her. She works daily from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m.

Antoinette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more clothes to sell. With her additional profits, Antoinette will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 34 years old and is married without children. Christine sells shoes in her market, and her business is well-organized. Christine employs one person to help her and she works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day. She has ten years of experience.

Christine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes for sale. With the profits, Christine will reinvest in her business, satisfy her customers and save for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja O. lives in Imereti Region, village Persati. He is 50 years old and lives with his wife. The only source of income of the family comes from agricultural activities: they own five milk cows and produce cheese, which is sold on the local market. They also grow strawberries on a 300 sq meter plot of land. They harvest on average 100 kg of strawberries per year and sell them on the local market. 

The family also runs a bee-keeping business: they own 35 bee-hives and bee colonies. 300 liters of honey are gathered and sold annually. With the requested amount Elguja will purchase the following items:  parts for bee-hives frames, equipment for production of beeswax, and some joiner’s (carpentry) equipment.  

Due to this investment, Elguja will be able to reduce his production costs for the wax plates by 30% and the cost of production of the bee-colonies by 50%. This will positively influence family income. With the increased income Elguja will purchase additional bee-colonies and expand the family’s business.

loans.use: to purchase parts for bee-hive frames, equipment for production of beeswax, and some joiner’s equipment.

loans.name: Basem

texts.en: Basem is a 30-year-old, single man who lives in Nablus. He owns his own barber shop in Nablus. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to renovate the décor of his shop. He believes by doing so, he will attract more customers and increase his business.

loans.use: To renovate the décor of his shop.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is an ambitious 18-year-old lady; she is married with one child. She started at a very young age to develop her skills in knitting, sewing and embroidery, and that’s when she found her passion for doing embroidery on clothes and all kinds of covers (tablecloths, pillow covers, etc.)

She started her own business (home-based) four years ago and it is still running, But because the high demand for her work, Eman applied for a loan to buy an embroidery machine that can help her do her work more quickly to be able to cover all of her customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine that can help her do her work more quickly.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
La sra. Angelina R. nació en la ciudad D. Belen en el año 1943, luego se mudó a la ciudad D. Luque, donD. posee su vivienda actual y su residencia familiar.
Tiene dos hijos mayores D. edad, es jubilada y tiene un copetin en su domicilio, ella se dedica a esto desD. hace muchos años, pues es el mayor ingreso económico que poseen, gracias a esto pudo mantenerse ella misma y a su familia.
Opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desD. el año 2003 logrando aumentar su ingreso gracias a los créditos obtenidos anteriormente.
Por ello deseas obtener otro préstamo, ya que la señora Angelina desea invertir su dinero a la compra D. mercaderias y artículos comestibles para su negocio (productos a granel, bebidas, golosinas, etc.)
texts.en:
Angelina R. was born in the city of Belen in 1943.  She then moved to the city of Luque where she currently lives in her family residence.  She has two adult children, is retired and has a small snack bar in her home.  She’s been in this business for many years because it’s the major source of income they have.  Thanks to it she was able to support herself and her family.

She’s been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2003 managing to increase her income thanks to the previously granted loans.  Because of this she’d like to get another loan because Angelina wants to invest her money buying merchandise and foodstuff for her business (bulk items, beverages, snacks, etc.)

loans.use: to buy bulk foodstuffs, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Apec Al Ouma Ngor Group 1

texts.fr:
Apec Al Ouma groupe 1 est une association de 13 femmes qui habitent dans la même localité de Ngor et appartiennent a la même association Al Ouma. Le groupe 1 est membre du guichet de Ouakam depuis juillet 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 2 200 000 frs. Les membres du groupe évoluent toutes dans le secteur du commerce(vente de produits locaux, fruits de mer,poissons, légumes, tissus,petit déjeuner ou diner,et d'autres produits divers). Elles pratiques des activités séparées.
Elles sont représentées par madame Ndiaply S.. Elle exerce la vente de produits locaux et de fruits de mer. Elle capitalise une expérience de 5 ans dans son activité. Elle a choisi son activité dans le but de se procurer des revenus afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et aussi éviter le chomage. L'argent emprunté a renforcé ses fonds de roulement pour l'achat des produits locaux et fruits de mer pour revendre.

Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 
 
Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas), Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children. They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.
 
Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in $2 USD per week. Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients
texts.en:
Apec Al Ouma Group 1 is an association of 13 women, all living in the same district, Ngor, and members of the same Al Ouma association. Group 1 has been a member of the Ouakam credit union since July, 2010. The group is asking for a loan of 2,200,000 francs. The group members all work in commerce (selling local products, seafood, fish, vegetables, fabric, breakfast, dinner or other consumer products). Each member operates her business independently of the other group members.

They are represented by Ms. Ndiaply S.. She sells local produce and seafood, building on five years’ experience in the business. She chose this work in order to earn income to help meet her family’s needs and to avoid being unemployed. The borrowed funds will reinforce her working capital for buying local produce and seafood for resale.  

Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas), Al Ouma has expanded its mission to work with adults as well as children. They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.

Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members. Members typically put in $2 per week. Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients.

loans.use: to purchase local produce and seafood

loans.name: Gladyse

texts.en:
Gladyse is 44 years old and is married, with one child who is four years old.  Gladyse sells various foodstuffs in her business, such as sugar, breads, biscuits, tomato sauce, bonbons, etc.  Gladyse has had her business for 1 year.  Her business is open from 8am until 7pm every day. This business is well-organized. 

Gladyse has requested a loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand her business by purchasing more foodstuffs, like sugar, rice, cooking oil, and so on.  With this profit, she will be able to build her own house and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods, like sugar, biscuits, tomato sauce, bonbons, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: C4909 Urukundo Group

texts.en:
Dorothe is 23 years old and is married. In this family, only Dorothe works. Dorothe is a businesswoman selling beans and cassava, sorghum and so on. Dorothe is the leader of this group which is called "Urukundo". The group has seven persons, six women and one man. Dorothe is the second person on the left.

Dorothe and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products such as beans, cassava, etc. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as beans, cassava, sorghum etc.

loans.name: Namutamala Women's Group-Mpigi

texts.en:
41-year-old Emmanuel K. is a retail businessman who operates in Mpigi Town. He is married with five cheerful kids who are all in schools in Mpigi district. 

Emmanuel has been in this business for the past 12 years and he says the credit goes to his wife who has supported him financially and morally since he began. Weekly he says this business generates 80,000 shillings as profit. He says he is requesting this loan to purchase more retail goods to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more general merchandise goods to resell.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice J. is a single woman of twenty-seven years.  She has two children and they live in Kaplelach in Eldoret.  She does maize farming in the area.   She has been doing this for two years now and gets a monthly income of four thousand shillings.

This will be Loice's second loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer.  With the income that she will get, she plans to start a retail shop. 


In the future, she wants to continue farming and also to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 30 years old and is married with two children between the ages of 5 and 6. He has been a motorbike taxi driver with 10 year's experience. He transports people every day from 6am until 10pm.

Jean Pierre has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy essential materials for his motorbike. With this profit, he will pay school fees for his children and save for his future.

loans.use: To buy essential materials for his motorbike.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La Sra. Nancy está casada con el Sr. Agustín y tienen 1 hija que está cursando la escuela primaria.
Nancy tiene una farmacia en su casa desde hace varios años. Ella es muy conocida en su barrio por sus conocimientos hacia los medicamentos, ya que también realiza primeros auxilios.
Ella se inició en otro trabajo donde trabajó como farmacéutica y con el correr de los años decidió abrir su propio negocio.
Su marido es camionero y con los ingresos de su profesión le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Hemos confiado en Nancy en otros créditos anteriores y ha cumplido con total cabalidad con sus compromisos.
Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor, por eso solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de medicamentos que puedan abastecer la demanda.
texts.en:
Nancy is married to Agustín and they have 1 daughter who is in primary school. Nancy has had a pharmacy in her house for several years. She is very well known in her neighborhood for her knowledge about medications, since she also does first aid. She started at another job where she worked as a pharmacist and after a few years decided to open her own business. Her husband is a truck driver and the income from his profession help with the household expenses.  

We have trusted Nancy with other previous loans and she has totally met her committments. She is a very responsible person who wants to get ahead. She has a jovial and enterprising spirit and that is why she is asking for a new loan to buy medications to meet demands.

loans.use: to buy various medications.

loans.name: Mamia

texts.en:
K. Mamia lives in the village of Vedidkari, Martvili District. He has a greenhouse where he grows red and black roses. At the moment he has 2,700 rosebushes. Each bush bears on average 2-3 roses. He sells them to retailers. 

Mamia started this business eight years ago. The greenhouse is already old and needs renovation. The requested amount will be used to replace damaged glass and plastic. This will allow him to maintain the required temperature in the greenhouse. It will positively influence the quality of the flowers and thus their price as well. 

Mamia hopes that his income will increase. He plans to reinvest in the greenhouse. Also, he wants to renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase glass and plastic for greenhouse renovation.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne C. M. is a hardworking 30 year-old lady.  She is married to Alex Kipngetich Kosgei and together they have four children, aged eleven, nine, seven, five, and three years.  She has been a farmer for about 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES.20,000.

Everlyne has applied for her second loan of KES.67,000 from KADET LTD.   She intends to buy fertilizer, maize seeds, and wheat seeds. She plans to use the profits from the expanded business to start a second business of dairy farming, which is also very marketable in this area.

Everlyne hopes to grow her business and become a leading local investor.  She would like to see her children realizing their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, maize seed and wheat seed.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is 25 years and is single. Jerome sells cooking oil, water, tomato source, juice, cassava flour, rice etc. His business is well- organized. He is open from 5am until 8pm every day and has five year's of experience in his business.

Jerome has requested a loan from kiva lenders in order to purchase more goods. With this profits, Jerome will reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as cooking oil, tomato souce, water, juice etc.

loans.name: Peter Ndungu

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  He is 53 years old, married to Peris Mumbi, and they have five children.  
He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Women In Active Group

texts.en:
50 year-old Mustafah M. has been a member of Women in Active group for the last 17 years. The father of 5 was previously in a retail business. He says he used savings from his retail shop to start up his current poultry business, which he operates from Mbiko in Lugazi. He says being steadfast, hardworking, and dynamic have been his calling cards.  He says his profits total up to 480,000 shillings a month. Mbiko is a favorite stop-over for refreshments for many people traveling from Eastern Uganda and Kenya. 

Mustafah says he is going to use this loan to purchase more mash for his chickens and also more chickens to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more mash for his chickens and also more chickens to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis K. B. is  fifty-eight years old, married, and a father of six children.   They live in Mosop, in the outskirts of Eldoret town.  His wife, Naomi, is a teacher. Francis is a maize farmer who grows maize for commercial purposes.  He has been in this business for twenty years and gets a monthly income of  KES.10,000.

This will be Francis' fourth loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to use the entire loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. With the income from the produce, he plans to pay school fees for his children and buy veterinary medicine for his livestock.

In the future, he would like to be a dairy farmer and also educate his children to the highest level.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and  fertilizers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currently in a business of selling onions and tomatoes. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom go to school. Rose will borrow a loan to stock more onions and tomatoes to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more onions and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Peter Munoro

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He is 33 years old, married to Lucy Wangui and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of Kshs 50,000 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Needs Ld-Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 42 year old widow without children. Her business is well-organized. Jacqueline sells shoes. She employs one person and her business is open from 8am until 7pm every day. Jacqueline has had one year's experience in this business.

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes to sell. With the profits, Jacqueline will expand her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 32 years old and lives in the village of Khuntsi, Martvili District. He is married and lives together with his wife, parents, and children. Koba’s parents are retired. His daughter is three years old and his son is eight years old; he goes to school. 

Koba's family is actively involved in agriculture. They have four cows, one bull and four goats. They produce cheese and sell it once a week on local market. The family also owns a 0.8 ha plot of land where they grow maize and nuts. 

With the requested amount Koba will purchase an additional cow so the family will be able to produce and sell more cheese. This will positively impact the family’s income. Koba plans to renovate his house with the increase in income to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 36 years-old and a widow with one child who is 16 years-old.

Julienne has had a restaurant business for the past year.  She employs five people who help her. Julienne works from 6am until 8pm.  After realizing that she lacks sufficient equipment to offer a quality service in her restaurant, she is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company s.a in order to expand her business by buying new materials.  With this expansion, Julienne hopes to get more profit than before and through that profit, she will be able to buy her own house and save for her child.

loans.use: to buy new materials

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia L. C. es una mujer que vive en Cartagena de Indias, ciudad amurallada, colonial y turística; en este ambiente de playa, brisa y mar,  Claudia  tiene varios negocios; ella inició en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace alrededor de 15 años y ha recibido 22 financiamientos, su primera actividad vinculada fue una pequeña venta de mercancías mediante catálogos, o guías especializadas de productos, pero inspirada por la actividad de sus padres,  que también formaban parte de los programas de la Fundación, adicionó a su actividad la venta de refrescos como cervezas  en un pequeño enfriador, que aún conserva y también agregó la producción de congelados, actividades que aún siguen generándole ingresos  y con las que sueña  hacerlas crecer cada día más para continuar aumentando su calidad de vida. En la actualidad su pequeño enfriador no se encuentra en condiciones óptimas y ella necesita reemplazarlo rápidamente, por eso recurre a su credikiva con el cual comprará un nuevo enfriador, para  pasar de la venta de cerveza a l detalle, a proveer en mayor cantidad a las tiendas y otros establecimientos. Su sueño es comprar su casa propia, porque en la actualidad vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes siempre la han apoyado en cada uno de los propósitos de su vida.
texts.en: Claudia L. C. is a woman who lives in Cartagena de Indias, a walled in, colonial and tourist city. In this ambience of beach, breezes and ocean, Claudia has several businesses. She started in the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo more than 15 years ago and has received 22 loans. Her first activity was realted to a small business selling merchandise via catalogues, or specialized product guides. Then, inspired by her parents activities, also a part of the Foundation's programs, she added the activity of selling beverages such as beer from a small cooler. She still has the cooler and has added making frozen food. These activities continue generating her income and she dreams of making them grow more every day to continue improving her quality of life. At present, her small freezer is not in the best condition and she needs to replace it soon. That is why she is turning to Kiva loans to buy a new cooler to go from small scale beer selling to providing a larger quantity for stores and other establishments. Her dream is to buy her own house, because at present she lives in her parent's house. They have always supported her in all of the things she has done in life.

loans.use: to buy a cooler

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Sifa is 37 years old and is married with three children who are between the ages of 1 and 10. She sells Bord lotion in her shop. Her business is clean. She is open from 7am until 9pm every day and has three years of experience in her business.

Sifa has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more Bord lotion to sell. With the profits, Sifa will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more Bord lotion to sell

loans.name: Grace Wangui

texts.en:
Jane has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 22 years.  She is 45 years old, married to John Chege and they have three children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy one bull and two sheep.

In future, Jane hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy one bull and two sheep for farming.

loans.name: Elyse

texts.en:
Elyse is 27 years old and is married with one child who is 2 years old. He has been a motorbike-taxi driver for one year. He transports people every day from 6 a.m. until 12 p.m.

Elyse has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy essential materials for his motorbike. With this profit, he will pay school fees for his child and save for his future.

loans.use: to buy essential materials for his motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is currently in a business of selling greens. She is 28 years old, married, with 4 children and all of them go to school. Flora borrowed a loan to stock more greens to sell. She hopes to pay her children in school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more greens to sell.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Oñondivepa” se formó gracias al deseo de mejoramiento y superación del nivel de vida de sus integrantes ya que son personas de muy escasos recursos.
El grupo pertenece a la ciudad de Asunción, capital de la República.
La señora Jorgelina N. se dedica a la venta de bebidas desde hace años, en especial las bebidas sin alcohol, ya que además de ser un negocio para su familia la tienda de bebidas, también desean promover la venta de bebidas no alcohólicas, y combatir de a poco el nivel de jóvenes adictos en la ciudad asuncena.
Ella solicita el crédito para adquirir más bebidas, pues al abastecer mejor su negocio habrá mayor cantidad de clientes y por ende mayor ganancia económica para su familia.
Todas las integrantes del comité son mujeres sacrificadas que desean superarse cada día por el bienestar general de sus hijos, maridos, parientes y por ellas mismas.
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa group was formed because the members wanted to improve their standard of living. They are poor people with low incomes and live in the city of Asunción, capital of Paraquay. 

Señora Jorgelina N. has earned her living selling drinks for many years. The drinks she sells are mostly non-alcoholic since this is a family business, and as well Jorgelina wishes to promote non-alcoholic drinks in an effort to combat the number of young addicts in the city.

She is seeking a loan to buy more drinks for her store, thus increasing the number of customers and earning more money for her family.

All the members of the group are hardworking women who wish to improve the wellbeing of their children, husbands, relatives as well as their own.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and juices

loans.name: Josiah Mwangi

texts.en:
Josiah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 48 years old, married to Jane Wanjiru and they have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Josiah hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Marie Regine

texts.en:
Marie Regine is 49 years old; she is married with eight children between 6 and 20 years old. Marie Regine also takes care of one dependent relative who is 20 years old. She and her husband work hard for the development of their family. Marie Regine owns a business selling bananas and Irish potatoes. Her business is well-known, as well as organized. She employs one person as a helper. Marie Regine has three years of experience. The hours of her business are from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day.

Marie Regine has requested her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more bananas and Irish potatoes. Marie Regine will be able to earn more profit. This profit will help her to satisfy her many Irish potato customers, to reinvest in her business and to save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 27 years old and married with two children between the ages 1 and 4 years old. Her husband is a driver. Angelique has been selling bananas and Irish potatoes, as shown in the picture, for two successful years. She currently employs one person and she operates her business from 8am until 9pm every day except Saturday.

Angelique has requested a loan through Kiva's partner, Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more bananas and Irish potatoes to sell. She hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to reinvest in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas and Irish potatoes for sale

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es: La señora Shirley es comerciante; ella tiene una tienda donde comercializa al por mayor plásticos y el crédito lo requiere para la  compra  de cristalería para así poder tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a su clientela. Con los ingresos que obtiene logra cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Vive en casa de su madre en la zona de El Gran Poder de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y no tiene hijos. La cliente se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se el otorgaron y pudo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Shirley is a businesswoman who runs a wholesale store selling plastic goods. She is seeking a loan to buy glassware and thus offer her customers a greater variety of products. With the money she earns, she will be able to pay for the needs of her family. 

Shirley lives in her mother’s house in the area of El Gran Poder, in the city of La Paz. She is single and doesn’t have any children. She is very pleased with the loans that she has received; they have allowed her to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy glassware (glasses, cups, jugs etc)

loans.name: Adrien

texts.en:
Adrien N. is 25 and is married. 

He has been selling various products such as rice, sugar, cosmetics and so on. His business is open from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. 

Adrien has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products for his store like rice, sugar, cosmetics and so on. With the profits, he expects to save money for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various products such as rice, sugar, cosmetics and so on

loans.name: Jëf Jël Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité JËF JËL est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MEDINA FALL2

Madame DIODIO D. (accroupie à droite de la photo avec une écharpe noir et levant le pouce) est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 05 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de fruits de saison (des oranges, mandarines, mangues etc.)

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroitre ses revenus financiers

Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group Jëf Jël is made up of 15 women who all come from the same neighborhood. They came together as kin and as neighbors.  The group is a member of the Medina Fall 2 "Banc Villageois" (village bank).

Ms. Diodio D. (pictured at right in the photo wearing a black scarf and giving a thumbs-up) is the group leader.  She is married and a mother of seven.  She also cares for five additional children entrusted to her by close friends and relatives.

She runs a small business selling seasonal fruit (oranges, mandarins, mangos, etc.).

With this new loan, she plans to increase her inventory in order to raise her profits.

Her ultimate goal is help cover her family’s financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en: Jean Pierre is 36 years old, married, and has two adopted orphans. He has been a motorbike taxi driver for one year. He transports people every day from 5 am until 12 pm. Jean Pierre would like to use this loan to buy a new motorbike. With his profit, he will build his own house for his family and save for his future.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Katussenvule Development Group

texts.en: T. Lilian, 50, with raised hand, is a poultry farmer based in Namiliya-Lugazi. She has been engaged in this business for the past 18 years. Previously this mother of five was in agro sales and farming. Monthly her business makes profits of shillings 200,000 and she says with this loan she is going to purchase more mash for her poultry. She is affiliated with Katussenvule Development Group.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken mash for her poultry

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: La señora Mónica es comerciante, ella tiene un puesto de venta  de juguetes en la zona 16 de Julio, vende los días jueves y domingos su esposo se dedica a la tapicería; el crédito lo requiere para la  compra  de peluches y juguetes. Con los ingresos que obtiene logra cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Vive en casa de su madre en la zona Ballivián de la ciudad de El Alto, es madre soltera  y  tiene un solo hijo. Es cliente nuestra desde el año 2008.
texts.en:
Señora Mónica is a businesswoman who has a stall selling toys in the 16 de Julio area on Thursdays and Sundays. Her husband is an upholsterer.

Mónica is seeking a loan to buy soft toys and other types of toys. With the money she earns, she will be able to pay for the needs of her family. She lives in her mother’s house in the neighbourhood of Ballivián in the town of El Alto. She is a single mother and has a son. She has been a client of this organization since 2008.

loans.use: to buy more toys and increase stock

loans.name: Rosalie Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Rosalie Fatou F. est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 1996. Elle est veuve et mère de 03 enfants qui sont autonomes. Mais elle a la charge de 05 de ses petits fils. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de boissons conditionnées en bouteille (des jus de fruits, de la bière, etc.)

Elle est détentrice d'une licence de vente. elle pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années. 

Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa nourriture et celles de ses petits enfants et de payer les factures d'eau et d'électricité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalie Fatou F. became a member of the Banc Villageois of WANGO in 1996. She is a widow and the mother of three independent children. 
She does however look after five of her grandsons. 

She runs a small business selling bottled drinks (fruit juices, beer, etc.). She holds a sales license, and has been engaged in this activity for several years.

Her goal is to be able to feed herself and her grandchildren, and to pay the water and electricity bills.

loans.use: to buy bottled beverages for resale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es casada y tiene 3 hijos en las edades D. 37 a 43 años, aunque conoce su negocio hace muchos años, con la ayuda D. sus hijos y con sus ahorros lo ha reactivado porque compró vitrinas,  las surtió y ahora tiene nuevamente a su fiel clientela; en la actualidad necesita surtirla mucho más con productos que aún no tiene, como juguetería, ropa para damas y papelería en general, razón por la cual ha acudido a su primer  credikiva, con el cual planea incrementar  su capital D. trabajo, pues tiene la convicción D. que sus ventas se aumentarán,  porque justamente surtirá  su negocio en una época D. mucha rotación D. mercancías,  porque se acerca el dio D. las madres y sus clientes le han encargado muchos artículos, además D. que ella organizará todos sus productos,  D. una manera que impacten la visión  D. sus clientes y con ellos  el interés, el deseo y la acción D. compra. Su mayor desafío ahora es el crecimiento D. su negocio y ella está convencida que con la ayuda D. Dios y sus esfuerzos D. trabajo lo logrará, mientras tanto su negocio reporta buenos indicadores financieros, que debe sostener para lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
Isabel is married and has three children aged between 37 and 43. Although she has had her business for many years, with the help of her children and her savings she has revived it by purchasing display cabinets and better stocking it.  She now has her loyal customers back.

Isabel currently needs to stock her business a lot more with products that she still doesn't have such as toys, ladies' clothes and stationery products.  For this reason, she is requesting her first Kiva loan which she plans to use to increase her working capital.  She is certain that her sales will increase because she will be stocking her business during a period when she experiences a good turnover of merchandise.  Mothers' Day is approaching and her customers have ordered many items from her.  Isabel will organize her products in a way which will draw her customers' attention.  This will gain their interest.  They will want to buy and they will buy.  Isabel's biggest challenge now is growing her business and she is certain that, with God's help and her own efforts, she will be successful.  In the meantime, her business has good financial indicators which she must maintain in order to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy toys, ladies' clothes and stationery products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: La señora Sofía es comerciante ella tiene un puesto de venta de juguetes en la zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, vende los días jueves y domingos  y también ella vende en distintas ferias de la ciudad; su esposo es chofer en el Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa; el crédito lo requiere para la  compra  de peluches, pues es un artículo que se vende muy bien y a buen precio. Con los ingresos que obtiene logra cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Vive en casa de sus suegros en la zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, está casada y no tiene hijos. Es clienta de IMPRO desde el año 2008.
texts.en:
Sofía is a saleswoman.  She has a toy stall in the 16 de Julio market, in the city of El Alto, where she makes her sales on Thursdays and Sundays.  She also sells at different street markets in the city.  Her husband is a driver and belongs to the Eduardo Avaroa union.

Sofia needs a loan to buy stuffed toys since they sell very well and for a good price.  Sofia uses the income that she makes to cover her family's needs.  She lives in her in-laws' home in 16 de Julio neighborhood, in the city of El Alto.  She is married and does not have any children.  She has been a client of IMPRO since 2008.

loans.use: to buy stuffed toys to sell on her stall in the 16 de Julio market in El Alto

loans.name: Abou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abou S. est un homme marié de 32 ans et père d’un enfant, qui vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni, relevant de  Sikasso  (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Très tôt, il a abandonné l’école pour mener  des activités économiques notamment l’achat et la vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès d’un de ses cousins.
Avec une expérience de 8 ans, Monsieur Abou S. maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité. 
Pour obtenir un fonds pouvant satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle, il décida d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à sa première expérience, pour acheter, 4 tonnes de céréales.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages environnants et effectue sa vente au marché de Bougouni, à une clientèle composée de la population locale.
Monsieur Abou vend ses céréales au comptant, en détail et à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice, il compte agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Abou S. is a 32-year-old married man and father of one child. He lives with his wife and their child in the district of Massablacoura, city of Bougouni, in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

He quit school at an early age to pursue commercial activities such as the purchase and sale of grain. He learned this business from one of his cousins. 

With eight years of experience, Mr. Abou S. has a good command of his activity and is in high demand. In order to obtain the capital necessary to satisfy his customer base, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is his first loan with the MFI, and he plans to buy four tons of grain. 

He stocks up in Bougouni and surrounding villages, and sells his merchandise at retail to the locals, at the Bougouni market, for cash or credit.

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which he will use to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase grain for resale

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka P. and her husband live in the village of Meskheti, Tskaltubo Region. They have two boys – 18 and 17 years old. Maka’s mother-in-law lives with them as well. She is retired. 

Maka is 38 years old. She has been engaged in agricultural activities for 20 years. The main source of the family income is agriculture. They have three milk cows and produce cheese, which is sold in a grocery shop. Also the family owns a plot of land with an area of 1 ha, where cucumbers and greens are grown. 

With the requested amount, Maka plans to cultivate that plot, sowing greens and cucumbers. Maka hopes that after proper cultivation she will have a good harvest and her family’s income will increase. Part of the increased income will be reinvested in the business and the other part will be used to cover her sons’ study fees.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Roció Lizette

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Roció Lizette, le está haciendo falta reparar las paredes y pintarlas, además de colocar piso en el interior de la casa. 
Solicita un préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejorar y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de las reparaciones. 
Doña Roció Lizette es madre soltera ya que quedó viuda  y  tiene tres hijo de mediana edad, bajo su responsabilidad a quienes les quiere dar un patrimonio seguro y una mejor vida.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo y que los gastos de su familia los cubrirá con la pensión que recibe.
texts.en:
Roció Lizette's home needs some walls repairing and painting.  It also needs flooring to be laid inside.  Roció Lizette is requesting a loan since she doesn't currently have the money she needs to make these improvements and pay the workman who will carry out the repairs.  

Roció Lizette is a single mother as she is widowed.  She has three children in her care who she would like to provide with a safe patrimony and a better life.  She plans to repay her loan with the income that she makes from her job.  She will cover her family expenses with the pension that she receives.

loans.use: to carry out some work inside her home

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La señora Norma es comerciante de peluches al por mayor y menor  vende los días jueves y domingos en la ciudad de El Alto; su esposo trabaja en una tienda como vendedor; el crédito lo requiere para la  compra  de peluches y juguetes de plástico para aumentar su mercadería y atender a sus clientes. Con los ingresos que obtiene logra cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto; es casada y tiene  un hijo. Con los anteriores créditos ella aumentó su capital de trabajo y es cliente de IMPRO desde el año  2008.
texts.en:
Norma sells stuffed toys wholesale and retail.  She makes her sales on Thursdays and Sundays in the city of El Alto.  Her husband works in a store as a salesman.

Norma requires a loan to buy stuffed toys and plastic toys in order to increase her stock and serve her customers.  She uses the income that she makes to cover her family's needs.  Norma lives in her parents' home in 16 de Julio neighborhood, in the city of El Alto.  She is married and has one child.  She used her previous loans to increase her working capital and has been a client of IMPRO since 2008.

loans.use: to buy stuffed toys and plastic toys to sell on her stall in the 16 de Julio market in El Alto

loans.name: Alou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alou Traoré est un homme marié de 32 ans et père de 5 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son père dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, très vite il commença des activités génératrices de revenus. Il a tenté plusieurs activités, mais sans succès.C’est ainsi qu’il décida de mener des activités d’achat et de vente de poissons de mer qu’il a appris auprès de son ami. Avec une expérience de10 ans il maitrise bien son activité.
Pour obtenir un fonds de commerce, il décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 20 cartons de poissons de mer.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et la vente se fait au marché de Torakabougou.
Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. Il est à son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
Avec ce prêt il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il compte rembourser les intérêt du prêt, améliorer son entreprise et aider son père à assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Alou Traoré is a 32-year-old married man and father of five children. He lives with his wife and children in his father’s home in the district of Torakabougou, in Bougouni.

He did not attend school, but started to earn a living at an early age. He attempted several activities without success. He eventually became involved in the purchase and sale of fish, a trade learned from his friend. With ten years of experience, he has a good command of his activity. 

In need of working capital, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to purchase 20 cartons of fish. He stocks up in Bamako and conducts his sales at the Torakabougou market. His clientele is composed mostly of women. 

This is his second loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having repaid the first one without problems. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which he will use to pay the interest on the loan, improve his business, and help his father with the family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase condiments

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La señora Elena se dedica a la elaboración de masitas y también prepara almuerzos; el crédito lo requiere para comprar un equipo buffet para mantener la comida caliente y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos familiares.  Vive en casa en alquiler ubicada en al zona de Villa Fatima de la ciudad de La Paz, es divorciada y  no tiene hijos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2008.
texts.en: Elena's business is making pastries.  She also makes lunches.  She requires a loan to buy a hot plate to keep her food warm and offer a better service to her customers.  This is Elena's source of income that she uses to cover her family expenses.  She lives in a rental house in the Villa Fatima neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  She is divorced and doesn't have any children.   She has been a client of IMPRO since 2008.

loans.use: to buy a hot plate to keep the food that she prepares for her customers warm

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: La señora Lucy se dedica a la comercialización de peluches por mayor y su esposo es empleado publico; el crédito lo necesita para poder adquirir mayor cantidad de peluches y juguetes, para su venta y así generar mejores ingresos que le permitan cubrir los gastos de su familia y empezar a ahorrar. Vive en  casa propia ubicada en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Es casada y tiene nueve hijos. Lucy es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2008.
texts.en: Lucy sells wholesale stuffed animals and toys for a living  Her husband is a public employee.  She needs the loan so she can get more product to sell and generate more income so she can pay household expenses and start to save.  She lives in her own house in the 16 de Julio area of the city of El Alto.  Lucy is married with nine children.  She has been a client of IMPRO since 2008.

loans.use: to buy toys and stuffed animals to sell.

loans.name: Maravillas Group

texts.es: El nombre de este grupo es MARAVILLAS, en honor a que todas son devotas del Señor de las Maravillas de Puebla en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes y es la sexta vez que pide un prestamo. La señora CECILIA F. G., es la Presidenta del grupo, ella tiene 40 años de edad, estudio unicamente la secundaria ,es casada y tiene tres hijos (18,17 y 12 años). Se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos; es conocida por sus compañeras por una persona responsable y que ha salido adelante ante la adversidad, siendo originaria de esta comunidad ha progresado constantemente, el prestamo lo requiere para comprar utencilios para su negocio y tiene pensado más adelante con las ganancias que obtenga incrementar su negocio y poner un local y vender jugos y cocteles de frutas. Observaciones, la señora que no se ve bien en la foto se llama Alejandra C..
texts.en:
The name of this group is “Maravillas” (Miracles) in honor of the fact that all of the members are devotees of the Señor de las Maravillas in Mexico.  The group is comprised of nine members, and this is the sixth time they are requesting a loan.

Cecilia F. G. is president of the group.  She is 40 years old, and she only has a middle school education.  She is married, and she has three children (ages 18, 17, and 12).  She sells Mexican snacks.  Her colleagues know her to be a responsible person who has gotten ahead when facing adversity.

She has been constantly progressing.  She needs the loan to buy utensils for her business.  Later on she plans to use her earnings to expand her business.  She will set up a site to sell juice and fruit cocktails.  

Note that the woman that you cannot see well in the photo is Alejandra C..

loans.use: to buy utensils for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria es comerciante y tiene un puesto de venta de Cd`s y venta de ropa ubicada en la zona 16 de julio de la ciuada de El Alto; su esposo le ayuda con esta actividad; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de CD`s y DVD`s para poder ofrecer a sus clientes, de esta manera cubren los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa de sus suegros ubicada en la zona 16 de julio en la ciudad de El Alto,  es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. La señora se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos  que se le otorgaron y esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Maria is a merchant, and she has a stand where she sells CD’s and clothes.  The business is located in the 16 de Julio zone in the city of El Alto.  Her husband helps her with this business activity.  

She needs the loan to by CD’s and DVD’s in order to be able to offer them to her customers.  This is the way they cover the family’s expenses.

They live in her mother and father in-law’s house, which is in the 16 de Julio zone in the city of El Alto.  She is married and has four children.  

She is very happy with the loans that have been granted, and this is the second time that she has requested a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy CD's and DVD's to sell at her stand in the city of El Alto

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Teodoro S. Jiménez es un hombre muy trabajador que desde hace 27 años, el dedica al mantenimiento de llantas de automóviles como lo es parchar, poner aire y la venta de neumáticos de segunda mano. El se encuentra agradecido por el apoyo brindado este será su segundo crédito el cual utilizara para terminar la construcción del proyecto anterior y así ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teodoro S. Jiménez is a very hard-working man.  For 27 years he has been repairing automobile tires.  His business involves patching tires, filling them with air, and selling second hand tires.

He is grateful for the support that has been provided.  This will be his second loan, and he will use it to finish a construction project that he started previously.  That way he will provide his family with a better quality of life.
.

loans.use: to finish construction

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: La señora Julieta tiene un puesto de venta de ropa en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto, su esposo es chofer  y es socio propietario en el sindicato de movilidades  Eduardo Avaroa; el crédito lo necesita para el aumento de mercadería como ser ropa para toda edad. Estas actividades son  la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. Es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Ernesto Torres de la ciudad de La Paz. Su relación con IMPRO data desde el año  2007.
texts.en:
Julieta has a clothes stall in the 16 de Julio neighborhood, in the city of El Alto.  Her husband is a driver.  He owns his own vehicle and is a member of the Eduardo Avaroa drivers' union.

Julieta needs this loan to increase her merchandise.  She will buy clothes for all ages.  This work is Julieta's source of income which she uses to support her family.  She is married, has two children, and lives in her own home which is located in Ernesto Torres neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  She has been working with IMPRO since 2007.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell from her stall in the city of El Alto

loans.name: Alianza Group

texts.es:
El comité Alianza nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando también en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
Este comité está integrado por mujeres que se distribuyen tanto por la ciudad de San Lorenzo como de Capiatá, fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas.
La Sra. Fidelina F., presidenta del grupo, tiene 29 años, ella es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora, se dedica a la venta de ropas, es muy activa y amable, por eso posee una gran cantidad de clientes, pues quedan muy satisfechos con su trato además de la calidad de los productos que ofrece.
Hoy día, solicita el crédito a Kiva para adquirir abrigos, pantalones, medias y bufandas, pues desea poder tener muchas mercaderías que ofrecer en esta estación de frío, próxima a invierno.
texts.en:
The Alianza (Alliance) committee was born after much effort and with the help of another committee that was also working in the city of San Lorenzo. The present committee is composed of women who are distributed throughout the cities of San Lorenzo and Capiata. They chose as their principal objective the growth of each member.

Fidelina, president of the group, is 29 years old. She is an enterprising and innovative woman who sells clothing. Fidelina is very active and friendly and, for this reason, has a large number of customers who are very satisfied with how she treats them, in addition to the quality of the products she offers.

Now, Fidelina is requesting a loan through Kiva to acquire coats, pants, hose, and scarves. She wants to be able to obtain a lot of merchandise to offer during this chilly season, just before winter.

loans.use: TO BUY SEASONAL COATS, PANTS, STOCKINGS, SCARVES, ETC., TO SELL

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza C. Martínez y su esposo son una familia muy unidad que ven por el bienestar de sus hijos a los cuales quieren ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Esta pareja cuenta con 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar por lo que en este momento requieren de un préstamo para utiles escolares y pagar las colegiaturas de la institución educativa en la que en este momento cursan el año. Así de esta manera seguirá ofreciendo a sus hijos una mejor educación para que en un futuro obtengan una carrera académica.
texts.en: Lorenza C. Martínez and her husband form a very close family that looks out for their children's well-being and quality lifestyle.  This couple has three school-aged children and therefore are in need of a loan to buy school supplies and pay for tuition at the school where the children are enrolled this year.  This will allow them to continue their education in order to have a career in the future.

loans.use: To pay for school tuition and supplies

loans.name: Otoños Group

texts.es: El grupo se llaman OTOÑOS porque a las integrantes del grupo les gusta esa estacion del año, consideran que es el tiempo de cosechar los frutos, para literatura representa la vejez y para ellas la vejez es un sinonimo de sabiduria, en esta epoca ya se deja sentir lo frío de la siguiente estacion, se ubican en el Estado de Hidalgo, el grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes entre ellas se encuentra la señora  Alberta M. O. la cual tiene una estetica desde hace 13 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar productos de belleza, ya que tiene muchos clientes y le solicitan muchos peinados y cortes porque les gusta como las atiende y la habilidad para realizar los cortes de cabello. Con este prestamo ella se siente muy feliz ya que podra apoyar en los gastos economicos de su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called "OTOÑOS" because most of its members enjoy the autumn season.  For them it is a time for harvest, and in literature it represents old age, which to them is synonymous with wisdom.  In this season one begins to feel the cold from the following season.  

They are located in the State of Hidalgo.  The group is comprised of 9 members among whom is Mrs. Alberta Mejía O. who has been running a beauty shop for 13 years.

She is requesting a loan to buy beauty products since she has several customers who ask for different hairstyles and cuts.  They like how she treats them and how she cuts hair.  She is very grateful for the loan since it will help her take care of some of the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La señora Verónica se dedica a la venta de almuerzos y su esposo es empleado público; el crédito lo usará en la compra de insumos como arroz, papa, fideo, aceite, azucar, verduras y otros insumos para preparar los almuerzos para sus clientes. Esta actividad, unida a la de su marido, es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. Es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona  San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. La cliente esta muy satisfecha con los préstamos que le otorgamos ya que pudo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Verónica is in the food catering business and her husband is a civil servant.  She plans to use the loan to buy ingredients such as rice, potatoes, pasta, oil, sugar, vegetables and other items to prepare lunch meals for her customers.  This business and her husband's employment are the source of income for supporting her family.

She is married and has three children.  They live in rental property in the San Martín area in the city of La Paz.  She is very satisfied with the loans she has received so she could improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es: La Silvina L. Domínguez es una mujer muy emprendedora que desde hace 1 año opto por poner un negocio en su misma vivienda, para tener un ingreso para sus gastos familiares.  La tienda es de abarrotes es denominada “Estanquillo Hernández” en la que ofrece variedad de producto para el consumidor como lo son los refrescos, botanas, tortillas de maíz, leche y mas. Esta es su única fuente de ingreso por lo que pide el apoya para comprar mayor producto para surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Silvina L. Domínguez is an enterprising woman who, a year ago, decided to set up a business in her own home to generate income to cover household expenses.  The grocery store is called "Estanquillo Hernández" and offers a variety of consumer products such as softdrinks, snacks, corn tortillas, milk, etc.  This is her only source of income, so she is in need of a loan to buy more products to stock the store.

loans.use: To buy products for her store

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba T. is 27 years old. He comes from the village of Kumistavi, Tskaltubo District. He lives with his family – his parents, grandfather and brother. Koba’s parents and grandfather are retired. 

The primary source of income for Koba’s family comes from agricultural activities. In particular, the family has two cows, whose milk is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold on the local market. They also own seven beehives and get 100 liters of honey annually. Also the family has a vineyard and is engaged in wine production. The wine is sold in the village, among the villagers. 

With the requested loan, Koba plans to start up a small bakery, where different types of bakery products will be made and sold in the village. Koba has worked in a bakery as a hired employee and he has sufficient experience in this business. According to his estimations, his bakery will be profitable and he will be able to support his family better. Part of the increased income will be spent on family well-being and another part will be used for expansion of the bee-keeping business; additional beehives and bee-colonies will be purchased.

loans.use: to purchase materials for start-up of a small bakery.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio M. Z. y su esposa son una pareja muy trabajadora dispuesta a ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Anteriormente donde el vive no pasaba la tubería del drenaje por lo que tuvo que construir una fosa atrás de su vivienda para que todos los desperdicios cayeran  ahí, la colonia donde el vive ya cuenta con drenaje, por lo que ahora requiere tapar la fosa para instalar su propia tubería y realizar sus conexiones con el drenaje de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Sergio M. Z. and his wife are a hard-working couple who want to provide the best they can for their children. 

Before, there was no sewage system where he lives so he had to put in a septic tank behind his house.  Now that the residential area has installed a sewage system he must cover the septic tank and install a drain pipe to connect to the city sewage system.

loans.use: To cover the septic tank and install a drain pipe

loans.name: Nelsa Leticia

texts.es:
la sra. Nelsa Leticia P. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en la colonia Luis Andres Zuniga de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa y se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal y joyas, sus dias de operación son de lunes a domingo, tiene un alto movimiento en la venta de joyas, especialmente anillos de mujer.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de joyas de plata, enchape de oro y plata, chancletas, ropa de verano, shampoo, lociones, perfumes, aceite para piel, acondicionador para pelo, gel para pelo, crema para la cara.
en estos dias las ventas son buenas ya que se aproxima la semana santa y las personas que viajan compran muchos de estos productos.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y asi tener buenas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nelsa Leticia P. is 45 and lives in the Luis Andres Zuniga housing development. She sells jewelry and products for personal use Mondays to Sundays. She has a high sales volume of jewelry, especially women's rings.
She will use this loan for the purchase of silver jewelry, gold and silver veneer, flip flops, summer clothing, shampoo, lotions, perfumes, body oil, hair conditioner, body gel, and face cream.
These days, her sales are good since we are approaching Holy Week and those who travel buy many of her products.
Her goal is to make her business grow in order to make a good income, which she needs to cover her household costs.

loans.use: to purchase silver jewellry, gold and silver veneer, flip flops, summer clothing, lotions, perfumes, body oil, hair conditioner, body gel, and face cream

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La señora Silvia tiene un taller de serigrafía con la ayuda de su esposo, que es el arte de impresión en cualquier material. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de acrílicos, tela, pintura, pinceles, para su negocio, que es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. Es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona de las Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que Silvia obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Silvia, with the help of her husband, has a silk screening workshop. Silk screening is the art of printing on any material. She needs this loan for the purchase of acrylics, fabric, paint, and paintbrushes for her business, which is her source of income for maintaining her family. She is married, has three children and rents a home in the Las Pampahasi zone of the city of La Paz. This is the first time that Silvia has received a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to purchase acrylics, fabric, paint, brushes, and other items for her silk screening workshop.

loans.name: Lorenzo Leobardo

texts.es: El señor Lorenzo Leobardo se dedica a la compra de carros usados que ya no funcionan con el fin de obtener alguna ganancia, el trabajo que realiza  Leobardo es quitar pieza que sirve para venderla a otras personas a un bajo precio que necesitan una parte para su automóvil que esta descompuesto y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar una nueva. Por tal motivo Lorenzo recurre a esta institución para comprar un automóvil que le ofrecen para seguir con su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Mr. Lorenzo Leobardo buys used cars that no longer work in order to make an income. He removes the parts and sells them at a low price to those who need the parts for their broken-down cars and do not have enough money to buy a new one. Lorenzo has turned to this institution in order to buy a car, which will allow him to continue with his business and make a better income.

loans.use: to purchase a car to sell its parts

loans.name: Trabajando Unidas Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “TRABAJANDO UNIDAS”

Lucia como toda madre es una muy trabajadora, años atrás cuando sus hijos aun eran pequeños ella se esforzó para darle lo mejor que pudo, darle educación y comodidades, ella se dedicaba a la venta de comida cerca de su casa, todos los días iba al mercado a buscar los insumos para su menú del día, en la actualidad ella también se dedica a la venta de comida y a la vez también a la venta de pollos los cuales cría en el segundo piso de su casa y los vende a modo de pedidos de sus clientes ya conocidos, ella solicita el préstamo para hacer la compra de sus insumos al por mayor, y con el ahorro de ello podrá comprar alimento para sus pollos.
Lucia pertenece a la alcancía comunal “TRABAJANDO UNIDAS”, que se caracterizan por ser responsables, todos ellos se conocen ya que son vecinos desde muchos años atrás, cada una en sus respectivas familias han dado lo mejor di, y en su mayoría ellos sueñan con cumplir con sus hijos y hacer que sus negocios sean duraderos y rentables.
texts.en:
"Trabajando Unidas" ["Working Together"] Community Bank

Lucia, like all mothers, is very hard-working. Years ago, when her children were small, she worked hard to give them the best that she could- to give them an education and comforts. She sold food near her home, and would go to the market every day to look for items for her daily menu. Now, she sells food, as well as chickens that she raises in the second floor of her home. She sells them on order to her customers and acquaintances. She is requesting this loan for the wholesale purchase of basic materials, and with her savings she will be able to buy food for her chickens.

Lucia belongs to the "Trabajando Unidas" ["Working Together"] community bank. They are responsible people, all of whom know each other since they have been neighbours for several years. Each one has given the best of herself to her family, and the majority of them dream of seeing their children grow up and having long-lasting and profitable businesses.

loans.use: to purchase items for selling food; the purchase of rice, mixed vegetables, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Laura Emperatriz

texts.es:
la sra. Laura Emperatriz J. tiene 55 años de edad, vive en la colonia Luis Andres Zuniga de la ciudad de tegucigalpa y se dedica a la venta de zapatos, carteras, bolsos y productos de catalogo para uso personal como cremas, lociones, perfumes, desodorantes, shampoos, jabones, cosmeticos, lapices labiales, esmalte para uñas, etc.
Laura trabaja de lunes a sábado, para conseguir sus productos, Laura compra mercadería en los EEUU, su hijo que vive alla se los compra y se los manda mensualmente.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de zapatos, carteras y bolsos para dama y  productos de catalogo.
su meta es poder comprar cada vez mas para tener mas productos y por ende mayores ganancias.
Laura nos comento que se siente feliz ya que todo le a salido muy bien y espera que sea mejor.
texts.en:
