Mrs. Laura Emperatriz J. is 55 and lives in the Luis Andres Zuniga housing development in the city of Tegucigalpa. She sells shoes, wallets, bags and personal-use items from a catalogue, such as creams, lotions, perfumes, deodorants, shampoos, soaps, cosmetics, lipsticks, nail polish, etc.
Laura works from Monday to Saturday. In order to acquire her products, Laura buys merchandise from the US. Her son, who lives there, buys them and sends them to her monthly.
She will use this loan for the purchase of shoes, wallets and bags for women, and catalogue products.
Her goal is to be able to buy more each time, in order to have more products and, in the end, a better income.
Laura tells us that she is happy and that things have always gone well for her, and she hopes they will go even better.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, wallets and bags for women, and products from a catalogue

loans.name: Luis Francisco

texts.es:
Don Luis francisco tiene 38 años de edad y 10 años de dedicarse a su actividad que es chinamero de fiestas, la mayor parte de su tiempo viaja y su familia queda en su casa ya que su negocio requiere mucho tiempo, debes en cuando su esposa y sus dos hijos lo acompañan y le ayudan en su negocio.  El señor llego hasta primaria.
Don Luis se entero de la Fundación  por medio de su esposa la cual ella también es comerciante, este es el primer crédito que solicita ya que el siempre ha trabajado con sus ahorros, Don Luis con el crédito piensa comprar un inflable con forma de castillo para los niños ya que solo  ofrece carruseles, y no tiene para niños.
El desde hace 20 años se dedica a chinamero pero desde hace 10 años se decide independizarse y comprar su equipo, empezó por un monto de 500,000.00 colones lo cual compro un carrito de churos de ahí vino el nombre del negocio ¨Churros Papillo¨.
Como el pasa muchos días fuera de su casa por andar viajando el se levanta temprano y   empieza acomodar y limpiar los carruseles, abre como a las 3 de la tarde y cierra el negocio como a las 11 de la noche. Don Luis la meta que tiene es cambiar un camión ya que es muy pequeño para transportar su equipo de trabajo. Es un señor responsable, y trabajador el crédito podrá dar un ingreso más a su negocio y tener una calidad de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Luis, 38, has been a carnival rides operator for ten years.  He spends most of his time traveling and when he does so his family stays home since his job requires a lot of time.  Sometimes his wife and two children go with him and help him with the work. He finished elementary school.

Luis found out about the Fundación through his wife who’s also a merchant.  This is the first loan he’s asked for since he’s always worked with his savings in the past.  Luis plans to use the loan money to buy an inflatable bounce room shaped like a castle for children because he currently only has merry-go-rounds and doesn’t have any for children.

He’s been in this line of work for 20 years but he’s only been independent for the last ten when he bought his own equipment.  He started out with 500,000 colones that he used to buy a snack cart and this is where the name of the business, “Churros Papillo,” originated.

Because he spends so much time away from home traveling he rises very early and starts to clean and organize the merry-go-rounds.  He opens around 3pm and closes the business at around 11 at night.  

Luis’ goal is to replace the truck he has to transport his equipment because it’s too small.  He is a responsible, hard working man.  The loan will allow him to have more income and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an inflatable castle shaped bounce room for children.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: La señora Eva elabora una serie de dulces para sahumerio (sahumerio es un acto ritual que se practica normalmente cuando se compra una casa o una movilidad para que no haya problemas en el futuro y consiste en encender una pequeña fogata con los insumos del sahumerio); esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo requiere para comprar harina, azúcar, colorantes, para la preparación de los dulces. Es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de las San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en: Eva's business is making sweet treats for 'sahumerio' ('sahumerio' is a ritual act that is normally carried out when somebody buys a house or a vehicle to ensure that there will be no problems with it in the future.  It consists of lighting a small bonfire with the 'sahumerio' supplies).  This activity is Eva's source of income with which she supports her family.  She needs a loan to buy flour, sugar and colorings for preparing her sweet treats.  Eva is married, has three children, and lives in her own home which is located in San Martín neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to buy flour, colorings and sugar for making special sweet treats which are used in 'sahumerios' (ritual offerings)

loans.name: Pikria

texts.en:
Pikria T. lives in the village of Kvishilori, Tskaltubo District. She is 23 years old and is married. She lives with her husband, children and mother-in-law. They have three children:  a four-year-old daughter and a one-year-old daughter and a three-year-old son. 

The family has three milk cows, whose milk is used to produce cheese which is the main source of income for the family. The cheese is sold on the local market by Pikria. She also makes dried persimmons and sells them on the market. 

With the requested 1,000 GEL Pikria wants to buy a bull, which will help her to till the land and grow some vegetables.

She hopes that this will increase the income of the family and she will use her increased income for the well-being of her children and of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a bull.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put in flagstone.

loans.name: José Marcos

texts.es: El José Marcos O. González es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, desde hace 10 años el adquirió su vivienda de interés social que por lo regular en esta ciudad este tipo de viviendas son muy pequeñas. José preocupado por el bienestar y confort de la familia el desea construir un cuarto mas en la parte de enfrente para tener mas espacio. Para poder realizar su proyecto necesita capital para comprar lo necesario para comenzar su construcción.
texts.en:
José Marcos O. González is a very responsible, hard working man. About ten years ago he acquired his house through a Public Interest Housing program. As is customary in his city, houses of this type are very small. 

Since Jose is concerned with the well being and comfort of his family he wants to construct an additional room on the front of the house so they will have more space. To carry out this project he needs capital to buy the necessary materials to begin construction.

loans.use: To build a room on the front of his house.

loans.name: Naydia

texts.es:
la sra. Naydia G. L. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la colonia Luis Zuniga de la ciudad de tegucigalpa y se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosmeticos y productos de uso personal, Naydia se levanta todos los dias temprano para salir a vender su mercaderia, trabaja de lunes a domingo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de  calsonetas, camisetas, trajes de baño, blusas, faldas, lociones, cremas, cosmeticos, shampoo, acondicionador, jeans.
desea tener variedad de productos para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes, ahorita tiene un pedido de ropa para verano con el cual obtendra buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Naydia G. López, 41, lives in the Luis Zuñiga neighborhood in Tegucigalpa.  She sells clothes, cosmetics and personal use items.  Naydia rises early every day to go out to sell her merchandise.  She works Monday through Sunday.

She will use the loan to buy underwear, t-shirts, bathing suits, blouses, skirts, lotions, creams, cosmetics, shampoo, conditioner and jeans.

She wants to have a variety of products available to cover all her customers’ needs.  She currently has a pending order for summer clothes that will produce good profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina desde hace 11 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, accesorios para el hogar y juguetes. Esta actividad la realiza para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, aunque su esposo es pensionado de EUA, ellos trabajan juntos para tener mejor calidad de vida. Este crédito que solicitan es para invertir en el negocio como compra de ropa y accesorios para ofrecer a sus clientes mejor calidad y variedad.
texts.en: For 11 years, Martina has been engaged in selling used clothes, household accessories, and toys for children.  She carries out this business in order to be able to help her husband with the household expenses.  Though her husband receives a US pension, they work together in order to have a better life.  The loan she is applying for is for investing in her business by purchasing clothing and accessories in order to offer her customers better quality and variety.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and new toys to sell.

loans.name: Imedo

texts.en:
Imedo P. is 23 years old and comes from the village of Partskhanakanebi, Tskaltubo District. He is married and lives with his wife and parents. The whole family is actively involved in agricultural activities. The family grows greens on a plot of land with an area of 1,000 sq. meters. In the winter period, greens are grown in a greenhouse owned by the family; its total area is 400 sq. meters. In the summer period, the greenhouse is used for growing tomatoes. The greens are sold to local wholesalers. The harvested tomatoes are sold at Kutaisi (nearby town) market. The family also has a milk cow and a calf. 

With the requested amount, Imedo plans to purchase plastic and wooden materials for the construction of a new greenhouse. When he has two greenhouses, he will be able to grow more greens in the winter period and more tomatoes in summer. That will significantly increase the income of the family, which now amounts to 650 Laris per month. 

Imedo hopes he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family with the increased income.

loans.use: to pay for plastic and wooden materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Wassilétou

texts.fr: Madame Wassilétou à 31ans. Elle est mariée à un conducteur de taxi-moto et est mère de 03 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales. Wassilétou  a démarré l’activité en 2003 et s’approvisionne au marché de l’intérieur et revend dans le marché d’Agoé. Elle veut assurer l’avenir de ses enfants, participer en partie à la charge de la famille, s’épanouir, c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter des céréales et du charbon.
texts.en: Madame Wassilétou is 31 years old and married to a motorbike taxi driver with whom she has three children. She sells cereals for a living. Wassilétou entered this trade in 2003 and sources her goods from inland, selling them in the Agoé market. She wishes to provide for her children's future, see to her family's needs, and fulfil her potential. She is therefore seeking her first loan in order to buy cereals and coal.

loans.use: To purchase cereals and coal

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
La señora Gisela es comerciante. Su esposo es chofer. El crédito lo necesita para la reparación del sistema de frenos. Esto le ayudara a que su trabajo sea más seguro para  los pasajeros. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. 

La señora Gisela es casada, no tiene hijos y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz. La cliente esta muy satisfecha con los préstamos que le otorgamos ya que mejoro su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gisela is a merchant, her husband is a driver.  She needs the loan to repair the brakes.  This will help her work be safer for her passengers.  This is her source of income for family support.

Gisela is married but has no children.  She lives in her parents’ house located in La Paz’s San Martin neighborhood.  She is very satisfied with the loans we grant because they improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to service her vehicle.

loans.name: Ginelba

texts.es: La señora Ginelba se dedica a la venta de cd`s. Su esposo es chofer. El crédito lo necesita para la reparación del motor. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. La señora Ginelba es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de las San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. Es su cuarta vez que presta de Kiva y se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos. Pudo mejorar la calidad e vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ginebra sells CDs and her husband’s a driver.  She needs the loan to repair the engine.  This is the source of income for her family.

Ginebra is married and has a son.  She lives in her parents’ house in La Paz’s San Martin neighborhood.  This is her fourth Kiva loan and she is very satisfied with the loans.  She was able to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to service her vehicle.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: El señor Rodrigo es Chofer y esta afiliado en un sindicado de transportes. El crédito lo necesita para el cambio de llantas de su vehículo. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. Es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de las Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y Kiva.
texts.en: Rodrigo is a driver affiliated to a transportation syndicate.  He needs the loan to replace the tires on his vehicle.  This is the source of income for family support.  He’s single and has no children and lives in his own house in La Paz’s Pasankeri area.  This is the first time he’s worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to replace the tires on his vehicle.

loans.name: Inmaculada Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se inició gracias a la Señora Bibiana, el grupo se llama ”Inmaculada”, fue ella quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en dicha zona.
La Sra. Bibiana B. es muy humilde, responsable y trabajadora, ella contactó con la Fundación, con el fin de participar del proyecto Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, con sus amigas y amigas de su barrio.
Gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya todas las integrantes mejoraron su calidad de vida satisfaciendo todas sus necesidades básicas y las de su hogar.
Las mismas mujeres se sienten muy orgullosas de estar formando parte del comité, porque gracias al apoyo, crédito y capacitación recibidas anteriormente por la Fundación se abrieron y sigue abriendo puertas en los distintos lugares.
El comité se encuentra en el Quinto Ciclo.
La sra. Bibiana se dedica a la venta de comestibles y desea poder adquirir otro crédito para comprar más bebidas, panificados, legumbres, entre otras mercaderías que sean de primera necesidad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The present committee started thanks to Bibiana.  The group is called “Inmaculada.”  She was the one who contacted her neighbors and friends to form the committee in that neighborhood.

Mrs. Bibiana Benitez is very humble, responsible and hard working.  She contacted the Fundación intending to participate in the Enterprising Women Committee with her friends and neighbors from the neighborhood.

Thanks to Fundación Paraguaya all the members improved their quality of life satisfying all their basic needs and those of their homes.

These same women feel very proud to be part of this committee because, thanks to the support, loans and training received previously from the Fundación, they opened and their doors are still open in various places.  The committee is in its fifth cycle.

Bibiana sells foodstuffs and wants to get another loan to buy drinks, baked goods and vegetables, among other groceries for her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire children's clothing.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es: La señora Agueda tiene un snack donde vende salchipapas. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de las salchipapas como papa, salchicha, mayonesa, ketchup, mostaza. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. Es casada, tiene un  hijo y vive en casa de un familiar  ubicada en la zona de las Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Sra. Agueda has a snack bar where she sells “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes). She needs a loan to buy supplies for making this dish such as potatoes, sausages, mayonnaise, ketchup, and mustard. This business is the source of income by which she supports her family. Agueda is married, has one child, and lives in the family home located in the District of Achachicala in the city of La Paz. This is the first loan she has received from IMPRO.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, sausages, mayonnaise, ketchup, and mustard.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señora Olga es madre soltera. Tiene un hijo menor de 16 años, él está cursando el segundo año de la Media.
Olga tiene un pequeño local en el centro de la ciudad donde vende bebidas y golosinas varias.
Ella se inició hace varios años vendiendo en forma ambulante hasta que consiguió comprar su local con la ayuda de unos  ahorros que tenía. Hoy día ella  es muy conocida por los turistas y personas que trabajan en el micro centro.
Es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe dudas que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Ella solicita de nuevo un crédito de Kiva para poder comprar más bebidas y golosinas que vende en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Olga is a single mother with a 16 year old son who is starting his second year of high school. She has a small space in the central part of the city where she sells beverages and different candies.

Olga started out selling as a street merchant for several years before she was able to buy a space with the help of some savings that she had accumulated. Today she is well-known among the tourists and the people who work in the downtown area.

Olga is a responsible person who has the desire to succeed. She possesses a jovial and enterprising spirit, so there is no doubt that she will be able to achieve all of the goals that she has planned. Olga is requesting a new Kiva loan so that she can buy more beverages and candies to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase beverages and candies.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maribel is the coordinator of her group, named Alfa y Omega 1, 2 & 3. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. She says that her most difficult challenge was to established her business and to give a good education to her children.

Maribel has had her business for a year and a half. She started with her small savings and after a month of operation she found the group in her community and decided to take out a loan to increase her inventory. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business (a small store of cloths, shoes, cosmetics and other products) by buying more of those items.

She will use the profits to invest in her business, because she wants to have a bigger general store. This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to invest in her business. Maribel, her family and group are located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry.

loans.use: to buy cloths, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Don Vidal es cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad, convive con su señora esposa hace 30 años, la Sra. Francisca Maria Garcia quien es docente; él se dedica a la compra de rollos que posteriormente los vende aserrados y trabajados, también se dedica a la fabricacion de muebles, cuenta con una antigüedad de más de 30 años en el rubro, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser cliente excelente y por sobre todo muy trabajador.
El cliente desea obtener este crédito para destinarlo a la compra de materiales, materias primas para la fabricacion de más muebles, como serruchos, martillo, lija, cepillo y rollos.
Cabe mencionar que cuenta con 3 hijos que ya son profesionales en la actualidad, gracias a su arduo sacrificio, teniendo en cuenta que eso fue su anhelo: verles profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Don Vidal is a returning client of Fundación Paraguaya. He lives with his wife of thirty years, Sra. Francicsca Maria Garcia, who is a teacher. Vidal buys rolls of timber to sell to sawmills and construction workers. In addition, he manufactures furniture and has thirty years of experience in this trade. Vidal has always been known as an excellent client and a hard worker most of all.

He wants to obtain this loan so that he can buy supplies for making furniture such as saws, hammers, sandpaper, scrub brushes, and rollers. It should be mentioned that Vidal has three children who are now professionals. Thanks to his hard work and sacrifice he was able to see his wish fulfilled.

loans.use: To purchase saws, hammers, sandpaper, scrub brushes, and rollers.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene ya más de ocho años dedicándose a las ventas de papelería escolar. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía que es hojas de papel, colores, tintas de impresoras y otra copiadora, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar su negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que su esposo el señor Juan José se encarga de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una compañía de trasportes como chofer de camión de carretera.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana has been selling school supplies for more than eight years.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy merchandise such as sheets of paper, crayons, printer ink, and another photocopier.  At the moment, she lacks the necessary funds for this investment and does not want to drain capital from her business.  

Juana plans to repay the loan with the profit she generates from her business.  Her husband, Sr. Juan José, takes charge of the family expenses with the salary he earns from his job as a truck driver for a transportation company.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and a photocopier.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo es chofer. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de un motor para su taxi para su mejor funcionamiento en el trabajo que desempeña y sobre todo con mayor seguridad. Es casado, no tiene hijos y vive en anticrítico ubicada en la zona de las San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO.
texts.en: Sr. Ricardo is a chauffeur.  He needs this loan to buy a motor for his taxi so that it will function better in his job and above all provide greater safety.  Ricardo is married and does not have children.  He lives in a rental property in the District of San Martín in the city of La Paz.  This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for his vehicle.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: La señora Nelly se dedica a la venta de calzados para toda edad.  El crédito lo necesita para comprar calzados deportivos para niños para obtendrá más ingresos económicos. Es casada. Su esposo es empleado en un colegio. Tienen dos hijos y viven en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO.
texts.en: Sra. Nelly sells footwear for all ages.  She needs this loan in order to buy athletic shoes for children so that she can earn more income.  Nelly is married and her husband works at a school.  They have two children and live in their own home in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.  This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO.

loans.use: To buy athletic shoes for children.

loans.name: Narda

texts.es: La señora Narda se dedica a la venta de carteras y perfumes. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo necesita para la cancelación de matricula y mensualidades universitarias de su hija. Es divorciada, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa propia con su madre ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO.
texts.en: Sra. Narda sells wallets and perfumes.  This business is the source of income by which she is able to support her family.  She needs this loan in order to pay the university tuition and fees of her daughter.  Narda is divorced, has two children, and lives at her mother’s house in the District of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz.  This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's university tuition and fees.

loans.name: Cariñositos Group

texts.es: La banca D. emprendimiento CARIÑOSITOS esta en su primera secuencia, contando con 6 integrantes mujeres y 2 varones, esta banca se caracteriza por vivir en la misma zona Periférica que queda a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. La Paz, la Presidenta es La Señora Edelmira con 37 años D. edad, ella obtuvo el crédito con la finalidad D. aumentar y equipar su salón D. belleza la misma que atienD. desD. hace mucho tiempo, es una persona muy responsable por este motivo fue elegida como presidenta del grupo, por su solidaridad con sus compañeras, con el dinero del crédito comprara material D. peluquería como tintes tijeras, champó, etc. La  Sra. Edelmira es una persona con ganas D. superación siempre velando por el bienestar D. su familia su deseo es el D. mejorar la calidad d evida D. toda su familia. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Cariñositos” is in its first loan cycle with a membership consisting of six women and two men.  The members of this bank live in the same area called Periférica, which is 20 minutes from La Paz.  Sra. Edelmira, age 37, serves as the president.  She is receiving a loan so that she can expand and equip her beauty salon which she has managed for a long time.  Edelmira is a very responsible person, which is why she was elected to be president of the group.  The money from her loan will be used to buy beauty supplies such as dyes, scissors, shampoos, and other items.   Edelmira is a woman who wants to get ahead and is always looking out for her family. Her desire is to improve the quality of life for her family. 

All of the members are responsible and hardworking people.  They are grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: To purchase dyes, scissors, shampoos, and other items.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando D. F., vive en el barrio los pinos donde tiene un negocio llamado “Confecciones DiF.” allí fabrica ropa en todas las líneas poductivas,  de acuerdo con la época, los gustos o preferencias de sus clientes,  de esta manera produce en los primeros meses del año ropa escolar, para el día de las madres ropa femenina, para Halloween disfraces infantiles etc; Fernando aprenD.ó su actividad como tradición familiar y la ha perfeccionado a través de cursos y talleres de actualización y mejoramiento en el arte de las confecciones. Él tiene un taller aunque pequeño muy organizado que lo hacen muy atractivo para sus clientes potenciales.  Su sueño es ampliar su taller y generar empleos en un sitio estratégico donde pueda independizar su espacio personal del productivo, esta es la razón por la cual trabaja constantemente y se esmera con disciplina para el cumplimiento de su propósito. Este, su credikiva, es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materias primas e insumos, especialmente telas al por mayor e invertirá también en la reparación de una maquinaria. Su principal desafío fue conseguir capital de trabajo para responder a sus clientes, pero sabe que de ahora en adelante“Confecciones DiF.”, contará con el acceso a los créditos de  la Fundación.
texts.en:
Fernando D. F. lives in the neighborhood of Los Pinos where he has a business called “Confecciones Difelipo”. There he produces all styles of clothing based on the season, as well as the tastes and preferences of his customers. During the first few months of the year he produces school uniforms, women’s clothing for Mother’s Day, children’s Halloween costumes, and other items. Fernando learned this trade since it is a family tradition. He perfected his skills by taking courses and workshops to update his knowledge and improve in the art of sewing. Fernando has a small workshop, but it is well-organized to make it look attractive to potential customers. His dream is to expand his workshop and create jobs in a strategic area that is separate from his personal space. For this reason, he works constantly and with great discipline so that he can accomplish this goal.

This Kiva loan is the first time Fernando has received financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the funds to buy materials and supplies, especially fabrics in bulk. In addition, some of the money will be invested in machine repairs. His main challenge has been securing operating capital so that he can meet the demands of his customers. Fernando now knows that he can move “Confecciones DiF.” forward since he has access to the loans from FMSD.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies in bulk as well as pay for machine repairs.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly  D. L. C. D. 66 años casada y madre D. 5 hijos, es una mujer  muy trabajadora que aplica toda su creatividad innata al desempeño D. una actividad que le genera ingresos: L. Confección; su negocio nació cuando procedente D. su natal Punta D. Piedra, en el departamento del Magdalena, llegó a L. ciudad D. BarranquilL. a los 19 años, donD. inició trabajando en una empresa D. confecciones y devengando un salario por producción, allí desarrolló toda su creatividad y 4 años después conformó su hogar y así mismo empezó   su necesidad D. adelantar una actividad que le permitiera atender sus hijos y generar ingresos simultáneamente;  D. esa manera nace el negocio que hoy sostiene y que  le ha permitido no solo su crecimiento productivo, sino también su crecimiento personal en términos D. desarrollar su autonomía y D. haber adquirido muchas amistades que hoy son sus principales clientes y que son muy fiel a sus servicio; por ello se esmera en diseñar cada día nuevos productos que estén a L. moda y que ayuden a que otras personas manejen una imagen personal y profesional adecuada.  Este es su quinto financiamiento con L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con L. que ha logrado hacer cambio significativos en su familia y para su familia, como las adecuaciones D. su vivienda que son posible gracias al crecimiento del negocio que esta organización ha apoyado,  con L.  cual permanece actualizada y  ha logrado cambiar toda  su  maquinaria y ofrecer productos cada día D. mejor calidad. Su sueño es continuar apoyando el buen desempeño D. sus hijos, elL. especialmente  tiene como meta lograr que su hija  culmine estudios universitarios, pues su sueño es que sea una profesional D. éxito.  En L. actualidad  Magaly quiere aprovechar L. infraestructura locativa comercial, en L. que se encuentra ubicada y el número significativos D. clientes para ofrecer nuevos servicios, pues está muy cerca a 3 centros educativos que comprarían sus servicios D. fotocopiaje, transcripción, internet e impresiones y esta es L. razón por L. cual está acudiendo a su credikiva, inversión que generará otros ingresos y mayor rotación D. su efectivo.
texts.en:
Magaly D. L. C., 66, is married and the mother of five children.  She is a very hard working woman who applies her innate creativity to an income generating activity: Dressmaking.  

Her business arose when she arrived in BarranquilL. at the age of 19 from her native Punta D. Piedra in Magdalena Department.  She started working in a dressmaking firm earning a salary based on production.  She developed her creativity there and four years later started her own home and needed a way to earn income while caring for her children at the same time.  Thus is born the business she has to this day that has maD. not only her productive growth possible but also her personal grown in terms of developing her autonomy and having gained many friends who are now her main customers and who are faithful to her.  Because of this she strives daily to design new items that are fashinable and that will help others to have adequate personal appearance.

This is her fifth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization with which she’s managed to make significant changes in her family and for her family like some home improvements that have been possible thanks to her business’ growth that this organization has supported and that permit her to be up to date modernizing all her equipment in order to offer better, higher quality products daily.

Her dream is to continue to support her children’s development.  Her main goal is that he daughter complete her university studies because her dream is that she becomes a successful professional.

Currently, Magaly wants to take full advantage of the commercial prospects the privileged location of her business has for it’s located near three educational institutions with significant numbers of potential customers to whom she can offer the new services of photocopying, transcriptions, Internet access and printing.  This is the reason she’s requesting a Kiva loan, an investment that will generate other income and improve cash flow.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a photocopier and a printer.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Catalina O. V. tiene 48 años de edad, vive en el barrio Conaden de la ciudad de choluteca y es una mujer emprendedora que se dedida a la produccion y venta de tortillas, su negocio estsa ubicado en su casa de habitacion, tiene la ayuda de su hija mayor para la elaboracion de sus tortillas.
Maria es madre soltera.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal y agua, ya que ahora los pedidos de sus clientes son mayores y no se da abasto con la produccion que tiene en este momento.
sus tiempos libres los dedica a visitar la iglesia.
texts.en:
Sra.Maria Catalina O. V. is 48 years old. She lives in the Conaden section of the city of Choluteca. She is an enterprising woman engaged in the production and sale of tortillas. Her business is located in her house. Her oldest daughter helps her in the making of her tortillas. Maria is a single mother.

The loan will be used for the purchase of corn, firewood, lime, and water since orders from her customers have increased and she isn’t able to fill them with the production that she currently has. Maria dedicates her free time to visiting the church.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, lime, and water.

loans.name: Daira Susana

texts.es:
Este es el segundo credikiva de Dayra Susana y està muy contenta por lograr aumentar su capital de trabajo con el anteriormente recibido;  ahora se dispone a volver a invertir, aprovechando que se avecina el dia de las madres, que es una època muy  comercial durante todo el mes. 
Dayra aun recuerda cuando iniciò cuando le traian la mercancia a su casa mediante el sistema de crédito, asì vendia colonias, perfumes, ropa ; ahora compra directamente y las ganacias son superiores, porque sus precios son mas econòmicos y puede escoger lo que ella necesita y en la calidad que desea ofrecer a sus clientes, asi ellos se benefican con precios y ella fideliza a sus compradores. Dayra reconoce que con sus creditos con la FundaciónMario Santo Domingo,  ha ido gradualmente cumpliendo sus metas pero eso si trabajando arduamente con mucha disciplina; por eso ahora con su segundo credikiva, comprará cosméticos, ropa femenina, electrodomésticos menores, accesorios y calzado, que le aumentarán el volumen de  sus ventas y logrará acceso a nuevos clientes; mientras sigue trabajando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida como poco a poco lo ha realizado para sacar adelante a su hijo de 20 años, con el cual quiere cumplir su màxima realizaciòn de verlo exitoso en un futuro no muy lejano. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Dayra ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/215541
texts.en: This is Dayra Susana’s second loan with kiva, and she is happy to have increased her working capital with what she received previously.  She is now preparing to invest once more, to take advantage of mothers’ day, which is close, and which is busy throughout the entire month.  Dayra still recalls, when she started up, how they brought merchandise to her house, under a credit arrangement.  She would sell cologne, perfume, clothing.  Now she buys directly, and her earnings are higher, because her prices are lower, and she can choose what she needs, and the quality she wishes to offer her customers.  They enjoy lower prices, and she gains their loyalty.  Dayra recognizes that, with her loans from Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she has gradually been achieving her goals, but through very hard work and strict discipline.  Thus, with her second kiva loan, she will buy cosmetics, women’s clothing, small appliances, accessories, and footwear, which will increase her sales and bring her new customers.  This, as she continues to work to improve their living conditions, as she has been doing slowly to help her 20-year-old son get ahead.  She hopes to see her highest goal achieved, that is, that he will be successful in the not-too-distant future.  If you wish to read Dayra’s story, visit this link:  http://kiva.org/lend/215541

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, women's clothing, small appliances, accessories, and footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sandals, slippers, shoes, and sneakers.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: La Señora agustina vive en la zona D. Chinchaya que esta ubicada a 40 minutos del centro D. la cuidad. Chinchaya es un lugar un poco alejado D. la ciudad pero muy hermoso geográficamente debido a su vegetación y ríos.  En esta zona las personas se dedican principalmente al lavado D. arena y piedras para construcción que sacan del rio, además  D. la crianza D. vacas lecheras. Agustina no trabaja lavando arena ni criando vacas lecheras pero tiene dos tiendas en su casa que queda cerca D. la plaza donD. venD. carne, verduras, hortalizas, tubérculos, refrescos gaseosas y material escolar. El esposo D. doña agustina trabaja con movilidad y actualmente solo tienen un hijo dependiente en edad escolar.   Agustina solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales D. construcción para su casa ya que esta haciendo ampliar para brindar mayor comodidad a su familia. Ella es una persona muy conocida debido a su buen carácter y responsabilidad, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el poyo brindado.
texts.en:
Agustina lives in the Chinchaya zone located forty minutes from downtown.  It’s a bit far from the city but very beautiful geographically thanks to its vegetation and rivers.  Most of the residents here work washing sand and rocks they get from the river that are used for construction.  Some also raise dairy cows.

Agustina doesn’t wash sand nor does she raise dairy cows; she has two stores in her house, that’s near the main square, where she sells meat, vegetables, tubers, soft drinks and school supplies.   Agustina’s husband is a driver and they currently have just one dependent, school age child.

Agustina is asking for the loan to buy building materials and supplies because she’s enlarging her house to proviD. more comfort for her family.  She is a very well known person thanks to her good character and responsibility.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Roly Edson

texts.es: Roly tiene 23  años es soltero vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con una moto taxi que da en alquiler a su hermano, el vehiculo lo adquirió con ahorros producto de su trabajo como obrero de construcción civil , esta actividad la sigue desempeñando en la actualidad , lo que le pagan por el alquiler de su moto taxi es de s/ 25.00 soles diario y lo que gana como obrero es s/300 soles semanal su meta en el futuro es terminar de construir la casa de su padres para tener una mayor comodidad, aun no la pueden terminar por que requiere un capital mayor el cual aun no lo tiene; el dinero será invertido en darle mantenimiento a su moto taxi cambio de aceite pintado entre otros , roly esta muy agradecido por la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Roly, 23, lives in his parents’ house.  He has a mototaxi that he leases to his brother.  He acquired the vehicle with savings from his job as a laborer in civil construction, a job he still has. 

He is paid a 25 sol daily rental fee for his mototaxi and he earns 300 soles per week as a construction worker.  His goal for the future is to finish building his parents’ house in order to have more comfort.  They haven’t been able to finish it yet because he needs a larger amount of capital that he doesn’t yet have.

The money will be used for mototaxi maintenance: to change the oil and paint it, among other things.

Roly is very grateful for the trust being placed in him.

loans.use: to change the oil and paint his motoraxi.

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en:
Sosefina, a 49-year-old married mother of nine children, has owned and operated an auto repairs business venture or work-shop house for the past four years. Sosefina needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase timber, nail and iron roofing to enlarge and renovate her work-shop house.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 700 talas or US $292 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Sosefina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Sosefina's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase timber, nails and iron roofing to renovate and enlarge her work-shop house

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en:
Ioana is 60 years of age and married with four children. Ioana owns & operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Ioana needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Ioana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Ioana's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood, chickens, tortillas, beef, pork, cheese, pork rinds, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, garlic, spices, potatoes, manioc, bananas, beans, bread, coffee, beverages, snacks, sweets, cookies, eggs, butter, wheat flour, lard, oil and gas.

loans.name: Desarrollo Para El Progreso 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Angel lives in Samana, the northeastern region of the Dominican Republic. This city is a mountainous region where one of the principal industries is tourism. And in one of the most rural areas, Angel and this group of 15 members are taking loans for their businesses, this group is named Desarrollo para el Progreso 1, 2 & 3 (Development to progress).

Angel requires a loan to buy a coconut tree to sell coconuts all over the city and on different beaches. This is his second loan with Esperanza International, and he decided to take out a loan with us because he feels comfortable with the payments and especially because these loans are for businesses. He is very excited to belong to this group of neighbors doing business for the improvement of their families and the community. He will take a step toward having one of his dreams come true — having his own business — and he knows that by working hard, he will improve his business and be able to save and provide any help his children require.

Angel says that his favorite thing is to work, especially in the land, by planting different trees and seeding. He hopes that the profit from his business will be enough to buy his own vehicle and to have a business without debts.

loans.use: To buy a coconut tree

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items for the home and decorations for Mother's Day

loans.name: Nuevo Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO ARCO IRIS” iniciará su quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Hilda. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa , fabricación de colchones, compra de mercadería, compra de repuestos, tejido en lana, venta de tostado, venta de peluches.

La señora Hilda, indica que hace once años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de libros, el que inicio por intermedio de su hermana mayor que tiene el mismo negocio, lo viene realizando hace nueve años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de libros: libros, fábulas, obras, cuentos para pintar, los que comprará del Desaguadero y también por mayor de las galerías de la Ceja y otros que le dejan en el puesto. Posteriormente los venderá en la calle Tiwanacu (calle comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) todos los días, desde las 15:00 a 21:00. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y negocios.
texts.en:
The “NUEVO ARCO IRIS” (New Rainbow) communal bank will start its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada Center.  It has 8 members and is led by a governing board headed by Hilda.  The communal bank’s members carry out a variety of businesses such as: clothing sales, mattress manufacturing, merchandise purchases, replacement parts purchases, wool weaving, snack sales and stuffed toy sales.

Hilda indicates that she’s been working with Pro Mujer for 11 years having joined thanks to an invitation from a friend.  She currently has a business selling books that she started thanks to her older sister who is in the same business.  She’s been in business for nine years.

The loan she’s taking out now will be used to buy books:  books, fables, coloring books, that she’ll buy in Desaguadero and also at wholesale in large stores in La Ceja as well as others that are delivered to her stand.  She then will sell them on Tiwanacu Street (El Alto’s commercial street) every day from 3-9pm.  This way of working allows her to generate income to help her family in whatever way possible because she lives in an unmarried relationship state and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training, the health services and business.

loans.use: to buy books.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La señora Elena vende dulces, chocolates y otros por las fiestas y restaurantes en las noches, desde hace veinticinco años, vive en alquiler,  esta en su cuarta secuencia, también pertenece al banco de emprendimiento principiantes, esta en su segundo ciclo, ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable, la señora vive sola, es separada, sus hijos son mayores e independientes, y ella sola con su trabajo se mantiene también se dedica  al venta de quinua una vez al mes viaja a una localidad de la ciudad de Oruro a comprar quinua y después lo revende en la ciudad de Cochabamba, es una persona trabajadora y siempre activa, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería como dulces y chocolate para así tener variedad de productos para ofrecer a su clientes, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación  del crédito.
texts.en: Elena has been selling candy, chocolates, etc for parties and restaurants in the evenings for the past twenty-five years.  She lives in a rented place by herself, is separated, and her children are adults and independent.    This is her fourth loan cycle.  She belongs to the Banco de Emprendimiento Principiantes communal bank.  In the second cycle Elena proved that she was a responsible person and she alone supports herself.  She also sells quinoa and once a month she travels to a business in Oruro to buy quinoa to resell in Cochabamba.  She is hardworking and always active.  With the money from the loan she will buy candies and chocolates to have a variety of products to offer her customers.  She is grateful to the institution for the support given her by extending the financing.

loans.use: To buy candies, chocolates, and more

loans.name: Huaycheñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HUIAYCHEÑAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Claudina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de chompas, venta de comida, taller mecánico y freno, tienda de abarrotes,  venta de comida, venta de verduras.

La señora Claudina,  indica que es la primera vez que en una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingreso por la promoción de la asesora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda en la provincia que inicio, por la ilusión que ella tuvo desde pequeña.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, etc que servirá para surtir su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “HUAYCHEÑAS” communal association is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional center. It is composed of eight members, and it is directed by a committee of officers, headed by Claudina. The businesses operated by the members of the communal association are varied; among them are sweater production, food sales, car repair and brake workshop, grocery store, food sales, and vegetable sales. 

Claudina reports that this is the first time that she has joined a communal association in Pro Mujer, and she joined thanks to the encouragement of the advisor. Currently, she operates a store in the province that she started in keeping with an aspiration she has had since she was small. 

The loan that she will be receiving now is to buy rice, sugar, noodles, etc., which will be used to stock her store. This form of work allows her to generate resources to help support her family, since she is married. 
  
When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the system of savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles and sugar for her store

loans.name: Dilcia Jackeline

texts.es:
la joven Dilcia Jackeline M. P. tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la colonia 27 de mayo de el Triunfo Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de pollo frito con chismol y tortillas. Dilcia es una joven emprendedora  y su negocio esta ubicado en la plaza civica de el Triunfo.
Dilcia es soltera pero muy dedicada a su negocio,  cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana para la preparacion del pollo, muchas personas la prefieren ya que le da un buen sabor al pollo.
Dilcia vive en la casa de sus padres que tambien le acompañan en su negocio.
Dilcia aporta economicamente para cubrir los gastos de la casa de sus padres.
sus tiempos libres lo dedica  para visitar la iglesia.
su sueño es tener una familia bonita y con hijos sanos.
texts.en:
Young Dilcia Jackeline M. P. is 25 years old. She lives in the 27 de Mayo neighborhood of El Triunfo in Choluteca. She works selling fried chicken with chismol (an Honduran salsa) and tortillas. 
Dilcia is an enterprising young woman. Her business is located in El Triunfo’s civic square.
Dilcia is single but very dedicated to her business. Her sister helps her prepare her chicken. Many people prefer her food because her chicken has a good flavor.
Dilcia lives in her parents’ house. They also help her with her business.
Dilcia contributes money to help cover the expenses in her parents’ home.
In her free time she goes to church.
Her dream is to have a happy family with healthy children.

loans.use: To buy chicken, lard, cabbage, tomatoes, green chile, onions, garlic, salt, lemon, tortillas, soft drinks, disposable plates, and bags.

loans.name: Francisco Pacheco (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Francisco Pacheco de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Francisco Pacheco. Esta ciudad es conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad del Valle por estar rodeada de majestuosas y hermosas  montañas.

Este es un grupo de personas que hace un tiempo atrás decidieron unirse para lograr conseguir mejores beneficios a través de su grupo, ellos se dedican a diversas actividades como: comercio en general, servicios, venta de comida entre otras cosas.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Vilma M. L., tiene 42 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre hace varios años de la cual tiene dos hijos de 21 y 15 años los mismos que estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella se dedica al comercio informal, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas). También vende ropa por catalogo, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Dice que le encanta vender y que lo mas  salida tiene son los perfumes ya que son muy buenos, lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 7 años y va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa de todo tipo como: camisetas, pantalones, blusas, ropa de niños, etc. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta el Banco por la ayuda que recibe para poder salir adelante.

Su sueño es tener un gran negocio.
texts.en:
In the Francisco Pacheco neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, the Manabí capital, the "Francisco Pacheco" communal bank meets every two weeks.  This city has been known for many years as Valley City because it is surrounded by majestic, beautiful mountains.

Some time ago the members decided to join together in an effort to obtain more profits through their group.  They are all involved in different businesses such as general sales, services and food sales, among others. 

Here we meet Mrs. Vilma M. L. who is 42 years old, has a common-law husband and two children, ages 21 and 15, who are in college and school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has an informal business selling Yanbal products (beauty products, perfume and ladies' accessories); and also sells clothing by catalogue.  Her working hours are from 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. every day, which she does door-to-door on an order basis.  She delivers the products on credit and collects payment weekly.  She loves to sell and claims her most popular-selling products are perfumes because of their quality.  She's been involved in the business for seven years now and it is going very well.

The loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and all types of clothing such as t-shirts, trousers, blouse, children's clothing, etc.  She's been in the communal bank since its inception and likes the support she receives in order to get ahead.

Her dream is to one day have a large business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, trousers, t-shirts, blouses and children's clothing, etc.

loans.name: Elsa Mariflor

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elsa, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, todos mayores de edad pero el menor aun vive con ella. El marido se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una ama de casa que comparte el tiempo entre su hogar y su negocio, tiene un negocio de compra y venta de pinchaguas, esta es una variedad de pez muy solicitada por las personas y por los dueños de negocios de ceviches, con este producto ellos preparan el delicioso ceviche de pinchaguas que es muy consumido por la gente, ella compra estos peces recién salidos del mar en las playas de los arenales, para luego limpiarlas curtirlas con limón y embasarlas en tarrinas plásticas, las mismas que lleva a entregar a sus clientes, trabaja todos los días en las mañanas, lleva cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar más pinchaguas y embases plásticos. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta todo del mismo.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish of the Portoviejo Canton we find a place known as "Los Arenales".  Here, every two weeks, the members of the "Nueva Generación" communal bank conduct their meeting.  This location is known for its beautiful beaches, gastronomy and warmth of its people.

Here we meet Mrs. Elsa who is 52 years old, has a common-law husband and four children, who are all adults but the youngest child lives with her.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a homemaker and distributes her time between her home and business.  She buys and sells "pinchaguas" (alewife fish), which is a very popular variety among people and ceviche business owners.  This fish is used to prepare the delicious ceviche that is very popular.  She buys the fish fresh out of the sea on the beaches of "Los Arenales", then cleans them with lemon and places them in plastic containers that she delivers to her customers.  She works every day in the morning and has been in the business for five years.

She plans to use the loan to buy more "pinchaguas" and plastic containers.  This is her fourth loan through the communal bank which she enjoys very much.

Her dream is to have a grocery store one day.

loans.use: To buy alewife fish (pinchaguas) and plastic containers

loans.name: Ana Candelaria

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lindo lugar conocimos a la señora Ana. Ella tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y  tienen dos hijos ya mayores de edad pero que aún viven en su casa. Su marido es pescador.

Es un ama de casa que para ayudarse y ayudar a su marido se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, tiene un pequeño local en su casa aunque a veces también sale a recorrer ciudad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00, sus hijos a veces le ayudan cuando  están desocupados. Su mercadería la comprar cada fin de mes en Guayaquil. Lleva 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad, nos cuenta que lo que ella más vende es ropa de mujer.

Con este crédito va a comprar pantalones, vestidos, blusas y camisetas. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta los créditos ya que son de gran ayuda.

Su sueño tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish of the Portoviejo Canton we find a place known as "Los Arenales". Here, every two weeks, the members of the "Nueva Generación" communal bank conduct their meeting. This location is known for its beautiful beaches, gastronomy and warmth of its people.

Here we meet Mrs. Ana who is 56 years old, married and has two adult children still living at home.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a homemaker who, in order to earn an income and help her husband, sells all kinds of clothing out of a small stall in her home.  Sometimes whe also sells door-to-door.  She works every day from 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. and receives the help of her children when they are not busy.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil at the end of each month and has been in business for 20 years.  Her best-selling merchandise is women's clothing.

She plans to use the loan to buy trousers, dresses, blouses and t-shirts.  This is her second loan through the communal bank which she feels is a great support.

Her dream is to have a boutique one day.

loans.use: To buy trousers, dresses, blouses and t-shirts

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo, de 62 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a  su esposa María de 52 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para vivir una vejez tranquila a lado de su amada pareja. El día de Lorenzo comienza muy temprano por la mañana, cuando abre su puesto y empieza con su venta de pollos, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Luciana (Mercado importante del distrito de Carabayllo), él es un vendedor muy persuasivo y siempre logra sacar una sonrisa de sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, quienes con sus bromas hacen más alegres las largas jornadas de venta, lleva 30 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta. Espera tener en el futuro un emporio donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad sus pollos congelados. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y se siente feliz de haberlo obtenido, en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que siempre ayuda en todo lo necesario. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más pollos para cubrir mejor la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 62 years old, is a kind, hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife María who is 52.  He aspires most to working hard now so he can have a peaceful retirement together with his beloved partner.  Lorenzo begins his day very early in the morning to set up his chicken stall in the Luciana Market (an important market in the district of Carabayllo).  He is a very persuasive salesman and always elicits a smile from his customers.

What he enjoys most about his business is talking to his colleagues whose jokes make the long day more enjoyable.  He's been in business for 30 years and believes that the hardest part of his job is having to spend the entire day in one place.  Sometime in the future he would like to have an emporium where he could sell frozen chicken in a calmer environment.  

This is his fourth loan through MFP and he is very grateful for it.  He is a well-loved member of the bank and always helps out there when he can.  He plans to use the 2,500 PEN to buy more chicken to be able to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Carmen Elodia

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, ella tiene 55 años de edad, hace varios años mantuvo una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo 8 hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, en su casa viven cuatro de sus nietos que ella los tiene desde pequeños y que ahora  tienen 12, 11, 10 y 8 años, todos están en escuela.
 
Es una mujer muy luchadora que para salir adelante se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, su forma de venta es recorriendo con sus productos por toda la localidad, trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 15h00, sus nietos le ayudan cuando ellos no tienen clases. El pescado lo compra a pescadores en Los Arenales, los cuales le dejan a buen precio y un muy buen pescado, lleva 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella también realiza trabajos de limpieza y fileteada de pescado por lo que le pagan un sueldo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado y llevarlo a vender. Lleva 8 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de parte de la fundación Espoir.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish of the Portoviejo Canton we find a place known as "Los Arenales". Here, every two weeks, the members of the "Nueva Generación" communal bank conduct their meeting. This location is known for its beautiful beaches, gastronomy and warmth of its people.

Here we meet Mrs. Carmen who is 55 years old.  Several years ago she had a common-law partner with whom she had 8 children who are all adults and independent.  Four of her grandchildren have lived with her since they were little and now they are 12, 11, 10 and 8 and in school.

She is a hard worker who, in order to get ahead, buys and sells fish door-to-door throughout the town.  She works every day from 5:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. and her grandchildren help out when they are not in school.  She buys fresh fish in Los Arenales at a very good price and has been in the business for 15 years.  She also cleans and filets fish for a wage.

This loan will be used to buy fish and sell it.  She has been in the communal bank for 8 years and enjoys the benefits she receives from the Espoir Foundation.

Her dream to is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana, D. 71 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Aparicio D. 77 años y lo que más desea es poder vivir una vejez tranquila a lado D. su querida pareja. Maximiliana es dueña del restaurante más concurrido D. su barrio, siempre esta muy alegre y recibe con una sonrisa a sus clientes diarios, ella disfruta D. atenderlos y brindarles la mejor atención posible, ya que sabe que D. ellos depenD. el éxito D. su negocio. Lleva 50 años en esta actividad y espera posteriormente poder abrir una sucursal D. su restaurante en una zona más comercial, donD. pueda vender su comida a muchas más personas y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos, ya que actualmente tiene muchos clientes que vienen desD. muy lejos a probar la deliciosas sazón que  ella le pone a todas su comidas. Considera que lo más difícil es tener que preparar diariamente comida para casi doscientas personas. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente en la capacidad D. pagarlo a tiempo, ya que confía en su negocio y en su banco comunal, al cual se siente muy contenta D. pertenecer. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas mesas y sillas, para mejorar la atención en su restaurante.
texts.en: Maximiliana is 71 years old. She is a woman who has always fought to get ahead in life. She lives in her own house with her husband Aparicio, who is  77 years old. What she wants the most is to be able to live her old age calmly at her beloved husband's siD.. Maximiliana is the owner of a busy restaurant in her neighborhood. She is always very cheerful and receives her customers everyday with a smile. She enjoys serving them and giving them the best service possible. She knows that her business' success depends on them. She has been doing this activity for 50 years and she hopes to later open another restaurant in a more commercial area where she can sell her food to many more people and thus improve her earnings. At present she has a lot of customers who come from far away to try the delicious flavor she gives to all her dishes. She thinks that the most difficult thing is having to prepare food every day for almost two hundred people. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She feels capable of paying it on time, since she has faith in her business and in her community bank, to which she is very happy to belong. With the one thousand five hundred nuevos soles she has asked for, she will buy new tables and chairs to improve the service in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
Yenny, D. 41 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Ricardo D. 46 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. El restaurante D. Yenny esta ubicado en una D. las calles principales del distrito D. Carabayllo, el cual es muy concurrido por las personas, debido a lo sabroso D. L. comida y a L. variedad D. platos que ofrece al publico, lo cual a hecho que su restaurante sea uno D. los más conocidos.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es atender a sus clientes y le gusta hacerlo bien, puesto que sabe que una buena atención hará que vuelvan pronto, lleva 10 año cocinando para sus clientes y lo más difícil para elL. es atender al mismo tiempo a todas las personas que asisten a su restaurante, espera poder mejorar L. infraestructura D. su negocio en el futuro y así poder brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y esta segura D. poder hacerlo, al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos, en su banco comunal siente que esta realizando una buena labor y que le tienen mucho respeto por L. puntualidad que demuestra. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, renovará sus utensilios D. cocina y arreglará mejor el ambiente D. su restaurante.
texts.en:
Yenny is 41 years old. She is a kind and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Ricardo, who is 46 years old, and their 3 beloved children, to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. Yenny's restaurant is located on one of the main streets in the district of Carabayllo. It is well known to people due to the deliciousness of its food and the variety of dishes it offers the public. This has maD. it into one of the best known restaurants. 

What she like the most about her work is serving customers and she likes to do it well since she knows that good service will make them come back soon. She has been cooking for her customers for 10 years and the hardest thing for her is serving all the people in her restaurant at the same time. She hopes to improve the business' infrastructure in the future and thus offer her cusomers better service. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time and she is sure that she will be able to do it, the same as with her first loan. In her community banks she feels that she is doing a good job and she has a lot of respect for the punctuality she has demonstrated. With the three thousand nuevos soles she has acted for, she will renew the kitchen utensils and fix up the ambience of the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and restore her food stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy belts, disks and grease in order to do some general maintenance work on his machinery

loans.name: Marlene Isabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Marlene, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, dos de ellos mayores de edad y tres de  15, 14 y 7 años, uno de los mayores estudian en Universidad y los menores en colegio y escuela. El marido de dedica a la pesca.

Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual además de dedicarse a la pesca también se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, el trabaja todos los días de la semana, dos días sale de pesca y los otros se dedica a comprar el pescado a otros  pescadores. El entrega a comerciantes que venden en otros cantones, a veces el mismo transporta el pescado y lo lleva a entregar a Manta. Lleva 20 años dedicado al comercio  de pescado y a la pesca desde pequeño.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres años y le gusta porque en las reuniones se distrae.
 
Su sueño es tener un trabajo para ganar sus propios recursos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Nueva Generación community bank meet in Crucita parish, in Portoviejo canton, in a place called Los Arenales.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches, its rich cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Here we meet 44 year-old Marlene who lives with her partner and has five children.  Two of her children are grown up and the others are 15, 14 and 7.  One of her older children studies at university and the younger ones are in high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

Marlene is requesting a loan for her husband's business.  In addition to fishing, he also buys and sells fish.  He works every day of the week.  Two days a week he goes out fishing himself and on the other days he buys fish from other fishermen.  He delivers his products to salespeople who then sell them in other cantons.  Sometimes he transports the fish himself and delivers it to Manta.  He has been fishing, and buying and selling fish, for 20 years, since he was young.

This loan will be used to buy fish.  Marlene has been a member of her community bank for three years and she likes it because she enjoys herself at the meetings.

Marlene's dream is to work herself so that she can earn her own money.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee tiene 29 años de edad, es natural del distrito de Santa Rosa, convive con Tomas de 30 años, fruto de esa relación tiene 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa situado en la ciudad de Santa Rosa. El trabajo al que Aydee se dedica, es el arar la tierra; en su parcela posee plantas de cacao, café, barbasco  y hojas de coca. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, sale a trabajar hacía sus fincas en compañía de su pareja, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá parar cubrir las necesidades de su hogar. Ella vende sus productos en los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudades de San Francisco, Kimbiri y santa rosa, puesto que es donde mejores precios percibe por sus granos y hojas de coca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 08 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los tendales donde es el proceso final para  luego comercializarlos. Aydee necesita el préstamo para comprar abonos naturales y fertilizantes químicos para mejorar sus cosechas. En adelante, espera adquirir nuevas tierras para así tener mayores ingresos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará abono natural como: guanos de isla y estiércol de animales y a la vez fertilizantes químicos para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Aydee is 29 years old.  She is from Santa Rosa district and lives with her partner, 30 year-old Tomas.  They have three children and live in their own home which is located in the town of Santa Rosa.

Aydee's business is working her land.  On her land she has cacao, coffee, barbasco and coca leaf plants.  Every day, very early in the morning, she goes out to work on her farm together with her partner as she knows that she depends on the money she makes from her produce to cover her household expenses.  Aydee sells her produce to the warehouses in the towns of San Francisco, Kimbiri and Santa Rosa since this is where she makes the most money for her grains and coca leaf.

What Aydee most enjoys about her work is harvesting her land since that is when she feels that the months of hard work have borne fruit.  She has been in this business for eight years and considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her crops from the farm to the drying areas where they undergo their final process before they are sold.  

Aydee needs this loan to buy natural manure and chemical fertilizers to improve her harvests.  In the future, she hopes to acquire more land so that she can make more income.  This is her fifth loan from MFP and she says that this loan will help her a lot in making progress in her work.  Aydee is a very well-liked member of her community bank.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy natural manures such as guano and animal dung, and also chemical fertilizers, in order to improve her production.

loans.use: to buy guano and fertilizers

loans.name: Kenny Carolina

texts.es: Kenny Carolina O. M.  de treinta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija en San Martin en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella posee una tienda hace un poco mas de dos años en su misma casa de residencia,  tiene mucha clientela pues siempre tiene lo que necesitan sus clientes a un buen precio. Kenny está llena de vida y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y siempre está a disposición de las personas que la visitan, su lema es cliente feliz: seguro regresa; esto la ha impulsado a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos con que no cuenta o mas solicitados para su tienda, como aceite, papel higiénico, azúcar, granos básicos, sal entre otros; de esta manera mantendrá a su clientela, atraerá a nueva, crecerá su negocio y al mismo tiempo logrará apoyar de esta forma a su compañero de vida Oscar quien trabaja como albañil
texts.en:
Kenny Carolina O. M. is 30 years old.  She lives with her life partner and daughter in San Martin, in San Salvador department.

Kenny has owned a store for a little over two years.  It is located in her home.  She has a lot of customers as she always has what her customers need at a good price.  Kenny is full of life and has a great desire to get ahead.  She is always ready to help her customers.  Her motto is "happy customers will definitely come back".  For this reason, Kenny is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy products which she either doesn't have in her store right now or which are very much in demand such as oil, toilet paper, sugar, basic grains, salt, etc.  In this way, she will keep her existing customers, attract new customers, grow her business and manage to support her life partner Oscar who is a construction worker.

loans.use: to buy oil, toilet paper, sugar, basic grains and salt

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Berta Alicia M. de sesenta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, el lugar donde reside es muy concurrido y tiene muchos clientes que la visitan a diario. Berta es una mujer honesta y responsable además de ser muy servicial sus clientes la prefieren porque siempre los recibe con una sonrisa en el rostro y en su tienda encuentran lo que necesitan a un bien precio; esto la ha motivado a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita abastecer con mas mercadería su tienda con productos como bebidas, sopas instantáneas, embutidos, golosinas entre otros. Y así no decepcionar a su clientela. Además esta es la forma en la que Berta lleva el sustento a su hogar y tiene esperanza que le permitirá darle a su familia una vida más digna.
texts.en:
