Berta Alicia M. is 64 years old.  She lives with her life partner and two children in her own home, in San Salvador department.

Berta owns a store where she sells essentials.  Her store is located in her home.  It is very busy and she has a lot of customers who visit every day.  Berta is an honest and responsible woman who is also very helpful.  Her customers prefer to buy from her because she always greets them with a smile on her face and they find what they need in her store, at a good price.  For this reason, Berta is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to stock her store with more merchandise such as drinks, instant soups, cold meats, candies, etc. so that she does not disappoint her customers.  This is how Berta supports her household and she hopes that it will allow her to provide her family with a more decent life.

loans.use: to buy drinks, instant soups, cold meats and candies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for making meals

loans.name: Alexi Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Alexi ella tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 23, 22 y 20 años, dos de ellos viven con ella y estudian en universidad. El marido es chofer.

Ella tiene una tienda en su casa, allí vende productos de primera necesidad, artículos de bazar, ropa, zapatos, bisutería y ciertos medicamentos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 con la ayuda de su esposo cuando él puede. La mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Portoviejo y otros de los productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes,  artículos de bazar, ropa y zapatos. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal hace dos años y le gusta  la unión que hay en el grupo.
 
Sus sueños son tener una casa más grande, mejor construida y que su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Nueva Generación community bank meet in Crucita parish, in Portoviejo canton, in a place called Los Arenales.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches, for its rich cuisine and for the warmth of its people.

Here we meet 40 year-old Alexi who is married and has three children aged 23, 22 and 20.  Two of her children live with her and are studying at university.  Her husband is a driver.

Alexi has a store in her home where she sells essentials, miscellaneous items, clothes, shoes, costume jewelry and certain medicines.  She works every day, from 6.00am to 8.00pm, with her husband's help whenever he is able.  She buys some of her merchandise in the city of Portoviejo and the rest is delivered direct to her store.

Alexi will use this loan to stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents, miscellaneous products, clothes and shoes.  She has been a member of her community bank for two years and she likes the unity that exists within the group.

Alexi's dreams are to own a bigger, better-constructed house and for her business to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents, miscellaneous products, clothes and shoes

loans.name: Rosa Yanira

texts.es: Rosa Yanira V. D. L. D. treinta y cinco años D. edad vive con su esposo e hijos en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella posee un negocio cerca D. su domicilio donD. venD. diferentes tipos D. fruta como melon, sandias, platanos, mangos, entre otros; últimamente ha tenido más clientes que la visitan pues su fruta fresca y sus buenos precios la caracterizan en el lugar, ésto la ha motivado para hacer crecer su negocio y se decidió a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más mercadería como plátanos, maracuyá, manzanas entre otros. Rosa es una mujer emprendedora dispuesta a trabajar duro para sacar adelante a su familia y tiene confianza que D. esta forma lograra darles una buena calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Rosa Yanira V. D. L. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and children in San Salvador department.  She owns a business near her home where she sells different types of fruit including melons, watermelons, bananas and mangos.  Recently Rosa has had more customers visiting her business since she is noted for her fresh fruit and her good prices.  This has motivated her to grow her business and she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy more merchandise such as bananas, passion fruit and apples.  Rosa is an enterprising woman who is prepared to work hard to get her family ahead in life.  She is confident that she will be able to proviD. her family with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bananas, passion fruit and apples

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia, de 34 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia morada junto a su esposo Benjamín de 37 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor porvenir. Las chacras de Claudia son las mejores y las tiene bien cuidadas, todos los días  es la primera en levantarse de la cama, prepara el alimento de sus hijos y enviarlos luego al colegio, mientras su esposo va preparando las herramientas que utilizará durante el transcurso del día; Claudia cultiva plantas de café, cacao y plantaciones de barbasco, productos que posteriormente lleva a comercializarlos a los centros de acopio situados en las ciudades de San Francisco y Kimbiri. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para pasear por los verdes campos de su poblado, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos quienes se encargan de dañar  los capullos de las plantas. Por lo cual ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insecticidas para luego realizar la fumigación respectiva y así combatir las plagas que aquejan sus cultivos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si quiere acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal es un socia, muy alegre y cooperadora. Con los 3,000 mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará insecticidas para combatir las plagas que dañan sus cultivos.
texts.en:
34-year old Claudia is a simple, hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her 37-year old husband Benjamín and their three beloved children for whom she wishes to provide a better future. Her fields are of good quality and well cared for. Every day she is the first person to get up, prepare food for her children, and get them off to school. Her husband, in the meantime, is getting ready the tools needed for the day’s work.

Claudia grows coffee, cocoa, and barbasco (a native Peruvian plant) which she later sells in the warehouses of the towns of San Francisco and Kimbiri. She enjoys the freedom of spending her days in the green countryside around her home and has been farming for fifteen years. The hardest part of her job is keeping insects away from the fresh growth on crops. For this reason Claudia is asking for a loan to buy insecticide to spray on the plants and keep the bugs at bay. In the future she would like to buy more land and increase production of her crops. 

This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She knows that she has to pay back the money punctually if she wishes to get another loan one day. Claudia is a lively and cooperative member of her community bank. With the 3,000 soles she has requested, she will buy insecticide to kill the bugs that harm her crops.

loans.use: to buy insecticide

loans.name: Sandra Adriana

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos la señora Sandra, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de  19,  17, 15 y 11 años, uno es mayor  de edad y estudia en Universidad y los menores en colegio y escuela. El marido de dedica a la pesca.

Ella además de atender su hogar también tiene un local en el cual ofrece el servicio de internet (cibercafé), allí vende jugos naturales, sodas, golosinas y bocadillos de picar a sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio, nos cuenta que lleva 7 años dedicada a esta actividad y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, sodas, aguas, golosinas y bocadillos. Ella lleva en el Banco Comunal cinco años y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a mejorar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Los Arenales is located in the parish of Crucita in the canton of Portoviejo. Every two weeks the members of the Nueva Generación (New Generation) Community Bank meet there. It is a place known for its beautiful beaches, its food, and the warmth of its people.

34-year old Sra. Sandra is a member of the bank. She lives with her partner and their four children aged 19, 17, 15, and 11. The eldest attends university and the younger ones go to college or school. Sandra’s husband is a fisherman.

As well as looking after the household, she runs an Internet cafe (cybercafe) where she sells natural juices, soft drinks, candy, and snacks to her customers. She works there every day from 8am to 8pm. Her children also help with the business. She’s been doing this work for seven years and it is going well.

This loan will be used to buy fruit, soft drinks, water, candy and snacks. Sandra has been a member of the bank for five years and enjoys having access to loans which have helped her improve her business. Her dream is to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy fruit, soft drinks, water, candy and snacks

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es: José Alfredo A. S. de 37 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida Rosa y su pequeño hijo en Tacachico en el departamento de La Libertad. El posee un negocio de joyería en oro, plata y fantasia, ofrece diferentes estilos de cadenas, relojes, pulseras para damas y caballeros, ya tiene mucha clientela pues su carisma y buen servicio atrae a las personas del lugar, José esta orgulloso de su trabajo, pues con el lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar, quiere que su negocio prospere y se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le dé la oportunidad de comprar mayor cantidad de anillos, cadenas, pulseras, entre otros y así tener a la disposición de sus clientes lo que necesiten. Tiene fe que esta fuente de ingreso le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Alfredo A. S. is 37 years old.  He lives with his life partner Rosa and his young son in Tacachico, in La Libertad department.  José has a business selling gold and silver jewelry and also costume jewelry.  He offers different styles of chains, watches, and bracelets for men and women.  José has a lot of customers because his charisma and good customer service attract people to his business.  He is proud of his work since it supports his household.  

José would like his business to prosper and so he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL which would give him the opportunity to buy a larger quantity of rings, chains and bracelets in order to have available the products that his customers need.  He believes that this source of income will allow him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rings, chains and bracelets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO CHANGE HIS VEHICLE'S SEATS AND MAKE OTHER REPAIRS

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ida B., tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos que son mayores de edad, soleros y que aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de mariscos. Está en el en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio y le gusta porque en las reuniones se entretiene y aprende de las charlas educativas que imparte el asesor de crédito.

Tiene un local en su casa en el cual se dedica a la venta de mariscos, nos cuenta que en su negocio los clientes encuentran de todo ya que ella les ofrece: camarón, langostinos, cangrejos, pescado en muchas variedades, conchas, etc. Ella ofrece productos de muy buena calidad ya que esta es su garantía y es por esto que sus clientes la prefieren. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 14h00, nos cuenta que tiene su negocio ya por 20 años y que en las temporadas playeras es cuando más vende.

Este crédito es para comprar toda clase de mariscos como pescado, camarón, conchas, cangrejos, langostinos, etc. para darles a sus clientes lo mejor.
 
Su sueño es tener  casa propia ya  que vive en una casita  de sus padres.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Nueva Generación community bank meet in Crucita parish, in Portoviejo canton, in a place called Los Arenales.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches, its rich cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Here we meet 48 year-old Ida B. who is married and has two grown-up children.  Her children are single and still live with her.  Her husband sells seafood.  Ida has been a member of her community bank since it was founded and she likes it because she has fun at the meetings and learns from the educational talks given by her loan advisor.

Ida sells seafood from premises in her home.  She tells us that her customers find everything they need in her business since she offers them shrimp, prawns, crab, a wide variety of fish, shellfish, etc.  Ida sells very good quality products and this is her guarantee.  This is why her customers like to buy from her.  Ida works every day, from 7.00am to 2.00pm.  She tells us that she has had her business for 20 years and she makes most sales during the beach seasons.

Ida will use this loan to buy all kinds of seafood such as fish, shrimp, shellfish, crab, prawns, etc, so that she can provide her customers with the best.

Ida's dream is to own her own home as she currently lives in her parents' home.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, shellfish, crabs, prawns, etc.

loans.name: Rosario Elizabeth

texts.es: La Señora Rosario tiene 30 años de edad  es madre soltera tiene un Hijo menor de 3 años de edad Vive en casa familiar en La Tinguiña .Tiene una Bodega en la Casa de sus tíos donde ella actualmente vive con su menor hijo .con el dinero realizara la compra de  Abarrotes como Arroz Fideo Leche,etc para incrementar su negocio rosario como toda joven tiene metas y sueños tiene todas la ganas de superarse y salir adelante junto con sus padres y con su hijo
texts.en:
Rosario is 30 years old and a single mother with a 3-year old son. She lives in a family home in La Tinguiña. Rosario has a general store in her aunt and uncle's home, where she actually lives with her minor son. 

With the money from this loan, she will buy groceries, including rice, beans, milk, etc., in order to increase her business. Rosario, like all young people, has goals and dreams. She has much desire to  advance herself and get ahead, together with her parents and her son.

loans.use: TO BUY GROCERIES, INCLUDING RICE, BEANS, MILK, ETC., TO SELL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's lodging while they attend school away from home.

loans.name: Guerreros

texts.es: El Sr. Guerreros es una persona que además de su trabajo, atiende junto a su esposa un puesto de hamburguesas y tacos que tienen en su domicilio particular  y  de  esta  manera pueden ayudarse  económicamente  ya que dependen de ellos dos hijos los cuales  son  lo  mas  importante  en su  vida ,  el  sueño de la  familia  es   adquirir  una  casita  propia  por  tal motivo ellos  trabajan mucho  en  su negocio el  cual abren los fines  de  semana, en esa  ocasión requiere  su crédito  para ampliar   el  menú de  platillos   que  ofrecen, ven   en este  una   oportunidad  de  ampliar  su negocio obteniendo  un mayor   numero  de  ingresos  además  de  la  posibilidad  de   hacer  su  sueño realidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Guerreros is a person who, besides his job, runs a hamburger, hot dog and taco stand at home with his wife.  This way they can help themselves economically because they have two dependent children who are the most important things in their lives.  The family’s dream is to acquire a small house of their own and this is why they work so hard at their business which they operate on weekends.

He needs a loan on this occasion to expand the menu of dishes he has on offer.  He wants to enlarge the business to earn more income and have the possibility of making his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a car port.

loans.name: Triy

texts.en:
Triy H., age 23, and her husband, Sokpheurng, age 25, are local farmers who live in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband help each other to grow rice and vegetables on their existing farmland, and they earn a profit of around 2.5 each day to help support the family expenses. Growing crops is an annual action with which they have had great success. This couple has one small child.

Triy H. would like to ask for a loan to buy a piece of farmland from her next-door neighbor. With this loan, she will enlarge her rice crop in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a piece of farmland in order to enlarge her rice crop

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertudes works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Gertudes requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods and noodles for her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for two years now, and she also earns additional income from E-loading.

In the future, Gertudes would like to renovate her home and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen N. earns a living by selling a few fresh fish in her village, Kompong Tom province. She has been involved in this career since 2000, making a profit of approximately $1.20 a day. She has a life partner in her husband who is a rice farmer as well as a fisherman, and he can earn about $2 in profit per day to share responsibility with Pen N. in covering the expenses of the family. They are blessed with four children, two of whom are single and working, while the other two are married and live in their own houses. 

Most of the family income depends on Pen's daughter’s job. She is a sewing worker who always goes to her workplace by hiring a taxi or walking, and it is a problem for her. To deal with this, Pen N. has decided to apply for a loan to buy a used motorbike which will be used by her daughter to ride to her job location.

loans.use: to buy her daughter a used motorbike to ride to her workplace

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 40 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by hog raising in the Philippines. Tita is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy some piglets and hog feed.

Tita has been   in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to  repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy some piglets and feed.

loans.name: Julio Herasmo

texts.es: El señor Julio tiene 55 años es casado, su esposa trabaja en el campo de manera independiente,tienen 2 hijos de 22 y 15 años ambos están en edad escolar, es maestro constructor, inicio esta actividad de la mano de su padre quien le enseño desde que el era muy joven, luego se independizo y empezó a realizar sus trabajos solo haciéndose conocido por la zona, tiene mas de 20 años trabajando y genera unos ingresos de s/500 semanales los desafíos que enfrenta es el no disponer de tiempo suficiente  para estar con sus hijos y poder cuidarlos, atenderlos y no poder apoyarlos en sus estudios superiores, su sueño en el futuro es poder comprar una unidad de transporte(camioneta) para el traslado de sus implementos de trabajo y poder ahorrar en el pago de transporte, el dinero lo invertirá en comprar  maderas que necesita para mejorar la calidad de su trabajo para brindar un mejor servicios a sus clientes y así ahorrar en alquileres de estas maderas, parte del dinero lo invertirá en algunas mejoras en su vivienda .
texts.en:
Julio, 55, is married;  his wife works as an independent field laborer.  They have two children who are 22 and 15; both are still school age.   He is a Master Builder.  He started this occupation hand in hand with his father who taught him when he was still very young.  Later he became independent and started doing his jobs by himself becoming well known in the area.  He’s been working for over 20 years and he earns about 500 soles per week.  

The challenges he faces are not having enough time to spend with his children, to care for and watch over them, and not being able to support their higher education.  His dream for the future is to buy a pick-up truck to transport his work tools and save transportation costs.  He will use the money to buy lumber he needs to improve the quality of his work and provide better customer service thus saving on rental costs of the wood.  Part of the money will be used to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy lumber and other tools.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S. O. is a 41-year-old married woman who earns a daily profit by working as a high schoO. teacher in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She has over ten years of experience in this sector and earns a formal salary every month. In order to help cover the family expenses, her husband works as a foreman of construction workers in the mobile place, where he gets a daily income averaging $5.20 per day. 

Sok S. O. will use her loan to buy a plot of land which is near her house so that she can grow a rice crop or enlarge her house. With the rest of the loan, she will buy construction tools to assist her husband's business. Sok S. O. has only one child who is still studying.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to grow crops or enlarge her house

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela works hard to support two children. She is married and has a Ready-To-Wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Estela requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to avoid future lung diseases resulting from continued toxic smoke inhalation.

Estela is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit cookstove.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vor

texts.en: Vor H., age 60, is a boat repairer and a cashew seller in and around her community, Kompong Tom province. She and her husband always work together in the same business.  They can generate a combined income of around $12.50 each day to use for their family.  The couple tries their best to earn money in order to feed their four kids until they are old enough to get a proper job. In order to make extra income, Vor H. would like to request a loan to buy cashews to stock her store, while prices are low, for future sales.

loans.use: to stock up on cashews, while prices are low, for future sales.

loans.name: Turbold

texts.en:
Turbold is 34 years old and lives with his wife and a son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  They  live together in a rented one-bedroom studio apartment. His family used to live in France for seven years and he worked in a scrap yard over there and has gained a lot of experience over the years. Therefore he started his own spare parts retail business last year. He is renting a stall at the “Mison”, the auto center in Ulaanbaatar city. 

Turbold purchased a small family car using his earnings. Turbold is a very hard-working and honest person who cares a lot about his family. His business is doing very well and he has his regular customers. He buys old cars and takes their spare parts out and sells them. Now it is the start of the warm season when the spare parts business gets busy, therefore he is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying an old car and some spare parts.

loans.use: to buy some spare parts and an old car.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey S., age 29, has been earning a living as a pig breeder for more than ten years in Kompong Tom province. From this business, she has the ability to support all her family needs and especially she can send her kids to school. Her husband is a fisherman and grows vegetables for extra earnings on a piece of land next to his house. They are blessed with one child who relies on their income. 

Mey S. is asking for a loan to buy additional feed and piglets for breeding. She hopes to use the remaining cash to purchase spare parts in order to replace a part of their plowing machine which broke.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Ork

texts.en:
Ork S. is married to a fisherman. They have seven children; five are married and live away from home and the other two are single; one works as a seamstress and the other, a fisherman.

Ork is skilled in weaving palm leaves by hand and has done so since she was a small girl. She has turned leaves into furniture and roofing material to sell from her home for years.

In addition to weaving, Ork annually plants rice. Dry weather is coming now, and it may affect Ork’s business. She faces a difficult season if she can’t irrigate her crops. Ork is taking out her first loan to purchase a pump to water her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to water her crops

loans.name: Winda

texts.en:
Winda is 33 years old and is married with 1 child.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 24,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stock such as canned goods and noodles.

Winda has previously borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Winda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for a sari-sari store

loans.name: Oum

texts.en:
Oum P. has been making and selling traditional Cambodian bamboo baskets with her husband in the province of Kompong Tom. She started the business many years ago after having learned the craft from her parents.  She has a regular customer base plus casual buyers in the market.

Her business is going better and better from day to day, but with a family of eight children, Oum P. is seeking a loan to purchase two buffaloes for breeding and feeding purposes.

loans.use: to purchase two buffaloes for breeding and feeding purposes.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 48 years old and is married with 4 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 10 years and earns additional income from a sari-sari store (convenience store).

Adelina has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy hog feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for pigs

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa works hard to support 3 children. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Josefa has requested a loan of 1,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy an Envirofit Cookstove. She is interested in the Envirofit Cookstove because she wants to reduce the amount of firewood she uses when cooking food for her family.

Josefa is aware that by using the Envirofit Cookstove, she will not only save money but also help the environment and reduce health risks and other hazards to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit Cookstove

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo K. is a 37-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer since she was single. In addition, she currently sells fresh fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier and other local fishermen. She runs her business in the market and is earning approximately $2 a day. 

Her husband is a primary teacher. The humble couple has three children who are attending school. 

Keo K. says that she wants to buy a second-hand motorcycle in order to pick up her fresh fish to sell, but her cash on hand is insufficient to buy one. So Keo K. would like to ask for a loan from Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle for picking up her fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for picking up her fish to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 65 years old. She is a married woman from the town of Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for more than 30 years. She and her husband, who is also a farmer, work together in tilling the land and keeping their crops healthy.

Erlinda asked for a loan so she could purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs that she needs. She hopes for her farming business to grow. Erlinda works hard to feed her family and keep them healthy.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
The two persons in the picture are Som P., 44, and her husband, Roum Oeurn, age 48. Som P. could earns a living as a breeder of pigs at the pigpen behind her house. Aside from this, she also helps her husband to sell firewood in and around Kompong Tom province. The couple has five children, four of whom are in school. One of them is employed as a security guard in a private company. 

Som P. is seeking a loan to buy a second motorbike for her son to ride to his work place. That can reduce the traveling costs for her employed son.

loans.use: to buy a second motorbike for her son to ride to his work place.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en: 28-year-old Fidel farms for a living. He tills his own land in the town of Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. He has been growing rice for six years and sells his harvest to his community. Fidel works hard so he can send his two children to school. Fidel is also a married man. He hopes for his business to grow, which would give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a farmer from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She is 58 years old and married. Norma has been growing rice for more than 30 years. She earns her living by selling her harvest to the market. Norma has children who are still in school. She works hard to sustain their education and provide them better futures.

Norma's loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She hopes for this loan to help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to mend his broken wall and decorate a few old parts of his house.

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla is a married woman living in the town of Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for more than 30 years. Prescilla sells her harvest to rice traders. She works hard to provide her family with better living conditions. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

Prescilla's loan will be used to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 52-year-old married woman from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She has six children, the oldest of whom is 31 years old.

Zenaida is a farmer and primarily grows rice. She has been tilling her land for nine years. Aside from farming, she also raises pigs and manages her own sari-sari store. Zenaida works hard to improve her family's living conditions. She also wants to be able to continue her children's education.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She hopes for this loan to help increase her yield and profit.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas K. is a 43-year-old farmer and mother. She is blessed with four kids. Three of the children are attending the public high school and the other child is married. Meas K.'s husband, Prak Thorn, is 40 and works in the farming business. Meas K. inherited farmland from her grandmother. She and her husband grow different kinds of crops on this land. Besides a rice-planting business, they also grow mold on the straw behind their house for additional income. Previously they used a plowing machine to support them in the farming business. Unfortunately, the machine broke down often during the plowing process. Because of this problem, Meas K. would like a loan to purchase a new plowing machine in order to replace the broken one.

loans.use: to purchase a new plowing machine in order to replace a broken one.

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en:
Gigi is 40 years old and is married with 4 children.  With 3 children in school, Gigi works very hard to provide for them.

Gigi runs a rice-retailing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 11 years and has requested a loan of 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more sacks of rice.

In the future, Gigi would like to expand her business to secure her family's future and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for sale

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: T. Nguyễn

loans.use: To purchase additional materials to expand his product offerings

loans.name: Loh

texts.en: Loh K. is a forty-nine-year-old clothing vendor residing in the Reussey Keo commune. He currently sells clothing for both men and women in the marketplace. He is single man who now lives with his niece who works in the factory. Loh K. never wastes time as he works to earn the money to support his ageing parents. He has managed his investment carefully and has attracted a large number of clients due to his communication skills. In order to better meet his customers' demands, he would like a $500 loan to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Lê

texts.en:
H. Lê D., age 28, lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. To make a living, H. operates a furniture making business. He makes and sells general household furniture to local businesses and community members. H. has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3.200.000 VND a month. He and his wife have two small children. 

In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services. He wished to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid his most recent previous loan of 8.288.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand his product offerings.  

H. is now requesting a new loan of 9.184.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and employed as working capital.  The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by this borrower from SEDA. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.
  
About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in the rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

-----------------------

H. Lê D. (20209020012) là 28 tuổi nam.  Anh ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Anh ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi nhỏ.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.184.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and employ as working capital

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung C., age 37, is the devoted mother of five children. She operates a recycling business, buying and selling used goods. She goes around her community buying many kinds of old things such bottles, cans, plastic products, and electronic wires, and sells these to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. 

She is generating an income of approximately $3.50 per day to help support her family. The other source of family income is her husband’s taxi service. 

Soung C. is going to use her loan to repair the family home, an old house that needs essential repairs.

loans.use: to repair the family home, an old house that needs essential repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for daughter to commute to her work location

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
"H. Nguyễn Thị (20209040036) is a 35 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To making a living, H. works in someone else's business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing construction services to local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2.600.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND which will be used to invest in constructional material to meet the demand of customers.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to supplement the family's income.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Nguyễn Thị (20209040036) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 1 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Làm việc cho một người khác.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ xây dựng cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2.600.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  phụ thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest  in  buying constructional material

loans.name: Chu

texts.en:
L. Chu Thị, age 47, lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. To make a living, L. raises livestock, specifically cattle, to offer for sale. L. has been engaged in this business for over 18 years and earns approximately 2.800.000 VND a month from these activities. She and her husband have one school-aged child.  
  
In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 8.288.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. L. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business.
 
About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in the rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

-----------------------

L. Chu Thị (20209040012) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 1 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, L. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 18 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 2.800.000 VND một tháng.
 
Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  L. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.
 
Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim L., age 43, is a resident of the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh city, where she earns a living by cultivating rice and vegetable crops on land she owns. Her husband provides irrigation services from the water system to local farmers who wish to pump water into their farm fields. The couple has three school-aged children, one of whom is married. Two are employed in a local factory. 

Chim L. will use this loan to purchase a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee. Thus, this loan will provide her with an additional new asset.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of her neighbor’s farmland that she will rent out to farmers for a fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with two children. She is 33 years old and has had a sari-sari store business for eight years.

Nancy sells items like oil, vinegar and noodles. She also sells vegetables. Nancy is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and noodles.

In the future, she hopes to start another business. She also wishes for her children to finish school and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 57-year-old farmer who is originally from Semarang, Central Java, which is another province in Indonesia. Esther is married to Hengky who is 63 years old.  They are blessed with five children: Romy, 37 years old, Ray, 35 years old, Roy, 32 years old, Rio, 30 years old; and Rini, 22 years old. All of her sons are married; Rini just graduated from the University.

Esther has been running a piglet breeding business for eight months. She commenced her business by purchasing two piglets to raise and breed. Now she has two pigs and nine piglets. She used to have 11 piglets but due to disease, she lost two piglets. Losing two piglets cannot prevent Esther from running this business. Esther plans to buy more piglets to fatten. She can sell them when they reach a standard weight. Esther likes the piglet breeding business because it can generate a good profit for her and her family as well.

Esther is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM to purchase four piglets and fodder. Esther really hopes that TLM is willing to assist her in improving her business. She believes the loan will motivate her to go forward.

In order to reduce the cost of traveling, Kom H. has decided to ask for a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle for her son to commute to work.

She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately $38 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Divina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to add capital to her business. 

Divina is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials for nipa production. This will be her 7th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for nipa production

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn, age 37, owns and operates a sar-sari (general store) business. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as biscuits and canned goods. She and her husband have two children, both in school. Roselyn works very hard to provide for them.

Roselyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

In the future, Roselyn would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family .

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Teddy has a clinic, which she has had for 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more medicine for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Teddy hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food.  In the future, Teddy hopes to open up another clinic.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for resale.
